Reviews.Title: “Spring trip to Venice”
Reviews.Author: TravelerUnitedStates
Reviews.Content: Hotel is very nice and clean. Breakfast was great, staff very helpful. Internet free in the lobby. Hotel was convenient to train station. Would go back agian.

Reviews.Title: “Very nice and non-expensive Hotel”
Reviews.Author: uberpomar
Reviews.Content: I booked this Hotel in the very last minute and I was pretty happy with the price and the quality of the Hotel. Staff are really nice and helpful and the place looks really nice, even fancy. The location may be a pro or a con depending upon the point of view; it isjust crossing the canal from the train and bus stations but it is far from downtown, anyhow, Venice is small and everything is at a walking distance. I highly recommend this Hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel”
Reviews.Author: Joanne B
Reviews.Content: Nice location, good breakfast, beautiful lobby and bar area, nice decor and clean. Globus Tour

Reviews.Title: “Convenient, good service, but dating.”
Reviews.Author: Zalton101
Reviews.Content: First impressions were good. The entry and reception area is clean and bright and the staff professional and polite. The location is good for travel. It's a short walk across one bridge to the train station and a slightly longer walk to Piazza del Roma via another bridge where the coaches and car parks are to be found. For those who enjoy walking, such as ourselves, its an easy walk from the hotel to the main attractions of Venice, However, if time is of the essence or you are not one who favors exploring by foot there are other hotels closer to Piazza St Marco, although without the proximity to mainland transport. The breakfast which was included in our booking was taken in the Hotel's restaurante. The breakfast was better than most hotels offer although was no where near as extensive as those offered in Dubai or Thai hotels we have experienced. The room, while comfortable, was far smaller than we expected and the bathroom presented it's challenges - yes it was small and the shower was not easy for a tall western frame to manage, The rooms were also showing their age and the need for refurbishment showed. The rooms were nevertheless clean. The staff were extremely helpful with all our requests and nothign seemed too much trouble for them,. So full marks here. On the down side, as with most if not all hotels on the island(s) of Venice, the hotel is not value for money. But from discussions with others in Venice at the time and a healthy dose of internet trolling it lines up with its competition. If you really need to save the dollars, there are lower cost and comfortable hotels on the mainland a short buss ride from Venice, but of course you don't get the canal location and the convenience.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect”
Reviews.Author: JayneA3
Reviews.Content: This hotel is perfectly situated just 5 minutes walk from the Piazzale de Roma where the coaches from Marco Polo Airport drop you off. It is beside the Grand Canal opposite the Santa Lucia railway station and the Scalzi Bridge. The hotel staff are very helpful and friendly . Our room was small but had everything you need for a short city break. The beds were comfortable and the bathroom was excellent. The breakfast was very good with traditional continental style with hot bacon and scrambled eggs as well.Plenty of hot coffee and a choice of teas. Although free Wifi is inly available in the public lounges and outside the hotel in their own seating area , we didn't find this a problem. We enjoyed our stay and would stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Not really a 4 stars”
Reviews.Author: Duonoro
Reviews.Content: My rating takes into account the balance between cost and quality. In my opinion, what you see in their web site is misleading: rooms are much poorer and the bathroom is very little (in comparison with the room type) and old. The location is great (just in front of the railway station), the staff is very kind, but you clearly perceive that everything is intended to save money: you must pay for the broadband in the room (12 euros per day), you must pay if you want a decent breakfast (for example: the fruit salad is in syrup, if you want the fresh one you must pay; the same if you want a juice made of real oranges, and so on; I don't want to speak of the coffees, the worst coffee I've ever drunk in Italy, and I'm Italian ...), and in comparison with the cost of (better) restaurants in Venice the price of the restaurant is huge. Moreover, they sent me an e-mail inviting me to leave this review, and in the same e-mail they offered me a "10% special reduction on the Bed & Breakfast rate of your next stay; free upgrade to a room of a superior category" ... maybe there is no connection between the two facts, but it left me with the sense that it wasn't completely correct. I think one should seriously think on the criteria used to assign hotel stars in Italy ...

Reviews.Title: “Brilliant service and staff”
Reviews.Author: vcs049
Reviews.Content: I have just stayed for eight nights at the Carlton on the Grand Canal and once again everything was perfect. The staff could not do enough to help my husband and I, our usual room was spacious and always spotless. Breakfast was superb with special requests being met immediately. This was my third stay and irrespective of whether I stay with my sister when I am on business trips (close to the railway station) or when I am on holidays with my husband, I will always stay at this property, I only wish I had discovered this hotel years ago when I first started to visit Venice.

Reviews.Title: “Nice stay”
Reviews.Author: Craig H
Reviews.Content: Being able to arrive by boat transfer directly to the hotel was fantastic. On arrival we greeted with a warm and informative checkin. We were roomed by a pleasant porter who was helpful. The room was very typical old world Venetian and met our expectations, I must say the room was clean and housekeeping were very helpful, which included extra pillows without asking. Unfortunately we had two single beds pushed together so make sure you seek clarification on your bed type at checkin. The hotel is basically on the wrong side of the town with San Marco being a 40 minute walk and Rialto bridge being about a 30 minute walk. But in fairness it did ensure we saw a lot more of Venice off the beaten track. The railway station and bus station are less than a five minute walk from the hotel. There are great small shops and eateries within walking distance.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect location and beautiful hotel”
Reviews.Author: Mitch59
Reviews.Content: My wife and I chose this hotel for it's location and we were not disappointed. We wanted to visit Venice for some time and when I found this hotel we booked it. The hotel is situated opposite the railway station (separated by the grand canal) and a short walk from the bus station at Plaza le Roma. Easy to find and remember, if you choose a hotel not on the grand canal, you face a long walk as we witnessed many people doing (there's no other way to get to your hotel once dropped off by the bus/water bus or water taxi). On arrival at Marco Polo Airport, walk outside and you can take the bus directly to Venice at a cost of 5 Euro (9 Euro return). Alternatively, we booked a water taxi in advance which sped us directly to the small pier at the hotel, well worth the cost. The breakfast at the hotel is buffet style with bacon and scrabbled eggs, fruit salad (tinned but enjoyable), fresh fruit, bread, cheese, ham, yoghurts, selection of jam, coffee and breakfast tea. We always found something to eat and never had any problems, We chose a room overlooking the Grand Canal (well worth the extra cost). The room was beautiful and finished in a typical Venetian style. Although small, it's only to be expected as the building is very old, but it was all we needed, lived up to our expectations, was as described by the hotel and was always kept clean. Some people have reported the noise level as you're at the front of the hotel, but when you realise that everything (including people) is transported via the Grand Canal, it's only to be expected. The view from the room also enabled much people watching and we never had a noise issue. We did find our room to be too warm, but through open the windows and invited Venice to join us, MARVELOUS. Staff were on the whole very good although when busy, reception staff tended to focus on their work rather than waiting customers. On returning to the hotel after a day exploring, we often sat outside the Restaurant at a small table enjoying a coffee (which was only 3.50 Euro). The waiter at the bar who served us coffee was a credit to the hotel, always had time to sped with us and was always willing to please and provide exceptional service. The best way to explore Venice is on foot and this hotel is in a perfect location. Overall, would we go back to Venice . . DEFINITELY, would we use this hotel again . . MOST DEFINATELY and would we recommend this hotel . . ABSOLUTELY.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect for Venice”
Reviews.Author: Mike151261
Reviews.Content: Nothing to complain about. The hotel is situated on the main canal, not very far from all inbound drop off points. Staff are lovely and friendly. Room was very nice and decorated as you would hope a hotel room in venice would be. Lovely lobby area with wi-fi. Food and drinks are a bit expensive and rooms overlooking canal can be a bit noisy due to traffic. Location is a bit away from most tourist atttactions but this is a good thing. Means you have to walk through some less busy areas to get to them which are delightful.

Reviews.Title: “Great location close to the train station”
Reviews.Author: Webber_naomi
Reviews.Content: Beautifully decorated room with lots of character. Initially the location I was concerned about as it was the first property you looked at across from the station but given how hard it is to navigate Venice it was a blessing with suitcases in tow. The breakfast was great but a little crowded and service was helpful.

Reviews.Title: “Staff the best”
Reviews.Author: silk1
Reviews.Content: Near train, bus station was allowed to check in at 10 room small but nice clean. Was my birthday staff bought to our room a birthday cake 8/10 Breakfast was NOT worth getting out of bed 2/10 To get around it handy river buses are bet way to move around

Reviews.Title: “a most equisite hotel opposite the railway station”
Reviews.Author: donalddaniels
Reviews.Content: as you emerge from the St Lucia station there is the hotel beckoning 20 metres away.... alas, across the Grande Canal. Never fear, there is an enormous arched bridge with lots of steps, and some young men hanging around who are happy to carry your heavy suitcase for 5 euro. Rooms are nice with lots of Venetian style furniture, and lovely views if you are in the front - you MUST be in the front!! Breakfasts are good and plentiful and staff most friendly. The only brickbat is the fact that free wifi can only be obtained on the ground floor. I will return!

Reviews.Title: “Good location and nice hotel”
Reviews.Author: Scankguy
Reviews.Content: Very easy to find from the airport coach stop, ideally located across the canal from the station and water buses. Very comfortable and friendly. Enjoyed the breakfast. Our room only had a view of the rooftops and church dome nearby but this was still nice. Only critism of the hotel was the bath, which was very small and designed with a higher part to be sat in, which for a shower made it difficult to use. Hotel has free internet in the lounge but needs paying for in the rooms. Heating was very effective which was good after a cold day on the canals.

Reviews.AuthorLocation: New York City, New York, USA
Reviews.Title: “On the Canal”
Reviews.Author: EmilyNYC_5
Reviews.Content: Hotel is located at a great location, it is a great short walk from the train station where we arrived, you just have to cross the bridge and the public water taxi stop is right by the train station. We booked the canal view room and it was great to look right and left from our balcony. I knew we would be close to the train station and that's why we booked it but I didn't realize that we would be staring directly at it the train station as well. Although minor, just thought I mention it so that others are not disappointed upon their arrival, the feeling on the canal is still wonderful. Room looked nice but was very small but definitely felt like a 4star interior unlike the bathroom which was rather large in size but looked like a 2star hotel bathroom which was disappointing. The breakfast was good and we enjoyed our 3night stay at this hotel. My main issue with the service of this hotel are the unknowledgeable front desk employees which gave us incorrect information about transportation and other touristy stuff on multiple occasions. I guess they just don't know. If you ask them, I would ask again at the tourist info booth located by the train station just to make sure.

Reviews.Title: “Very nice place to stay in Venice”
Reviews.Author: Chrysophylax_jp
Reviews.Content: The hotel is very closed to the main train station (few steps) and quite close to Treviso airport, which is very convenient. The boat stop is pretty close, too, if you want to travel on boat, but three days travel card is quite expensive and you won't probably use it. Rooms look better on official photos, but still are very nice. The problem is that they'll give you only one key. We had a half board, because we took our lunch in town. Breakfast is a large buffet and we really loved scrambled eggs and bacon. If you like coffee, never order it to your breakfast, it is a disaster. Dinners were always lovely and while I don't eat fish and seafood, there was always another option like beef or pork or chicken.

Reviews.Title: “Absolutely great”
Reviews.Author: strumph
Reviews.Content: An excellent location offering a very good starting point to discover Venice on foot/ by vaporetto. The hotel is 5â€™ walking distance from Piazzale Roma, on the right side and facing Grand Canal. We booked a twin beds room (352) which was good in size, nicely decorated in Venetian style damask tapestry, with Murano glass chandelier. Even though the room looks out onto Veniceâ€™s narrow street we were very pleased with the comfort offered. After all Venice is to be explored, not to stay in the room and admiring Grand Canal from the window .In the room you can find a plasma screen satellite TV (21 TV channels, pay TV and 3 radio stations), internet connection ,a safety box., self-regulated air conditioning A mini bar is also available. The bathroom also is large; there are accessories and hair- dryer. There is a great service of cleaning and maintenance (we had a little problem with the heater into the bathroom, immediately fixed up). The breakfast was delicious: cold and hot dishes, fruits, refreshments, sweets. The service for the restaurant is also great; they pay attention to everything that makes the tourist feeling good. For dinner there is the possibility to choose between a la carte menu with typical and international specialties and a fixed menu for 25 EUR /person which is a very good price for what it is offered. Add to this the pleasant and romantic atmosphere and the personnel's courtesy at La Cupola restaurant. The porter was very polite and helpful with our luggage (no charge for doing this). Our special thanks go to reception team. They are so kind, polite, gentle and helpful. We definitely come back to this hotel and we strongly recommend it!

Reviews.Title: “BEAUTIFUL VENICE”
Reviews.Author: Leicestershirefairy
Reviews.Content: Stayed at The Carlton on the Grand Canal Hotel.Went for three days, managed to visit alot of sights in that time.The hotel is beautifully and lavishly furnished. The staff are very helpful in every thing that i asked about.The food is first class.The hotel is situated in an exellent area ,easy to reach all interesting sights..easy to reach from the airport as well. We had room 308 on the third floor ,two big windows over looking the canal. The decor was very rich and plush with silk walls and a vast glass murano chandelier, it also had a good sized bathroom with over head shower. The breakfast every moring was of a good quality. I do hope to visit again someday. THANKS FOR EVERY THINK.

Reviews.Title: “Lovely hotel in great location”
Reviews.Author: Emma J
Reviews.Content: Myself and my partner travelled to Venice at the end of February 2012 for a romantic 3 night break. After looking at some of the brilliant reviews for this hotel we thought it would would be ideal for us and we were not wrong. From the airport, we bought a cheap return coach ticket direct to Venice bus station - the ride only took us 20 minutes (plus ten minutes waiting at the bus stop) The Italian scenery was nice on the way giving us a great introduction to the city. From the coach station, the hotel is literally 5 minutes walk away and very easy to find. We were greeted in a friendly fashion at the reception desk and given a map detailing Venice and its attractions which was very helpful. A porter then showed us to our room, which, although on the ground floor and not looking out onto the canal, for our needs it was perfect being quite spacious and clean. The bed was comfy also and we had no trouble getting to sleep. Our only critisism would be the noise early in the morning. Unsure whether this was the other guests making the racket or the staff! Either way, we would still come back to this hotel. Breakfast was 'ok', not a great amount of choice but we still didn't go hungry. The service was great, the waiter/waitresses made you a coffee or tea as soon as you sat at your table. If you want to have a drink at the hotel bar, be prepared to pay a lot (over 10 euros for two drinks)! A walk finding some local bars is a much cheaper option. In terms of Venice atmosphere in Winter, we arrived on the last day of the February festival. The streets were packed with people in masks and costumes. It was great to experience, though it was absolute madness. The time we spent in Venice, we were lucky to have really nice weather - the sun shone everyday and felt warm enough to take off our jackets. St Mark's Square is a good half an hour walk through the narrow streets and over bridges but is well worth it if you want to see all the sights Venice has to offer. We were so glad we didn't buy any Vaperetto tickets, as we would have missed out on so much. Definitely visit the Bell Tower, it's relatively inexpensive and has great views all over the city. We even saw the Swiss Alps. Overall, hotel great and Venice even better. Would recommend to anyone!

Reviews.Title: “Very elegant interior...”
Reviews.Author: Shannon H
Reviews.Content: The first hotel you see exiting the train station and a short walk over a bridge.The room small but so much character. Relaxing bath and bed. Chocolates on our bed...yummy. A huge array at breakfast and lovely coffee. Reception staff accommodating. Restaurant had a nice selection. Easy access to water taxis, restaurants and shopping area. A great base to explore.

Reviews.Title: “Very convenient location and good standard”
Reviews.Author: GautamMu
Reviews.Content: For visitors coming by train, this hotel is as good as can be. With a vaporetto pass you can reach anywhere very quickly and conveniently. The rooms are generous (for the price) and the breakfast was much better than most other hotels we stayed in in Italy. The complimentary trip to Murano for a glass blowing demo was a bonus. The free wi-fi in the reception area works well. We'll stay there again

Reviews.Title: “Good location for visiting Venice”
Reviews.Author: Gilly186299
Reviews.Content: The Hotel is in a good location near railway station. Information centre nearby where tickets can be purchased for waterbus, which is the easiest way to travel and also the cheapest. Some way from San Marco, and out of the main tourist area, but it is so easy to hop on waterbus and get off wherever you want to. It is just a few stops to Rialto Bridge & Market. We bought 3 day pass, which allows you to travel as many times as you like, even over to Murano. The hotel is typically Venetian, our room was a little small, with very little storage for clothes, but was spotlessly clean, bathroom also small but clean. It was at the back of hotel, which was a little dissapointing. Breakfast was varied, with a reasonable choice, served buffet style. Staff were pleasant & friendly. Restaurant prices were very high, so did not dine in! Lots of little bars & local places are much cheaper. The only problem is getting over the bridge with suitcases. The hotel did not offer any porters on arrival & on departure charged 10 Euros for porter. But, a nice hotel in quieter location.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel for a visit to Venice”
Reviews.Author: Holiday_Junkie222
Reviews.Content: My partner and I stayed here on our visit to Venice last year. The decor is very fitting for its location and it's very central to everything. I would highly recommend.

Reviews.Title: “Top notch in every respect”
Reviews.Author: Design123
Reviews.Content: Second time visit to this hotel and it was every bit as good and classy as the first trip. Clean, well run, spacious and wonderful staff who can't do enough for you. The location is excellent, at the opposite end of the grand canal to St Mark's, very close to (but visually separated from) the only road access point into venice and just opposite the train station, so if its your first visit to Venice and you don't know your way around this is an excellent starting point. This hotel is a real class act and I'm really not sure why it is not rated 5*.

Reviews.Title: “Cannot beat the location”
Reviews.Author: Sugiato
Reviews.Content: Hotel is just opposite S.Lucia train station (across the grand canal) so it is very close and easy to find! My room (and its bathroom) is very spacious, bed is big and quite comfortable. The carpet and its furniture looks a bit old, but as long as its clean I don't really mind. My room is at the back so it only has small window for air circulation without any view, and the sound proofing could be better as i can hear people conversation quite clear (i am guessing it is from the level above through the window). No free wi-fi in the room, only available in lobby/bar area but the signal is very weak and sometimes non existence. Breakfast is great with bacon and omelette on top of the standard cereals, pastries, juices and cold meats.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect hotel, Perfect holiday...”
Reviews.Author: Laz1983
Reviews.Content: Having read some of the previous reviews and having got a brilliant cheap deal, I wasn't overly optimistic about arriving at the hotel. I also thought it to myself - it's just a place to stay whilst exploring Venice. However, I was pleasantly suprised... Upon arriving at Marco Polo airport, we walking through customs and there is a ticket booth where you can get your tickets to Venice. Private taxi's are about 100 EUR, water boats 15 EUR or a 20 min coach ride to Piazza Romale is 5 EUR and a perfect location for this hotel. You walk towards the canal and turn right (no need to go over the huge glass bridge) then you walk over 2 smaller bridges and arrive to the hotel within 5 mins walk. Hotel is lovely and decorated in traditional venetian style. When I booked through Easyjet, you have an option to send a message to the hotel, I requested a room over loooking the canal and this is exactly what we got, room 209. Perfect room, very small but the other reviews said the same, it was perfectly adequate for a base to stay. There was a lovely Juliet balcony aswell. It was a little noisy in the morning when the boats were coming in with their deliveries but it depends if you are a light sleeper really, we were fine. The breakfast was fine and traditional continental breakfast... bread rolls, toast, ham, salami, cheeses, bacon, scrambled eggs, fresh fruit, cereal, jams and nutella spreads, fresh juices, lovely coffee, tea, yoghurts, croissants..... all well stocked and a perfect spread for a start to your day of exploring venice. there is free wifi in the bar on the right as you walk in, also the hotel are happy to keep your luggage if you have a later flight. As for Venice itself.... if you come out of the hotel and walk across the bridge on your right, there is the Vaporetto service which has quite a few services leaving from this station (ferrovia) and you can go straight to San Marco, Rialto, Murano etc.... I would recommend getting a pass for 24/36/48 hours - we got a 48 hour pass for 28 EUR, otherwise its about 6 EUR per trip so it can get expensive. The service is frequent and quick too. Alternatively, you can walk through the streets and across the bridges to reach wherever you want. Although the hotel is at the end of the canal, its a perfect location in my opinion. You have the bus station 5 mins away, the train station to catch trains to Verona etc opposite and one of the biggest Vaporetto stops right opposite. It is also a lot cheaper to eat and drink in this district. Average prices for 2 pizzas, 2 soft drinks, a side salad and cover (bread and breadstiscks) is about 30-35 EURO, nothing is cheap in Venice, the soft drinks in all of the restaurants are a min of 3.50 EURO and water is about 4-5 EURO!! The restaurant on the corner as you walk over the bridge is quite pricey, 50 EURO for lunch - omelette, pasta and 1 bowl of chips and 2 diet cokes!!! We got a vaporetto to san marco and went up the bell tower, 8 EUR each and you can go straight up and get some amazing views - it was especially lovely as we had fab weather - sunny all the time and blue skies. We then sat at a cafe in st marks square where my boyfriend proposed....:-) Beware of the prices... 8.50 EUR (Â£7.30) for a can of coke!!! Walking from st marks square through the narrow streets is lovely and you can get to Rialto in about 10-15 mins, the shopping streets are lovely but the designer shops are very expensive, more so than in the UK. Rialto is lovely too and there are some lovely restaurants and cafes lining the canal. Florida restaurant was nice and the cafe on the opposite side was a nice place to sit in the day and watch the world go by. Beware of the gondola's... on the first day we were offered a gondala from one of the side canals for 60 EUR to go down the whole canal and the side canals.... we didnt go then on the last day we enquired about the gondolas from outside of the hotel to go to Rialto.... (not far) and they said 110 EURO!! Barter and try to get one from the side canals and also try to go on one in the day as they are a lot cheaper. We caught a Vaporetto to Murano and saw the glass factory which was interesting and then caught the vaporetto over to Burano which was beautiful, the streets are lined with colourful houses, beautiful shops selling hand made lace and souvenirs and lovely restaurants on the canal. Overall a lovely trip, Venice is lovely and a beautiful place to explore... it is very expensive and nowhere is cheap but I would definitely go back to this hotel and definitely go back to Venice to explore more as there is so much to see and do......

Reviews.Title: “great value for Venice”
Reviews.Author: AzerB
Reviews.Content: Stayed there during the peak of the bienalle & the rate I got for 3 nights was what the other hotels were offering for 1. So great value. The hotel is a bit far off from the main sights, which I did turn into an advantage: walked all over the city towards SAn Marco, enjoyed what the city had to offer & took the vaporetto coming back. If coming in via train, the station is right accross the canal, there is one bridge to cross over. I do agree with a previous comment : taking a taxi (with wheels) is not a good idea, actually to any location in the city. Walking with suitcases is not fun. If I had taken a water taxi, I would have arrived at the front door of the hotel. The sitting area on the front is fun, good drinks & great for people watching. I wanted the room with the terrace, which was not availble so got another on the ground floor, on the courtyard. This is so much better as you get extra space & air. As the room did not look out to any street or canal, it does get the city noise, so turned out to be for the best. Although the hotel personel is a bit noisy in the morning when watering the plants & talking to each other. I have my eyes set on another hotel that I discovered, if I can't stay there next time, will come back here. The breakfast was ok, nothing to complain or praise. The reception staff helped with reservations, taxi arrangements etc the way they are supposed to. Wireless is available only in the lobby, I would be upset if I wasn't on the ground floor.

Reviews.Title: “Left a day early”
Reviews.Author: travelingirl38
Reviews.Content: We were "greeted" by the hotel staff (female at the front desk) with a scowl, and a mumbled "hello." We approached the desk to check in and she just stood there, avoiding eye contact, while the other worker was on the phone. She was not busy doing something else...just standing there. No, "we'll be with you in just one moment"...nothing. We stood there awkwardly until the nicer worker got off the phone and checked us in. It was very strange, off-putting, and not a very nice welcoming into Venice. The hotel is conveniently located. The rooms are small, but appeared overall clean. The breakfast was decent...standard from what we've found in Italy. We were just not impressed with the hotel staff, or the area in general, so we checked out a day early. And no free wi-fi in the rooms? Get with the times, please! Disappointed.

Reviews.Title: “I recommend”
Reviews.Author: eu_devacances
Reviews.Content: The location is very good because it is near the station and the arrival area of the bus. And the hits to take the vaporeto is next to the hotel. It is also walking distance to either side. At night is a good area to find pleasant restaurants

Reviews.Title: “Old World Charm of Venice”
Reviews.Author: Tina S
Reviews.Content: This hotel location is amazing, itâ€™s literally right across from the train station. The rooms were a good size for Venice, but great value. For Venice, the price youâ€™re paying and what youâ€™re getting is really great! Itâ€™s walking distance from a lot of shops and restraints. And the water bus is right beside the train station, so itâ€™s very easy to get to St. Markâ€™s or any other part of Venice. Venice is very old world, and has so much unbelievable charm, and this hotel reflects that. Itâ€™s very old world Venice, and transfers you right back into that time. Breakfast was include, so that was a great bonus, and fantastic way to start your day, as you will be spending lots of time walking around the canals. DO NOT TAKE A TAXI CAB from the airport. Pay the extra money and take a water taxi. With all your luggage and trying to walking over the bridges, good luck! You will break your luggage. Itâ€™s not worth it, try to find someone to split the fare of the water taxi, itâ€™s honestly is worth the extra money.

Reviews.Title: “Remarkably good value”
Reviews.Author: Timbowhimbo
Reviews.Content: Location is very handy for the rail station and bus station and vaporetto (water buses). However, 20 minutes walk from Piazza San Marco. Lots of good artisan restaurants within 5 minutes walk off the tourist traps. An excellent continental breakfast, but get there before 8.00 for the best choice of fruit and pastries. Would certainly recommend. My wife and I stayed there for a week.

Reviews.Title: “Great location. Professional staff”
Reviews.Author: bourgan
Reviews.Content: Stayed here feb 2012 for 4 nights. LOCATION. 3 mins walk from bus and train station. 30 mins walk to San Marco or 10 mins by ferry. Being so close to the bus station makes it easy to find when you get lost which everyone in Venice does. Signs for Piazzale Roma are everywhere. At the front of the hotel is the Grand Canal, and behind is Santa Groce which is off the main tourist trial, but is beautiful and a change from the crowds of San Marco and per Rialto. HOTEL. We stayed in room 252 which is at the back of the hotel overlooking an alley. It was spacious enough and kept clean. The decor was traditional with some faded charm. Good value for the price we paid. The only negative was a patch of mould on the bathroom ceiling! The reception and breakfast area is first class and the staff very smart and professional. Breakfast itself was good quality. There are no tea / coffee facilities in the room and you have to pay to watch TV. Use of the safe though is included in the price. Booked everything through Jet2 and got a good price. I would stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Can't get better. Best Hotel in Venice easily”
Reviews.Author: Juhi_KS
Reviews.Content: I travelled to Italy on my honeymoon in november last year. When yo uare in Venice, everything looks beautiful..but this hotel just blew me off.. so regal, so royal..a picture perfect hotel..awesome rooms.. and most importantly, awesome staff. We reached at 6 in the mornig, whereas our check-in was from 12pm. however, the person on the front desk checked us in early, without any extra charge.. Extravagant breakfast buffet... location of the hotel is a big plus..just on the canal and bang opposite Ferrovia train station and water bus stop. Would recommend tihs hotel to everyone travelling to Venice.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, nice rooms”
Reviews.Author: omg_travel
Reviews.Content: The location is superb, and absolutely good value for your money. We stayed 4 nights, and they have a promo, if you stay 3 nights you get the 4th night free. The rooms are nice, Venetial style. This hotel has absolutely nothing to do with the worldwide Carlton hotels group, but it's very nice nevertheless. Absolutely friendly staff.

Reviews.Title: “Lovely hotel & great location.”
Reviews.Author: debra1954
Reviews.Content: We stayed at this hotel for 3 nights choosing it mainly for its location which was ideal.Having done tons of research before, making notes to bring so that we could get as much out of our short stay as poss...I then went and left them all at home! It really didn't matter though in the end. Was absolutely sure i knew exactly how to get to the hotel and that it was very straight forward but arriving at night it all looks very different. So we had a bit of trouble finding the hotel. so many bridges and wondering if we were crossing the right one. Eventually got there and as you walk in it really is lovely.Was very pleased with our room despite having 3 windows but no canal views, which i was initially disappointed about,decided not to ask to change it.Unfortunately we had a terrible first night being regularly woken by what we think must have been shutters banging against the opposite building walls.So first thing in the morning we asked if possible could we change rooms which was no problem at all and we were more than happy with the much quieter room we were given.Still no views of the canal but we decided that it didn't really matter because as soon as you step outside the hotel they are all around you. Everywhere you look is a photo opportunity. We knew having such a short time we would want to cram a lot in and so got a 72hr vaporetto pass which was well used but we also did a lot of walking too. We found it very easy to get around Venice and never really got completely lost as we had expected to. Everywhere seemed well signposted.I had been once before only for a couple of hours back in 1968 and had always wanted to return one day so it was a very special return to be with my husband for our 40th anniversary and his first time too. We pre-booked a Secret Itineries tour for inside the Doges palace with a very good English speaking guide which we thoroughly enjoyed. Had time to wander around the palace too on our own, went into the basilica in St.Marks square, art gallery at Accademia, the Rialto, Canareggio, off and on the vaporettos,didn't seem to stop but only really touched the surface and would definitely return to explore a lot more. Despite the freezing cold weather we still think it would be better to come either a bit early or late in the year as we were suprised at how many tourists there were in early Feb so can only imagine how heaving it must get in high summer. Breakfast at the hotel was very good with more than enough choice for us.Rolls,croissants, toast.jams, fruit, juices,egg, bacon.cold meats etc. Really nice coffee and jug of hot milk, choice of teas.Very nice waiting staff and manager. We didn't eat any meals there as ate out.Would definitely return to The Carlton.

Reviews.Title: “Very good hotel and location”
Reviews.Author: James W
Reviews.Content: We stayed during the freezing winter storm in February, which limited our enjoyment of Venice itself. Nevertheless, this is a good hotel, in an excellent location. The only drawback could be the hike over the bridge to get to the vaporetto station. The breakfast buffet was excellent, hot and cold food, nicely presented. The rooms were small, but nice fitted and looked after. The service is exellent, friendly withiut being invasive. The restaurant is expensive, but the food was very good. We woukd rocommend it.

Reviews.Title: “Excellence in Venice”
Reviews.Author: Geordiestrip
Reviews.Content: This was a 2 night stopover in Venice in January. The room was booked through laterooms.com and was excellent value. The hotel responded immediately to an email confirming our arrival and sent details of all the different ways of reaching them from the airport with costs, a map and a bus timetable. It is in a very good position 3 minutes walk from the airport bus station and opposite the railway station on the Grand Canal. The room had a good view over the Grand Canal and was well equipped. The staff were very friendly and the concierge most helpful. The Breakfast Buffet was good and the bar in the foyer was very restful. We did not eat other meals in the hotel but used it as a base to explore Venice and in this respect it was very good and would certainly use it agan.

Reviews.Title: “Great place in venice”
Reviews.Author: lankk97
Reviews.Content: This hotel is across the canal from the train station. Very convenient when you have a big luggage bag with you. Booked a grand canal view with a balcony. The guy at the counter said we had a very nice room and I could not agree more with him. The staff is friendly and welcoming but not intrusive. The rooms are well-kept and clean. (it's venice, all the building are old). The breakfast (which is included for all rooms) has quite a decent spread. Even though there are many people, the food is replenished quickly. Due to its proximity to the train station, the place was never deserted but it is not noisy either (but bear in mind that we were there in winter). Very safe area even though we strolled around after 10 pm. Wireless is free in the lounge area. The downside is that the room was very pricey. But if you are from across the globe, how often will you go to venice, right?

Reviews.Title: “A great place in Venice”
Reviews.Author: diporzio
Reviews.Content: The expensive hotels are not my favorite places but this was a real exception. We took a Christmas easyjet offer for this Carlton Hotel with the flight to Venice The elegance is not overwhelming Rooms are large elegantly furnished nice Buffet breakfast very good The bar is nice And we were in Venice immersed in its beauty at an affordable price just across the main train station

Reviews.Title: “VERY NICE HOTEL, GOOD LOCATION”
Reviews.Author: Romantic2011
Reviews.Content: It was our second time at this hotel and we liked it as much as the first time. First the hotel is right in front of the train station and you have the Ponte Scalzi in front to cross the Grand Canal and get to the vaporetto station. So from there it is very easy to get anywhere. If you dont get lost, from there you can be at Piazza San Marco with a 30 minutes walk. The hotel is very nice, the lobby and lounge are very well furnished and decorated. The rooms are very cleaned and nice and comfortable. The staff is very nice and professional. The breakfast was included and is very good.

Reviews.Title: “Great location”
Reviews.Author: REGCambridge
Reviews.Content: Great for us 100 metres away from main street 3 min walk on arrival by bus brilliant if we come again or should I say when one tip fly into marco polo we went into treviso still good 45 min 9euro bus trip ok but water taxi from airport would of been great take some comfy shoes lots of walking great shops Carlton does a courtesy water taxi to Murano do take they provide a taxi back to San marco I think even if you don't purchase anything staff were great we weren't to happy with our room we were given it was ok but we upgrade to a canal view yes I agree it's not summer but the it's a special trip looking out the train station is opposite some other reviews moan about this but didn't seem a problem not noisy at all river is bustling all hours breakfast is superb all the usuals great bread rolls on the whole good stay great location for us walk able to everywhere downsides drinks in bar 12 euro for gin and tonic 12 euro for Irish coffee,no wi-fi only in bar Â£5euro an hour cable in room no kettle in room we Brits seem to always moan about this but hey we're in Venice! Would recomend

Reviews.Title: “My First Trip to Venice”
Reviews.Author: Loraine052
Reviews.Content: On January 12, 2012 â€“ January 15th, 2012, my husband and I had the opportunity to stay at the Hotel Carlton on the Grand Canal in Venice with friends. After arriving at the airport we took the ATVO bus from the airport to the bus station near the canal. It cost 5 Euros one way or 9 Euros round trip. We had a short walk to the hotel, the check in staff was very courteous and we had a very lovey room. The rooms are simple; it had an Armoire, a desk, TV, phone and a safe. Our bathroom had a tub however; our friendâ€™s room only had a shower. Every morning we had a complimentary breakfast which included, cereal, scramble eggs, bacon, a verity of yogurts, fruit, juiceâ€™s, cheese, salami, ham and fresh croissants. Free internet is available near the front desk. The hotel is in a great location, walking distance to restaurants, tourist attractions and the water taxi to take you to Murano and Burano. Be ready to walk up and down bridges to get across the canal, I would definitely recommend this hotel and would stay there again if I ever return to Venice Italy!

Reviews.Title: “Excellent hotel, you get exactly what you expect!”
Reviews.Author: Liniredbaron
Reviews.Content: Booked this hotel as a surprise birthday treat for my wife and she loved it! We arrived by bus which is 9 euros return from the airport and the hotel is less than five minutes walk from there. The hotel staff were very friendly and always helpful. The room was spacious and very clean but one downside to be wary of, everything in the room is chargeable, we had some Pringles and peanuts and it cost us nearly 10 euro! Other than that well worth looking at for your stay in Venice.

Reviews.Title: “Lovely visit”
Reviews.Author: Belle_Ame_4
Reviews.Content: I stumbled upon this hotel when I ran into other Aussie friends upon arriving in Venice. I have to say I was impressed upon check-in. After quite a wait I asked what the rate for a single room was and the gentleman was very helpful. He didn't charge me the full rate - he gave me a better rate than listed and then reduced it twice more as I had waited a while and he accidently gave me a double rate. The second reduction was because I was with other Aussies - very nice. Great location to the train station especially if you are catching the Eurail upon leaving Venice. It is at the top end of the canal however a ticket for the days you will be there makes travelling between stops along the canal super easy and it's pretty much it's own hop on hop of tour. There are only a couple of not so great things for me. One was that the room was quite small (not too much of a problem except it was extremely hot even though it was very cold outside. Breakfast was fantastic and handy to have wifi available - however it would be much better if we could use it throughout the hotel and not just in the bar. Apart from convenience I say this for another reason which was that I was asked to move tables twice to accomodate for an extremely rowdy tour group of americans both nights which then caused me to feel unwelcome and uncomfortable. However overall my stay was great and I would stay again. I wish I could remember the name of the gentleman that checked me in as he was great.

Reviews.Title: “Nice Hotel but not conveniently located”
Reviews.Author: Mandie v
Reviews.Content: This hotel was by far the most expensive that my boyfriend and I stayed in during our Italy trip and it left both us us a bit disappointed. The hotel staff is friendly and helpful, the breakfast is great but the room itself was average. An old bathroom with a bath shower combo and plumbing that did not quite work. The air-conditioning unit was not working and they only managed to fix it towards the end of our stay. We stayed in a room with a canal view, but due to the location of the hotel (directly opposite to the train station and ferry) it was really noisy. All of this aside the worst part was how long it took to get to the sights from our hotel. On average the ferry ride to anywhere took about 45min. The next time we visit Venice we will definitely try and stay in the Dorsoduro District.

Reviews.Title: “Absolutely the best breakfast ever”
Reviews.Author: bergzabern
Reviews.Content: I recently had the pleasure of being a guest at this fine hotel. Coupled with a great location and friendly staff the morning breakfast was beyond compare. The staff went out of their way to ensure your every want was met. The dining room manager was out on the floor greeting guests and ensuring things were running smoothly. A very well managed and well run establishment. I had one special request which was fulfilled immediately and with a smile, a rarity indeed.

Reviews.Title: “Big hotel, closeby the trainstation”
Reviews.Author: LubvandenBerg
Reviews.Content: Hotel is rather big but it's closeby the trainstation and big parking garage (5 min. walk). So ideal to start the exploring of Venice. Service is good, rooms are rather small but clean. Price/ quality rate is okay.

Reviews.AuthorLocation: Ft Myers, FL and Milford, PA
Reviews.Title: “Beautiful place to stay”
Reviews.Author: lilyontheroad
Reviews.Content: On the Grand Canal in Venice across from the train station, which makes it easy to find in a maze of a city! The dining room and bar are charming, the reception staff very friendly and they speak good english too! It deserves the 4 star rating.

Reviews.Title: “Best Location”
Reviews.Author: harjeet48
Reviews.Content: The hotel is located at a very strategic spot. The front desk staff are very friendly and te same goes to the conciege staff. The only glinch and set back about the hotel is the superior rooms that we got rattles everytime someone opens or close their room door . We can hear the conversation from the next door room and from outside of the window.

Reviews.Title: “Good hotel, great location.”
Reviews.Author: DavidBiel
Reviews.Content: Overall we were very pleased with this hotel, although there as nothing "special" about it. We chose it partly because it is right near the train station and very easy to find, especially when you arrive after dark in a strange town. Room was clean, quiet and cozy. Bed was comfortable. Initially I thought the decor was too dated, but then realized this was likely intentional to look Venetian. The bathroom had been re-done and was very nice. Good breakfast is included. It could be improved by having wireless Internet in the rooms (it is available in the lobby only, or 8 Euros/night via cable in room). Also, an in-room coffee machine would be a nice addition. Overall we were very pleased, and would choose it again.

Reviews.Title: “Good Hotel, Great Charm”
Reviews.Author: Stephanie S
Reviews.Content: Of the 7 hotels we stayed in while in Italy, this was among my favorites. The room seemed very "Venetian." It was by far the most spacious room that we stayed in while in Italy. The room was spotless with a very comfortable mattress. The service was very nice, but I am not sure that I would have called it anything special. I would maybe say that the service is very professional at the Hotel Carlton. The location is on the Grand Canal on the "right" side, but it would either be a long walk or a boat ride to get anywhere. We used a boat, but like I said, you need a plan or a long walk to get to where you want to go. Overall, charming atmosphere that did not detract from the overall feel of the city.

Reviews.Title: “Fair deal”
Reviews.Author: Liew T
Reviews.Content: Don't ever believe an Internet photo. Location was prime next to railway station, walking distance. Nothing much activity.

Reviews.Title: “great location,”
Reviews.Author: aasthagupta
Reviews.Content: We went on our honeymoon to venice, like most of us we thought it would be really romantic. We reached in d night but the best part was location, it ryt opposite to the railway station. So it was easy for us to reach to the hotel. But it turned a task wid ol d luggage we had. We called the hotel to arrange for a transport but they said it would be charged at â‚¬40. So we carried our luggage ourselves. The staff was warm. The room we got was quite small n cozy. But the best part was canal view. Which made it really romantic at night. The size of the bed was definately a problem if u r a lil tall,which we had. The breakfast was nice.the balcony offered a great view of the mornings. Ovearall a decent hotel but cant say a four star kinds. Only great because of location.

Reviews.Title: “Deceptively good location”
Reviews.Author: BenRG
Reviews.Content: The room we stayed in was a canal view room. Although it was small, it was quite nice as it had a fair amount of detail to it. Canal views were good, but have to stand quite close to the windows to appreciate it. One downside is the noise from the canal (not too bad during most sleeping hours however). The location is obviously fantastic for train travellers but I'd also say is a good location all round. As it's not in the centre of town, it in a way forces you to either walk or get a vaporetto, which is fantastic! Part of the adventure in Venice is exploring the back streets and viewing the canal, so for this it's perfect!

Reviews.Title: “Romantic hotel”
Reviews.Author: Tramper
Reviews.Content: my wife and I stayed here in May of this year for 2 nights as part of our 10th wedding anniversary. We upgraded to the Juliet balcony on the canal which was well worth the expense as it afforded us the perfect perch from which to watch all the coming and goings along the canal. Boats of every size and shape; some brimming with commuters, others carrying anything and everthing imaginable passed by our view.....staff were very friendly; eager to ensure that you were happy and the location is within good walking distance of St Mark's Square. Rooms were on the smaller size but were adequate for Venice standards and highly romantic. We actually slept all night with the balcony doors and side window open so that we could open our eyes and look upon the canal at any time. It is across from the train station but that did not take away from the overall experience....perfectly placed to catch the afternoon sun and sunset..We spent our time meandering along the waterways and shops and felt perfectly safe. Unbelievalble experience..we will come back to this hotel and defeinately recommend you try the Juliet balcony experience. We do have photos to view if interested. Tramper

Reviews.Title: “Honeymoon”
Reviews.Author: kayleigh g
Reviews.Content: We went to Italy for our honeymoon in Nov, 2011. Our second hotel was Hotel Carlton and it was FABULOUS. We booked the Junior Suit and got the exact same room that was in the pictures. We had flowers waiting in our room and Presco delivered on the second night. The whole hotel staff was absolutely lovely. Very friendly, spoke great english, and all were very helpful! We will be going back to this hotel in the future!!

Reviews.Title: “good for the docks”
Reviews.Author: NorfolkNat333
Reviews.Content: Our room looked over the roof tops and was quiet. Glad we didn't pay the Â£178 extra for a canal view as the hotel just has a view of a railway station We thought the room we stayed in however was pleasant enough and when we asked for another blanket in the middle of the night it was delivered in minutes Coffee at breakfast was really good and the staff were all helpful There was a mosquito in our room but we had opened the windows, got bitten but the bites didn,t itch

Reviews.Title: “Just lovely!”
Reviews.Author: Teeaitch
Reviews.Content: Looking at some of the previous reviews ("small room", "tired decor", " inadequate breakfast") I think I must have been staying in a different hotel. Our room was just lovely with beautiful brocade wall covering, a comfortable, large bed, plenty of storage space and was spotless. Right from the start the staff were excellent - we loved Felipe's twinkle and Mario's attentiveness - and the food was first class. Dinner in La Cupola was superb although breakfast on Sunday was minorly chaotic. I'm trying to think of a criticism - OK, the drinks are expensive, but where aren't they in any 3 or 4 star hotel in any city? I did spot a worn bit of carpet on a staircase but to say that the corridors are 'tired' is completely over the top. We travel a lot. We loved The Carlton and wouldn't hesitate to return or recommend it.

Reviews.Title: “Hotel Carlton on Grand Canal, Venice, Italy”
Reviews.Author: Mirko R
Reviews.Content: Great place to be in Venice. Hotel is located opposite railway station, just over the bridge. Ideal location if you travel with kids and have lots of luggage. Water bus station are either few hundreds meters back on your left from station, or over the bridge. Family rooms are quite large and hotel is clean. Breakfast buffet meets standards of the hotel. Entire lobby is spacious, well decorated in typical Venecian style and their staff are very very pleasant. We would definitely stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Good Hotel & Service”
Reviews.Author: Mabir
Reviews.Content: Great hotel with a great location. Right in front of the train station. But price was a little steep. Nice feel of venetian interior in the hotel. Service was average. The rooftop bar is a great place to have a drink and watch venice go by in the evening.

Reviews.Title: “A great experience”
Reviews.Author: Aveen M
Reviews.Content: The location of this hotel is fantastic. It's right opposite the railway station. The interior is well decorated. The rooms are comfy. The breakfast was well laid out and a satisfying buffet. I would definitely stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Old and noisy”
Reviews.Author: Xavi V
Reviews.Content: The location is great (across the Canale Grande from the train station), but the room was not so good looking, and located on the dock so we could hear all the activity from the street. The breakfast was also disapointing with bad quality food ! Definitely not the best place to stay in Venise !!!

Reviews.Title: “great breakfasts, helpful staff!”
Reviews.Author: woahwoah
Reviews.Content: My daughter and I stayed here for 4 nights recently and it suited our needs really well. It's ideally positioned if you are arriving from the airport by bus, or are using the train, as both stations are a 2 minute walk away. However, the hotel is also well positioned on the Grand Canal. Our standard room was small but pleasant, and the bathroom was fine.The coffee at breakfast was amazing, and there was a good choice of pastries, fruit, yogurt etc, as well as hot food if you wanted it. The staff were very helpful and spoke good English. The hotel seems to have a lot of American visitors, and provided US rather than UK newspapers, and the cooked breakfast was aimed at American tastes, I think. Our only 'wish' might have been for a kettle and some cups in our room to make drinks, but that's a small thing (how British!).

Reviews.Title: “wont stay here again”
Reviews.Author: PretoriaTravelagent
Reviews.Content: opposite railway station and very noisy....public areas quite presentable..however corridors and rooms a bit tired....a groups orientated hotel..personally prefer to be in the area between St Marks and Rialto

Reviews.Title: “Great location, charming hotel”
Reviews.Author: Carmen L
Reviews.Content: I spent a long weekend at the Carlton at the end of November. The location is great, very close to all transport - waterbuses, buses and land taxis - and a short walk to San Marco while being in a quiet non-commercial area. Excellent service (friendly personnel), great food if you feel like staying in. Internet free in the lobby, inexpensive in the room. I would definitely recommend it!

Reviews.Title: “5 day trip venice”
Reviews.Author: welshrode
Reviews.Content: Got a shared boat taxi from marco polo via aviator.com straight to the hotel -great ride-Straight off the boat and into hotel lovely foyer and people on reception very nice and helpful.the lad took us to the room -sorry no money on me for tip-and did not see him again.Room was a bit on the small side with not much hanging facility -but enough .the en-suite was tight anfd the curtain had to go in the tray otherwise the room would have flooded.It was good enough for our needs at the price of Â£320 for 5 nights -worth going that little bit extra as the hotel was nice .The breakfast was excellent of american style breakfast as the description the bacon (or panchettas)with scrambled eggs was tasty and the coffee was brill.Downside 9euro abeer in the hotel and 10 euro for amaretto-but reccomended

Reviews.Title: “tiny rooms”
Reviews.Author: hersheyhere
Reviews.Content: first destination of our italian honeymoon, the first look at the hotel definetly made us happy with its strategic location right on the canal.. however, the room s were tiny with a pillar running right through the centre of the room.. i would rate the rooms as cluttered and claustrophobic but the staff was very friendly which made up for the sad rooms. a very good location. the hotel offers a complimentary ferry to the murano and burano island...

Reviews.Title: “Magical Honeymoon”
Reviews.Author: Pennargirl
Reviews.Content: My husband and I just returned from a 3 night stay in Carlton on the Grand Canal. The hotel is in a brilliant location. Just over the bridge is the Ferrovia water bus station. You just have to hop on a number 2 boat which will take you to the Rialto and San Marco and then back to Ferrovia. It is also situated a 3 minute walk from the Pizzale Roam bust terminal and just across the bridge is the train station. The reception area is very decadent and the staff are friendly and very helpful. The rooms are decorated in traditional Venetian style. Our room was very small and we were a little disappointed that we didn't have a canal view, however this was an oversight on our part as we didn't request this when booking the honeymoon. On saying that, our room was lovely and immaculately clean. The cleaning staff are also very friendly and always there with a cheery 'buon giorno' and a smile. The breakfast was very good too, it catered for all nationalities and there was always plenty of food available and again the breakfast staff were happy and helpful. We did not go into the Hotel Cafe or Restaurant as we had read reviews of it being a bit expensive. There are so many scrumptious eateries and restaurants in venice you just have to try them out. Our tip is that if there are locals there its a good place to eat. Avoid the restaurants looking out over the canal, you pay a very high premium to eat there. Venice is a magical place and if we ever return we would defiantly stay at the Carlton on the Grand Canal Hotel again.

Reviews.Title: “our romantic weekend”
Reviews.Author: neville m
Reviews.Content: We had an extremely pleasant 3 days in Venice in late October. We had a room with a Grand Canal view,and my partner got very emotional when we opened the windows and shutters to view the busy canal. The breakfasts were great, the hotel cafe and restaurant were very very expensive for what you get, but service was OK. Reception desk was very helpful.

Reviews.Title: “Very nice and clean!”
Reviews.Author: Angela A
Reviews.Content: The staff was nice and the hotel was fancy and clean. The rooms were big and the bathroom was SO clean which is a must! The breakfast was really good and there was a big selection. We wanted to eat there one nigth but the restaurant is $$$$$ so that sucked. Overall we were happy with it!

Reviews.Title: “Good but not Grand Hotel”
Reviews.Author: 777KandT
Reviews.Content: We had a very enjoyable 3 night stay. While the room was not as nice as the common areas, it was a reasonable size and reasonably furnished. We had two windows and a balcony overlooking the Grand Canal. While we were concerned about the location before we arrived (across from the train station and some distance from St. Mark's square), it turned out not to be an issue. The front desk staff was very helpful and volunteered lots of valuable information. While we found the room to be fairly expensive, we had the same experience with other hotels in Venice and elsewhere in Italy.

Reviews.Title: “A really good experience, great location”
Reviews.Author: lnj4boogie
Reviews.Content: My 68 year old mom and I on her first abroad were introduced to this hotel through Gate 1 Travel. We were part of a tour. The hotel was beautiful, classic Venetian. As i mentioned, this was a first trip for my mom and she was quite comfortble in this room. If you have travelled in Europe before the size of the rooms will not surprise you. In fact, the size of our room was better than most. The ac was more than adequate two single beds, mini fridge and a nice sized bathroom. Although the hotel faced the canal we had an interior room which was quite quiet. The hotel had a Healthy European continental breakfast. Tv (if you are American) consists of CNN! But no matter, who stays in the hotel in Venice anyway! The hotel is also over the river from the major transportation center. We walked to the old Jewish section and to St marks square (took about 40minutes). Walking through the streets is the best part of staying in Venice. This was definitely an above average hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Very tired hotel!”
Reviews.Author: RichardChurch
Reviews.Content: Shabby room with water stains,old fashioned bathroom,botched repairs through out and average breakfast. Not good value

Reviews.Title: “ROOMS SMALL AND OLD”
Reviews.Author: afintx
Reviews.Content: When I checked into this hotel I didn't think it would be that bad from the appearance of the lobby. However, when they showed me to my room on the ground floor in the back I almost burst into tears. The decor was beyond shabby, the carpet had stains and it was barely big enough to hold a double bed. There wasn't even a proper window in the room. It was more like a port hole on a ship. The room was a small box. I asked the manager to see another room and he showed me something even worse ( as if i thought that was possible). He said the hotel was sold out for the weekend and these were the last 2 rooms he had left. ( B.S.). We had prepaid for the hotel so we were stuck there for 2 nights. Luckily there was a lot to do so we didn't stay in the room much. Don't stay here!

Reviews.Title: “Comfortable Mini Break”
Reviews.Author: vroom100
Reviews.Content: This hotel is a five minute walk from the drop off point for the buses from Marco Polo Airport. The staff are polite and helpful and we were shown to our room by a kind porter. The room had recently been refurbished with cool marble walls and tasteful decor. Although there was not very much storage space, the room was ideal for a short break. The breakfast was included in the price and was advertised on booking as 'American' but it it more like a generous continental breakfast buffet but there was plenty of food and so perfectly adequate. As Venice is not particularly large, the hotel is well situated for the major sights. It is about twenty five minutes on foot to St Mark's Square but after the immense bustle of the Square it was nice to get back to the slightly quieter area this hotel sits in. Having said that, there are plenty of resturants and shops nearby to keep you entertained. The hotel was relatively quiet at night, we were only woken once by other guests returning to their room.

Reviews.Title: “Convenient Location, Inconvenient Welcome”
Reviews.Author: Steph S
Reviews.Content: We were pleased when we stepped out of the train terminal to see the Hotel Carlton just across the canal. As an over-packer and big shopper, it made finding our hotel and getting there very easy. Easy ended there. When we arrived, we were greeted with the fact that a very sick person was in the room (gross! and TMI) we had reserved and the hotel wanted to "upgrade" us to another room for the first night, and then into our original room for our next two nights. The luxury of staying in a city for 3 nights is staying in the same room for three nights. The "upgraded" room was without the canal view and had a "private" patio that was far from luxurious. After some back and forth with Dennis at the front desk, they were able to put us in the deluxe room with a canal room (which is what we had reserved). My husband thanked Dennis, and as we were walking away, Dennis snidely remarked "Well, I was just asking you to do me a favor." After traveling halfway across the world and for the amount of money we were paying, I did not expect, nor appreciate being asked to do THEM a favor. And I couldn't understand why Dennis had to have the last word. The room was small, but nice. And besides the lack of water pressure in the shower, and our initial interaction, our stay was pleasant.

Reviews.Title: “Location, location, location!!”
Reviews.Author: MrsChoosy_11
Reviews.Content: We have just got back from an amazing long weekend in Venice and we are still reeling from such an incredible trip. The location of this hotel is perfect, opposite the train station and close enough to the boat stop from the airport and situated on the Grand Canal. The standard room was cosy (I already expected this) but tastefully furnished in typical Venetian style. Our room overlooked the central courtyard. The staff were very helpful and on the couple of occasions we needed assistance with a troublesome safe in the room, they had it fixed within minutes. On arrival we were given a map and a brief rundown of where the main tourist attractions were/walking times and also Vaperetto prices for 12/24/72 hours. We were also informed there was a free boat to Murano Island from the hotel, however this did not happen on the day we decided to take advantage of it. Breakfast is more than adequate (both hot and cold food available, plus fresh fruit). The roof top bar is lovely, but we couldn't brave the cold for long enough to take advantage of it. You can however, sit outside with a drink and enjoy the best of Venice right on the doorstop. We wouldn't hesitate to recommend the city (it is every bit as magical as you think) and the hotel and have vowed to return one day!!

Reviews.Title: “Try the roof top bar!”
Reviews.Author: gavwaugh
Reviews.Content: We have just returned home from a 2 night break in Venice, staying both nights at The Hotel Carlton on the Grand Canal. We booked a standard room which was great for our needs. The room was clean, well furnished and the bed was very comfortable, especially after walking and seeing the sights all day. The weather was beautiful and very warm so the air conditioning was very welcome. The Roof top bar is a great bonus and lovely place to sit and unwind after a busy day. Breakfast is a very good continental breakfast, the only hot food being eggs and bacon which is disappointing if you like a big cooked breakfast. The service was good and staff friendly. The hotel is in a good location in a beautiful city, probably not as luxurious as I expected for the money, however this wasnt a problem for us.

Reviews.Title: “Let down by the Breakfast”
Reviews.Author: guggle86
Reviews.Content: My only comment with regards to this otherwise excellent hotel is the American Breakfast. My idea of an American breakfast is bacon eggs and pancakes with maple syrup. There was no choice of eggs other than scrambled. The container was topped up with more as required between 7 & 10 am. Unfortunately there was nothing different to breakfast at the Carlton than any other cheaper hotel in Venice or Rome.

Reviews.Title: “Hard to beat this location”
Reviews.Author: wardyp
Reviews.Content: Fantastic location, right on the grand canal and opposite the train station. Rooms are comfortable and breakfast is good. Try the roof top bar at night, beautiful views of the canal and Venice.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel”
Reviews.Author: MichelleLG-84
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for two nights following a cruise as part of our honeymoon. The junior rooftop suite was absolutely lovely - it looked like something out of a movie we were quite impressed. The extras, toiletries etc were all top quality. The hotel staff were lovely and very helpful during checkin, providing us with a map and pointing out the major sights of Venice. They were also very helpful the second night when there was a thunderstorm and the restaurant was full, recommending a nearby restaurant, calling them for us and giving us an umbrella and perfect directions. Our checkout was easy and pain free. Brilliant service! Only downsides - The wifi is not free but isnt as steep as some other places. If you are hoping to have a view of the canal by booking the rooftop suites you will not, only other rooftops but still a nice view. That aside the hotel is in a brilliant location, very close to the port where we disembarked and also close to the train station, meaning if you wanted to carry your only luggage it is quite possible with only a couple of step-bridges to manouvre!

Reviews.Title: “Glamorous This Hotel is NOT”
Reviews.Author: UncleBuck19101
Reviews.Content: We Stayed in Venice the last 2 days of a 2 week vacation in Italy and stayed at the Carlton, best way to sum it up is it's probably about the same as the cheaper places just a few feet around the corner a short walk down one of the side canals and will come with just as many beggers at the front door "you would think the Hotel staff would chase them off" or a Hotel like the Carlton puts there place as being would have a private court yard out in front with view of the canel. As for the rooms when we checked in my wife asked for a different room as soon as we seen the 1st room and the 2nd room well it was not much better, so we found out the nice fancy hotel we thought we were staying at and PAYING for was not what we exspected, so we stayed in this 2nd room 1st night and when running the water in the bath sink in the morning Black sewage came out of the base of the sink at the floor, so we got a 3rd room, my assumption is well Venice is a old city and I feel any place you stay there is going to be a old place with fancy fringe at front door. If someone asked me about Venice I would say make it a day outting and get on the train accros the canel and get out into italy somewhere, Venice's canel is filthy for starters but supose if your going to go to Italy you should at least see it, but personally I would not stay in the city there. there were places out in italy that we both enjoyed and would tell you go to, places myself i've never heard of were the best in Italy, Rome sucked also.

Reviews.Title: “Very good all around”
Reviews.Author: S T
Reviews.Content: The hotel is located along the canal directly across from the train station. Our room and the hotel grounds were tasteful and clean. The breakfast in the morning is great and better than any other breakfast at any other Italy hotel I have stayed at. The staff is friendly and accomodating as well. The beds are fairly comfortable. Great all around hotel - I would definately stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent location”
Reviews.Author: Nubian-Lady
Reviews.Content: Stayed in this hotel for 3 nights Your could not be nearer to the transport links, if are taking the airport bus to Pizzale Roma, walk over the smaller bridge to get to the hotel on your right (save you time) The hotel overlooks the Grand Canal ideal location; you can sit outside with a drink and watch the world go by. Breakfast was fab so much to choose from We had one meal in the hotel, which we though as a bit overpriced but you pay for the location, but explore the area. The hotel staff were very helpful provided us with a map of the area, and which water bus to get to St Mark Square etc. get a 3 days travel pass itâ€™s were it. The only downside was no team making facilities, but room service was at hand. Try not to be located to room 317 because the area is need to the lift and the house keeper storage room which get quite noisy Also the room doors need softer door closures Would I stay in this hotel again of course !

Reviews.Title: “Like”
Reviews.Author: Jelvas121
Reviews.Content: its a nice hotel, but the rooms are very small. I like de service , all the employees are very kind.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location and Friendly Staff”
Reviews.Author: Holliday
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for 4 nights once again after a previous stay in 2006. The room (I booked a standard room) was furnished in traditional Venetian style. Had some minor issues with a smelly air-con system that really did not get any better during my stay, though when reported the houskeeping team were efficient in taking care of the smell - suggested it might just need the filter changing! The TV did not work for 2 days, but not really an issue as who comes to Venice to watch TV!! Did have ants one day in my room, but housekeeping did take care of them and they were not seen again. Otherwise, the rooms are clean, tidy and functional - plenty of towels and requests for more dealt with quickly. The breakfast buffet is great: juices, coffee, tea, breads, pastries, yogurts, meats and cheeses. The hot items of bacon and scrambled egg were tasty too. The staff were friendly and helpful throughout. The hotel wins on location, right beside the Grand canal and perfect to sit out front enjoying a glass of prosecco whilst watching the world go by. Venice is a wonderful city break.

Reviews.Title: “Well located Hotel.”
Reviews.Author: petsan
Reviews.Content: This hotel as its name says overlooks the Grand Canal in Venice. Our room was a standard room so we did not expect to have a room on the front overlooking the canal but nevertheless our room was adequate for our purposes, clean with lovely Venetian furniture. If you want modern do not go there. The hotel breakfasts where excellent, and evening meals are available but on the expensive side. The standard meal is 35euro but this menu did not change during the 4 nights we where there we did have it one night and it was very good. The hotel does supply complementary transfers to the island of Murano to visit a glass making factory which was worth taking (not to much pressure to buy in the factory shop). The hotel is so easy to get to from the Piazza Roma where the airport transfer buses arrive, only 5 minutes walk, and is also just across the canal from the railway station.

Reviews.Title: “WOW!!!!”
Reviews.Author: rose p
Reviews.Content: From the moment i arrived in Venice i knew it was going to be amazing experience...I was with a tour goup and it was dark when we arrived but already i could see that another excellent Hotel was chosen..The foyer was amazing.....the decor....the staff were friendly....and the room...I was so pleased...Beautiful traditional Venetian furniture and Murano glass chandelier.It totally sealed the whole experience..would definitely return and recommend to all :)

Reviews.Title: “A great place to stay”
Reviews.Author: Rugbyrefbognor
Reviews.Content: We had a Standard room at this hotel which overlooks the Grand Canal near it's western end. The room was very comfortable with all facilities and, thank goodness, had quiet and easily adjustable air conditioning. The furnishings were traditional and pleasing. The large bed was firm, which suited us. To sleep one must shut the exterior blinds. This is done by opening both windows. The handle has to be in the horizontal mode to first open the right hand window inwards Then the left is opened by raising upwards the thin metal lever inside the recessed frame itself near the base. ( I make this comment as other reviewers have had difficulty cloing blinds). The room lacked tea and coffee making facilities which was a shame. This is a traditionally built hotel so do not expect large sunlit Standard rooms. The room was well serviced daily. The main rooms of the hotel are very pleasing, light, and very tastefully furnished. One can eat in the restaurant where the food is very good indeed. We took the half board option and had our dinner outside. This great as we watched canal traffic etc Breakfast provided a full range of continental cold and hot dishes. For those who wish to dine elsewhere,there is a good choice of Restaurants along the nearby Novo canal. We found the staff to be excellent. Receptionists were cheerful helpful and did their best to answer my stupid questions! The waiters were first class! Special mention must go to Fillipo, Enrique, and Andrea who made our dining experience so memorable. (my partner's 60th birthday!) The hotel is only 3 to 5 minutes from the Piazale Roma bus station, and also the Waterbus and Railway Stations opposite. For those who like to walk and explore (and Venice is so much worth it), Reception will provide a very useful map which shows all the main places of interest. Venice is quite compact and visual surprises and delights await you around every corner. It takes about 40 minutes to walk to Piazza San Marco. For non walkers, It is worth buying a ACTV Waterbus pass (32 Euros for 72 hours unlimited travel). With the pass you can visit and explore the islands of Guidecca, (great views of Venice'interesting churches,and cheaper bars etc) and Murano. Any "free" boat to Murano should be treated with care. One can end up at a glassworks of an associate of the driver and be given a really hard sell with no promise of a boat back! The No2 Bus is faster to San Marco than the No1 which stops everywhere. Yes Venice is expensive,but this hotel provides really good value, comfort and convenience.

Reviews.Title: “Very enjoyable break!”
Reviews.Author: Gary290
Reviews.Content: As the name suggests the hotel sits right on the grand canal and whilst it's true that it's the opposite end of the canal from San Marco, it's perfectly located for transport links. Immediately across the grand canal from the hotel is the train station and the piazzale roma bus terminal is a five minute walk from the hotel. There are vaporetto stops directly opposite the hotel so you can easily reach the other parts of venice- though we found it perfectly possible to walk from the hotel to san marco.
