Walking also provides the perfect opportunity to "get lost" in the small (tiny?) venetian streets/piazzas. The hotel service is excellent and while the rooms are small, they are perfectly clean. Besides if you spend any more than sleeping time in your room, you're rather missing the point of being in venice! I'd also like to compliment the breakfast, very good indeed.

Reviews.Title: “Awesome trip great hotel”
Reviews.Author: TonyNev
Reviews.Content: Getting there:- From Airport grab the shuttle coach (5euros each) took about 20mins and they run all the time and comfy. from the Bus station your only about 3 mins walk along the grand canal and over two bridges. Reception:- Very swift check in and a great informative male receptionist - Gave us a map that we used for the whole trip and advice on how to get around. Bar - Not used but very ventian with good choice of drinks. Price not the hoghest but not the cheapest Bottle of beer 7e wine by the glass 6e but you are on the grand canal looking at all the hussle bussle of venice. Restrurant not used but again prices comparative. Breakfast - good selection of food - meats, cereals, toast, cousaints were gorgeous. nice to grab some fruit before heading out. Staff great. Room - All you could need and very Ventian with its plaster workk on the head board and around the room. Clean tidy and very comfy bed. bathroom very clean. TV nice with BBC news to keep uptodate plus lots of other euro channels for others. Court yard out the back nice to sit and have drinks with friends Roof top bar.............only bad experience wante dto get a late night drinks and one member of staff with some very rude russian guests so the poor lad was rushed off his feet so we gave up! more not his fault. Location very easy to get around - main vaperetto stop over bridge 1 and 2 takes you down through the grand canel. Go out hotel and wal left and then first left and walk to Academia bridge great walk and lovely sites and this is a little off of the Tourist route and some great squares to sit and have coffee / wine / beer / food Went with some friends and loved it. Make sure you take a trip to Burano lovely pituresque island.

Reviews.Title: “Memorable short break”
Reviews.Author: 123HappyTraveller
Reviews.Content: The hotel is in an ideal location. Had a lovely room with balcony over-looking the Grand Canal. The staff were all very nice and well-mannered. They made us feel very welcome. It was a surprise trip for our Golden Wedding Anniversary and one we will always remember. We can certainly recommend the hotel for a memorable stay.

Reviews.Title: “Convenient location”
Reviews.Author: Alexj44
Reviews.Content: Located right across the grand canal from the Train Station, and with many rooms with balconies overlooking the Grand Canal this hotel is worth considering. The con is that is quite far from San Marco's Square. Rooms are small but clean.

Reviews.Title: “Remarkable Stay”
Reviews.Author: Romela57
Reviews.Content: The two days at the Carlton at Venice, in the month of August were rather memorable. The hotel is so well located that we spent one entire evening sitting outside at their canal side restaurant . The room though small was clean and comfortable. The staff gave us a map and directed us to all the right spots. The second day we had to check out in time but our train was late in the evening. The hotel provided us a baggage storage facility. The hotel has a free water taxi that takes you to Murano island. This was indeed a welcome surprise. Would love to go back to this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Hotel was nice, but we expected more”
Reviews.Author: Mharrington53
Reviews.Content: As the review title says, the hotel was nice and it was in a convenient location to the train station (right across the canal) so that eliminated the need for a transfer. The lobby and staff we great, but the room was very dated and definitely could use an update. As European hotels differ from American, I expected the four star rating to reflect somewhat less than what you wold expect in the U.S., and that was pretty much the case. The room was tiny and the bathroom even tinier, but again, it's Europe so that is the case in most instances. The location is good, as there is a vaparetto line right near by to take you wherever you need to go. Overall a pretty good hotel, but based on the four star expectation I would recommend that a traveler temper their expectations,

Reviews.Title: “Very Good Hotel. Good Location”
Reviews.Author: Travelor-eume
Reviews.Content: Good location, nice rooms, good food, good service, friendly staff. We highly recommend this hotel. We would definitely stay again.

Reviews.Title: “We liked it and we'll be back”
Reviews.Author: Vladks
Reviews.Content: NIce 4 star (European stars) hotel right on the Grand Canal! Nice restaurant and nice free breakfast. Free Wi-Fi which helps! Great location for cruisers taken cruise or arriving in the Port of Venice.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location + Friendly staff”
Reviews.Author: A-Villan
Reviews.Content: We stayed at this hotel for few nights on our trip to Venice, and we enjoyed it, except for few negative experiences. But first, let me point out the good things about this hotel: 1- Location of the hotel is wonderful. It is on the grand canal, and right across from the train station. You only have to cross one bridge and you're there, barely a 5 min walk. Also, this hotel is near a major street, on which you will find many restaurants, grocery stores, shops (gift shops, brands, big chain retailers, etc). This street is very packed with tourists and locals, and if you walk through this street for about 15 to 25 min (depending on how fast you walk), you will find yourself at San Mark's square, where all the action is. However, even if you decide to stick to the area near the hotel, that area is also very well alive. 2- The rooms at the hotel are very clean and its decorated in a classic Venetian style. Housekeeping staff are really friendly, and will always smile at you and welcome you. 3- Receptionists were really friendly and helpful. They will gleefully answer any question you have and will guide you to any place you want to go, and they will also inform you of all the options available to you in terms of how to get there. They will make it easy for you, especially if this is your first time to Venice and you know nothing about it. Now on to the bad stuff at this hotel: 1- In our second day at the hotel, we returned to the room and found it all cleaned up and shiny, but the housekeeper had removed the soap bar from the bathroom, and did not provide new one. We called housekeeping and asked for a soap bar. No one showed up at the door. Later on, we discovered a storage room for housekeeping on our floor which had soap bars, fresh towels, etc. The room was unlocked, so we took what we needed. 2- No wi fi service in rooms. If you want to access the internet, you have to go to the bar and get a password from the bartender. Very inconvenient, and connection speed was horrible. Overall, the good things outweigh the bad things at this hotel. The location alone is worth another stay at this hotel. I would certainly come back to this hotel the next time I'm in Venice.

Reviews.Title: “Book this hotel if you are going on a cruise!”
Reviews.Author: Bertago
Reviews.Content: Together with my girlfriend, I was visiting Venice and stayed at Hotel Carlton on the Grand Canal in the end of August 2011 (26-27.08.2011). This hotel is a great hotel if you are going on a cruise out of Venice. It is a short walk to Piazzale Roma (bus station) and across the Grand Canal you got the train station. From Piazzale Roma you can use the People mover to go to the cruise harbour. The location of the hotel is fairly good also for the main attractions - aprox. 30 min walk to Piazza San Marco, and not too far away from an vaparetto stop. Service at the reception was good and friendly, the breakfast was quite ok for a 4 star hotel, and I was very happy for the free wifi in the bar. The hotel room was nice, but with a bit narrow bathroom. This was on the other hand compensated with the french balcony with an amazing view of the Grand Canal. We would definitely return to this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Great Spot on the Grand Canal”
Reviews.Author: spensabrog
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Carlton for 3 nights in August. The Carlton was a perfect location for our family with two children ages 9 and 7. It is located at the beginning of the Grand Canal and since we drove it was just a short walk over a bridge to the hotel. It is located at the opposite end of St. Marks square but water taxis and the vaparetto is located right outside. The location was quiet in the evening and we felt very safe and comfortable. We walked most of the time because it is the best way to see the real Venice. The service was professional and ready to answer any questions that we had about what to see and do. The breakfast was perfect for the kids as well as the parents. The rooms were clean and the maid service perfect. The only bad thing that we could say is that our room did not have a view of the Grand Canal. We would recommend staying here!!!!

Reviews.Title: “Amazing location”
Reviews.Author: prwallah
Reviews.Content: We spent a night at the Carlton and Grand Canal hotel on our holiday. It has a fantastic location as it is located on the canal with a fine restaurant that affords a wonderful view of the canal. The hotel is walking distance from the railway station which is across the canal. Our room, though small was very clean with comfortable beds. The hotel serves a good breakfast. The staff speaks English and is very friendly and helpful. The hotel provides you with a facility to leave your baggage after check out, roam around the town and pick it up in case you have a late evening train. We asked the reception on the major sightseeing areas. The gentleman produced a map and outlined the route which turned out to be the best walking tour we have had in Italy. Thanks to the helpful nature of the hotel staff we saw Venice at leisure and on our own terms. The hotel provides a free water taxi to go to see the glass factory at Murano. Would stay here if we were to visit Venice again.

Reviews.Title: “Large Room, comfortable stay, close to sights”
Reviews.Author: Traveller1991
Reviews.Content: We've just returned from a weekend stay at the carlton. Overall it was lovely, we had a large room which was slightly dated (however their was a classical theme, I think we may have been in an older room). The hotel is within walking distance to st Marks square and the Rialto etc. It is also close to resturants and shops (lots of lovely murano glass) and is directly opposite the train station and near to water bus stops. We ate out both nights but both breakfast and dinners smelled delicious and looked plentiful. Just remember the city tax which during Aug 2011 was 4 euro per person per night which you pay on check out. Hope this helps....Enjoy your stay.

Reviews.Title: “A Lovely Hotel”
Reviews.Author: Keith L
Reviews.Content: My wife & I stayed here over the long week end in August 2011, and were delighted. We caught bus No5 from Marco Polo airport for â‚¬5 each, arriving at the Piazzale Roma about 30 mins later. The routes shown from here on their web site map are correct, but the shortest & easiest is to head toward the glass bridge across the road, but not go over it. Rather take the steps down on the right, then over 2 small bridges (keeping slightly left, with the Grand Canal on your left) and the hotel is a short distance down on your right. Staff are welcoming, friendly and most helpful, speaking excellent English into the bargain, as most locals do. Enrico was most attentive at meal times, as well as at the outdoor tables where we spent most late evenings soaking up the atmosphere. Our room was at the back on the 1st floor, so no noise at all. Having said that, it didn't appear to get noisy at night anyway. Bedrooms & corridors are decorated in 18th century style, so not to be confused with being "old fashioned" or in need of updating. Lobby and lounge are more modern. Someone commented about their room being dark, even during the day. I can only guess that it was due to the window shutter not being opened. A thin, flat braided nylon cord is found by the window, pulling on this will open the shutter, which is normally left closed to help keep the rooms cool. The water bus stop is directly across the Grand Canal from the hotel, as is the train station. We bought a 36hr unlimited use ticket each for â‚¬23 (there are many others to be had) and found it the best for getting around. This offers use of any of the route numbers, but we used No 1 manly - which stops at every stop. No 2 stops less frequently, so can be considered the faster alternative. Dont forget to validate your ticket before boarding at the machines. This goes for the bus too! We would highly recommend this hotel for location, helpful staff as well as comfort and value for money.

Reviews.Title: “lovely hotel”
Reviews.Author: UkBlondie047
Reviews.Content: We've just got back after staying at the Hotel Carlton and was unable to find any faults. The postion of the hotel is handy for both the train and bus station which we managed with ease, the folk at the bus depot were helpful. All the staff at the hotel are friendly and helpful, the room was clean with a comfortable bed, breakfast had a good choice so all in all we had a lovely holiday.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful Rooms with stunning views....”
Reviews.Author: brockbanks
Reviews.Content: Our group comprised of 3 Adults and 1 child (14 years old). Firstly I must say that the trip to Venice was fulfilling a dream of my Mother who is in recovery after suffering a serious illness in 2010. The Hotel were aware of this and although we had already booked Superior Rooms, gave us beautiful rooms with a view of the Grand Canal. This made the trip so much more special for my Mum, and I can't thank the Hotel enough for this. LOCATION: The Hotel is a five-ten minute walk from the nearest parking area Garage San Marco- a cost of 30 Euro's per night, but the hotel provides a 10% discount on this at the end of your stay). We stayed during Italy's recent Heatwave, so even this short walk over 2 bridges with suitcases was tough going! However, in usual temperatures this would be okay for most. If you arent in the best of health then you can use Water Porter's for a cost of around 30 Euros to transport your bags. HOTEL: The Hotel is in a lovely setting- right on the side of the Canal, with comfortable chairs and tables positioned outside so that you can watch the world go by! Inside, the entrance is impressive and opulent, with marble and comfortable sofas and chairs and flower displays filled with Orchids. The rooms we stayed in had Cancal Views and fabric on the walls with extravagent headboards on the bed, murano glass light fittings and elegant mirrors! Beautiful and VERY Venetian. The Bathrooms were large and spotlessly clean. We had just a shower in ours but it was large and the pressure was good. My Mother had a bath and a shower- although she did warn that she was glad she wasnt overweight as I understand the bath was little on the snug side! Be warned if you are a larger bear! Both rooms had air conditioning that worked well, and large windows that you could open to expose wonderful vista's! FACILITIES We mainly visited the Hotel Bar. The drinks are as reasonable as Hotel Prices can be and are accompanied by Canapes, Salted Peanuts and Crisps...if you order tea or coffee you get Biscuits! It is all spotlessly clean and you feel very indulgent! If you visit, I hope that you are lucky enough to be served by Dario- professional, friendly,welcoming and so hardworking....it was such a pleasure to meet him and we much preferred him to the slightly grumpy Maitre D's! . FOOD- My only criticism of this hotel is that on our first morning we went to Breakfast Buffet Style) and I found what appeared to be 'Fruit Flies' crawling all over the bread.....LOTS of them. The Lids on the scrambled egg and Bacon canteens had also been left open and again, more flies were gathering. This turned my stomach and as a result I didn't eat a meal in the hotel again...but this was my only criticism and can be easily remedied. PS: Room Service is pretty scace- think it was offered between 12 and 2 and then again between 7 and 10 approx...but then why are you sitting in your room when in Venice?!! :) OVERALL- A lovely Hotel..if ever we returned to Venice, we would definitely stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “If over 180 cm tall, best to stay elsewhere.”
Reviews.Author: David A
Reviews.Content: We chose to stay at the. At the Carlton Capri (sister hotel) although only three stars compared to four, I preferred the reviews. On arrival at the Capri, we were advised that we were upgraded to the four star Carlton on the Grand Canal. We thought this could not be that bad. The bed I. The room is two single beds joined together. And at 192cm or 6 foot 3 inches, this was going to be a bit of a problem. Tried sleeping the first night, a little difficult. My partner asked reception in the morning if they had bigger beds, ad was advised that beds were about 180cm long. So if you are over 5 foot 9 in height and don't like your feet hanging over the end of the bed you may want to look elsewhere. You are also only provided with two flat pillows, I would expect spare pillows for a four star hotel. I personally prefer two pillows, especially if they are flat. The air conditioner in our room was a little noisy, this may have been more noticeable due to the fact that I had trouble sleeping due to the side of the bed. I am writing this at 3.00am in the morning as 8 can't sleep. Wifi Internet acces is only available in the cafe on the ground floor.first four star hotel we have stayed in Europe that we have not had access to wifi in our room. Seems to becoming the standard, as it is easier to make your next booking. Apart from the bed size (tiny when you are 192c, and your partner is 178 cm, staff are friendly and speak English and location to the train Station is excellent. I would have preferred to stay at the hotel of my choice which was the Capri, as. My experience in Europe my room was not up to four star quality. Management, two single beds stuck together is not what one would expect from a four star hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Convenient Location for Trains & Bus”
Reviews.Author: grandfatherbay
Reviews.Content: This hotel was a disappointment. We had two rooms and found them to be dated and "tired". One of our initial rooms had clearly been used by a smoker, even though we were told the rooms were non-smoking. There was some resistance to finding us another room, but eventually they did. Rooms are dark (and they keep shutters down during the day), so the first thing you have to do is get that shutter open. The A/C was temperamental and the room did get warm. At some point they did renovate rooms in this hotel but now they desperately need updated bedspreads/bedding and baths. Rooms are small, but that is not unexpected in Venice. We chose the hotel because of its proximity to the train station, just over the bridge. Also the very close-by bus hub was a big convenience since our daughter was flying in to meet us in Venice and the bus is a good way to easily get into the city from the airport. The Vaporetto dock was by the train station and water taxis were right by the hotel. From a transportation perspective it was very convenient. Breakfast service is adequate and there was free wi-fi in the lobby bar area. The hotel was booked and some of the cruise lines do use this venue for passengers. Staff was generally rushed â€“ but then part of that is just Venice.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect location for exploring!!”
Reviews.Author: blondehabs
Reviews.Content: Spent one night before boarding cruise. Be prepared to walk a little distance from the vehicle drop off / taxi stand. The walk from the taxi / bus drop off includes many steps. But if you are up for the walk and lugging your luggage you will be fine. About a 10min hike. But you are walking along the canal, so who cares! Drive from Marco Polo airport was less than 10min. in a private car. Arrived at the hotel and was greeted by nice staff. We were not lucky enough to have a canal view, but we did have a first floor garden view. Standard room was very large and bathroom was very spacious. After getting settled, we started exploring. We had been to Venice several times, so we were just out for a walk and dinner. You can go out the front entrance of the hotel and turn right and you can find tons of cafe's, souviner stands/shops, shoe stores, many pharamacy's, not to mention the canal and the water taxies. Easy to navigate around and make your way back to the hotel. Bar area was nice. Breakfast buffet was large and very nice european choices. Check out was easy. We were taking a cruise and the shittle service was in the hotel directing us where to go for the bus ride.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful!”
Reviews.Author: Susan G
Reviews.Content: This hotel was very close to the Piazzale Roma which was very convenient to get to from the airport and then to get to the port for our cruise ship the next day. Even before we left, the contact at the hotel, Jessica, gave us so much information on how to get to the hotel. *Warning*: at the airport, the man at the taxi desk tried to rip us off. He kept insisting that the ONLY way to get to the hotel was via one of his water taxis (100 euros!) or a private taxi (170 euros!!). I knew this was incorrect because Jessica had told us about these options as well as private car, private taxi, taxi, and bus. (He was trying to make it seem as though you can only get there through water ways and failed to mention the bridge that connects the island to the mainland so that cars can cross.) This made me so upset that he was trying to take advantage of us since he was at the official desk at the airport, not out on his own. That was very deceiving and had I not had all the advice from the lovely hotel, I never would have known. We ended up walking outside to try to find a taxi ourselves and ended up taking the ATVO bus, which I had been hesitant to take at first, for only 5 euros a piece! It was fast and drops you at the same place a private car would have (in the Piazzale Roma). The only way to get dropped directly in front of the hotel is by water taxi, but there are so many other options--don't feel you can't have options! From there it is a 5-10 minute walk along the canal (over a couple of bridges) to the hotel. It wasn't really fun to walk over the bridges with our luggage, but doable so we could save 100+ euros in travel. (Hint: once you get pointed in the right direction to get the hotel--just walk toward the canal--don't take the huge bridge. Go down the steps on the right and walk along the right side of the canal and the hotel will be on that side after crossing 2 white stone bridges. It's a little shorter.) Another plus about this hotel is the amazing breakfast we had included. We got there so early on the day of our arrival that we were able to enjoy it once we got there and it was so filling: cereal, eggs, sausage, fruit, pastries, toast, bagels, cream cheese...mmmm. The rooms are small, but expected since European luxury hotels are different from those in America. There was a small fridge, but they have things for purchase in it so you can only fit in a can or two of your own soda. We had a room that had a balcony that overlooks the canal which I highly recommend. We had a lovely breeze, could sit out and people watch, and got some great pictures of it all lit up at night. In the bathroom, there was even an outlet that was compatible with US cords. I hadn't purchased a converter since we were going on a cruise line, but it was handy so we could plug in a curling iron or charge our laptop (it is placed within the wall though, so you'd need a cord and not a charger that lies flush with the wall like some camera chargers). Also, the location is near a lot of great shopping. Just cross the bridge over to the side of the train station (the side opposite the hotel) and walk and walk to find gelato, food, shops, farmer's markets, churches, you name it. You can get a gondola ride too. The next day, to get to the port, we walked back (again, it's easier to walk along the canal on the side the hotel is on, not the train station as the bridges are a little shorter) to the Piazzale Roma and took the People Mover for only 1 euro a piece. Then it was a little walk to the terminal and we were on the ship!

Reviews.Title: “Lovely hotel in great location - wish we had a view”
Reviews.Author: kcw531
Reviews.Content: Our family of 6 stayed here in two rooms for two nights. The hotel is located right across the canal from the train station, a short walk away, so excellent for train travelers. Water taxi is right there as well. The hotel is elegantly decorated, and our rooms clean with unique provincial furnishings. The drawback of our rooms was that they were on the second floor, with no view, and were very dark inside as the windows faced a wall. One room was extremely dark inside even during the middle of a sunny day and we needed to keep all lights on while there. Considering that we were in this amazing city right on the canal with beautiful sights in every direction, any kind of view would have been nice. Nonetheless, our stay was pleasant. The breakfast room was attractive, clean, and well stocked. The front desk staff, while not overly friendly, was cordial and helpful. Free wifi in the lounge area was a plus.

Reviews.Title: “Great place to stay”
Reviews.Author: Classy_Chica
Reviews.Content: I enjoyed our stay here. We were given a choice of two rooms both nice but smallish, opted for the one that was longer, was spacious, good sized bathroom and the room beautifully decorated which gave a romantic/authentic vibe. The staff were friendly, great for asking advise, variety of good breakfast that you could have outside on balcony by the canal and the location was good. Everything is pretty central, we got a pass to use the water buses for our stay but didnâ€™t really need it as everything was an enjoyable walking distance and they donâ€™t really check tickets. Got a bus from the airport and you can walk to the hotel from there-needed to ask for directions but not far at all. Would definitely recommend this hotel and four days is more than enough to see the whole of venice.

Reviews.Title: “Hotel Carlton was the best choice!”
Reviews.Author: LBTravelDesign
Reviews.Content: Last month, I stayed at the Hotel Carlton for two nights as the tour manager of an American group. This hotel, with its wonderful location, top-notch service and great amenities was the best choice for our group. We arrived at the hotel via the Piazzale Roma where our airport transport buses left us. We did have two foot bridges to cross and even though the walk to the hotel was only 5 min. away, crossing the bridges while towing luggage was difficult for some members of the group. For our departure, we hired a private porterage service that was efficient and reasonably-priced. If you stay at this hotel with or without a group, consider hiring a porterage service. As for the hotel, the rooms are designed in elegant Venetian style with comfortable beds, very nice linens and clean bathrooms. As the tour manager, I saw several members' rooms and all were consistent and lovely. A few members also had balconies overlooking the Grand Canal which was delightful for them! The breakfast buffet each day was a nice selection of delicious offerings. One of our most pleasant surprises during our stay was the group dinner we arranged at the Hotel's restaurant under the superb management of Filippo. The food was fantastic matched by the high level of service by the courteous staff. In addition, I want to thank one of the hotel managers, Serenella Poletto, for her kind and attentive service to our group. For groups or individuals, the Hotel Carlton on the Grand Hotel is a terrific choice and I would not hesitate to recommend this hotel to anyone. Thank you for a marvelous stay in Venice!

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful, enjoy!”
Reviews.Author: Sqwhirl
Reviews.Content: Great staff, best breakfast anywhere! Lovely room looking on to the grand canal. Would have stayed longer if we could. Thanks for a great stay.

Reviews.Title: “Great location and pleasant staff but......”
Reviews.Author: mizdarcy
Reviews.Content: My 16 year old granddaughter and I booked Venice a "city stay" through Gate 1 Travel. I upgraded their basic offering to this 4 start selection. While the hotel is in a very nice location but it is on the opposite side of the canal from the Vaporetto etc. making it necessary to cross the bridge to get to transportation. Our room did not live up to my expectation. Although the room was nicely decorated the carpet was very worn and the furnishing could have used some updating. The mattresses were typically European (e.g. very little padding) but we were so tired at night that that did not become an issue. We were in room #121 and the textured glass door to the bathroom was installed backwards. If you were in the room you could see right through into the bathroom, however, if you were in the bathroom you could not see out! To preserve modesty we hung a blanket over the door when showering etc.! We also noticed that when entering the first floor the hallway to where our room was located very dark and not well lit, with a very narrow hallway and worn carpet, while the hall leading off in the opposite direction was extremely well lit. with a wide hallway. I was expecting a better room having paid extra for the upgrade. The bathroom also had some mold on the ceiling and on some of the bath tiles.

Reviews.Title: “Small and worn room, but excellent location”
Reviews.Author: ActRegular_traveller
Reviews.Content: We stayed here as part of a tour group for 2 nights in June. There was at least one other tour group there at the same time as us. The hotel is well situated, just across the Grand Canal from the railway station and about 200 metres away from the bus station. However, being Venice there are bridges across canals to negotiate. The hotel seems to be quite old and renovation hasnâ€™t been all that recent either. However, there was a lift â€“ not all that common in Venice I gather. Our room (162) was quite small with only enough room for the double bed and small side tables and a minimum of furniture. There was very little circulating space. The bathroom was also quire compact with the shower in a Â¾ bath and very little shelf space. The door to the bathroom closed but couldnâ€™t be latched. We had a view of an internal courtyard. A safe was provided and there was a TV, minibar and hairdryer provided. There was cable internet for a fee (5 Euro/hr or 12 Euro/day)but the cable connection was nowhere within reach of a power point â€“ we had to pull out the minibar and disconnect it and the TV to have power. Breakfast was reasonable although the layout was odd â€“ a feature of the arrangement of the area they were set up in. Only an average hotel anywhere else, but given difficulties of changing almost anything in Venice they did a fairly reasonable job on this hotel and given the central location Iâ€™d give it a 4.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, small rooms, pleasant stay”
Reviews.Author: Susieqtravelpro
Reviews.Content: Ideal location for train station and water buses. Clean smart rooms. Basic continental breakfast with nice coffee to start your day. Nicer 4 star hotel than my friends 4 star experience at the Hotel Amadeus. Minibar (I used the fridge for my own water) safe, CNN and BBC on little flat screen TV. Wireless in the bar area next to lobby only. Clean updated bathroom.

Reviews.Title: “Three stars Hotel Carlton Capri (sister hotel) is better organised!”
Reviews.Author: cmieux
Reviews.Content: The Hotel lobby gives the impression that you are in a 4 stars Hotel. This impression vanishes when you enter your room : 6 hangbers, and 1 shelve. That<s all you get for your luggage. They advertise internet connection but your laptop has to rest on your knees. Plus the room are half cleaned, dust is apparent and the carpet look dirty. Last year we stayed at the Carlton Capri, a 3 stars sister hotel located behind. Room and corridors were cleaned and it is a lot better organised for travellers and the reception personnal less snob. My advice, if you want to be near the train station, stay at the Carlton Capri. Jimmy

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful Venice experience”
Reviews.Author: holiday84Sydney
Reviews.Content: This hotel made our stay in Venice just fantastic. We arrived by train. Just about a 5 minute walk over the bridge on the grand canal and we were at the hotel. We had three suitcases so it was great as we didn't have to carry our luggage far. This hotel faces the Grand Canal and the ferries and the water taxis are right outside it, how convenient! We could walk everywhere, which we did. Just a short walk to the Rialto bridge, or St Mark's square through lovely little alleyways and saw the true Venice architecture, just loved it. The hotel staff were so helpful, our room was delightful and very clean and comfortable. We stayed for 3 days. A full buffet breakfast was included in the price and there were lots of choices to cater to everyone's needs. It was delicious. Outside the hotel they had tables and chairs under shade where we sipped our wine and watched the organised chaos on the water. We will definitely stay there next time we come back to Venice. The only place for us!

Reviews.Title: “Very comfortable!”
Reviews.Author: gh27
Reviews.Content: I had grown accustomed to uncomfortable, expensive European hotel rooms but this one pleasantly surprised me. Spacious bathroom, great air conditioning in room, very nice breakfast buffet, beds that were actually comfortable and extra pillows, blankets, and towels. Excellent location next to the Roma Piazzale.

Reviews.Title: “Beyond Beautiful”
Reviews.Author: kyra_10
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed here for a reconnect weekend. We couldn't have asked for more. The location is a 3 minute walk from the parking area and directly across from the train station. The room was elegant and charming. The food was impeccable. And the staff was gracious. Shopping and restaurants are a 2 minute walk, and yet the hotel is not in the heart of the tourist throb. (A PLUS for us as we don't like to feel crowded.) All in all, this was one of our most perfect and memorable stays, and we can't wait to go back!

Reviews.Title: “Perfect Location and Great Hotel”
Reviews.Author: steverino27
Reviews.Content: Just a few minutes walk from the train station with our rolling suitcases was easy. The ferry dock is near, as are restaurants and everything else is either walking distance or a short boat ride away. Our room was clean and furnished nicely, although it wasn't very large, but we also had a private terrace with table and chairs. We enjoyed breakfast and service was friendly and prompt. We will definitely stay here on our next trip to Venice.

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel, frendly stuff, quite location.”
Reviews.Author: OIS72
Reviews.Content: We liked staying at the hotel due to the nice design and very frendly stuff. We had our rooms on the last floor and even the standard room had a big and very nice terrace (good for having breackfast or a Prosseco there). A minus is a location ( a bit too far from the city center) but the minus bekomes a plus in the night as it is a very quite place.

Reviews.Title: “Nice.....”
Reviews.Author: badabing51
Reviews.Content: Having no other hotel in Venice to compare it to, I would say it was probably very, very average and maybe above average. It was getting aged but then we are talking about Venice. All of Venice is aging. Small rooms (by Canadian standards) but it was okay for our stay with Insight Tours. Right on the Canal so could watch the daily comings and goings! Great corner grocery store over the bridge and past the bus station.

Reviews.Title: “Absolutely beautiful”
Reviews.Author: Elphaba175
Reviews.Content: First and foremost, the hotel is located fantastically. You can't miss it when you step out of the station - it's directly across the water! There was fantastic communication with a woman in their offices called Jessica, who just went above and beyond. At the time of booking, we didn't have a credit card and they don't accept debits. But as it was where we really wanted to stay, Jessica was extremely helpful in helping us do a bank transfer. It went smoothly, with no problems at all, and she was quick to contact us to tell us all payment had been received. Her English was perfect and her manners and friendly nature just added to the experience before we'd even got their! She also encouraged us to get in touch nearer the time to be given a list of trips, exhibitions etc that were on to get the most out of our stay. The man at reception was extremely friendly - we arrived rather early so they put our luggage in secure storage and were welcome to stay in their rather beautiful waiting area, but decided to go for a wander to kill time. We had asked for the "cheapest" (if a room in an amazing 4* hotel can be cheap!) room which would overlook a courtyard, but to our surprise, someone had actually upgraded us, which we werent told to begin with. The porter who accompanied us to our room with our luggage took great pleasure in being the one to tell us we'd be pleasantly surprised, and seemed about as thrilled as we were when we opened the shutters on the window to find we'd been upgraded to a room with a view of the Grand Canal! Amazing. The room, needless to say, was absolutely stunning. It wasn't huge but it didn't need to be at all, and technically we shouldn't have even been in that room! Beautiful big bathroom with a great shower and all other amenities you could possibly want. The cleaner did an absolutely amazing job with our room - it was immaculate. This was our first experience in a 4* hotel so having porters etc do things for you was strange...in a good way, and they were politely insistent that they took our luggage - the only thing that upset me was the way the cleaner would apologise when she knocked to clean the room to find out we hadn't gone out yet, and when she walked across the corridor in front of us and again, apologised. It was absolutely not a problem in the slightest - she was lovely and did a very good job, though we wouldn't have minded if she'd left the room as it was! It just makes me wonder how other guests who do expect the 5* treatment all the time treated the "help" staff there. We tipped very well at the end of our two nights stay because she had worked so hard. I don't care if it's expected of them, they deserve some credit. The breakfast buffet...well, I've never seen anything like it! It was beautiful. It just had your standard buffet food, but I think it's partly to do with the room it was all laid out in. It was just fantastic. The food quality was beautiful too and the waiting staff again were lovely and very attentive. We didn't use their evening restaurant service because we ate out each night, but the menu sounded lovely. And it was a great addition having an accordion player outside our room one evening! The hotel also offers a great private gondola tour deal with the gondoliers just outside the building. We had initially thought it was 100 Euros per person, but we had expected the cost to be high so went for it anyway. It was, in fact, 100 Euros for the tour, so for the two of us it was just 50 Euros. The boats could seat between 5 or 6 people though, so in the event of a family tour, the price is great. Our gondolier was lovely, and it was nice to have the boat to ourselves. We went up the Grand Canal and he gave us a guided tour, then he took us round the back streets as it were between all the ols houses and their hotels. The whole thing lasted 35 minutes and we were serenaded too. The hight of romance if that's your thing! It really was the highlight of our Venice trip. In all, 5/5 for this hotel for food, service, room, sleep quality etc. What I loved about this place was the quality of work and effort from everybody - from the manager to the cleaners. A hotel can't function without a decent, strong body of staff who are all important, no matter how "low" their position would appear when ranked. A brilliant hotel that I would definitely stay in again.

Reviews.Title: “wonderful location”
Reviews.Author: flo1020
Reviews.Content: very nice hotel situated across from train station on the grand canal. unimpressive breakfast. nice room.

Reviews.Title: “Fabulous location, great breakfast, pleasant staff”
Reviews.Author: My2Cintz
Reviews.Content: My wife and I stayed at Hotel Carlton for two nights and would recommend the hotel for it's unbeatable location and helpful staff. They also serve very nice complimentary breakfast. As the name suggests, the hotel is located on the Grand Canal. It is right across the canal from the train station and a vaporetto stop (waterbus) making it ideal for arrivals and departures in Venice and beyond. The room we stayed in was small and not luxurious but comfortable and clean. The hotel does not offer wi-fi. All in all considering location, price and helpful staff, I would rate the hotel very good and would recommend it to people who prize location and value over 5-star luxury.

Reviews.Title: “Not the place I will remember Venice for.”
Reviews.Author: ALS85
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed here as part of a group holiday tour and we were very disappointed. The room was tired with poor furniture and small beds even though we were in a triple. The view was directly into someone elses appartment down an alleyway. The bathroom was bizarre with the towel rail in the shower. Tiles had been replaced and the taps were rusty. Breakfast was adequate. On the plus side nice reception area and good location if you dont mind walking or taking the vaporetto. Not really 4* quality

Reviews.Title: “Location is Awesome!”
Reviews.Author: Quilting4Cats
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the Carlton for two nights as part of a tour group. The location was incredible...right on the grand canal and easy access to everything. The rooms were small and a little outdated, but clean and comfortable. There is no wireless at this hotel, only ethernet which is 12 euros per day. The bar/restaurant is a little pricey, but you have to remember that everything is brought in on boats, so there is a premium price on things. We took a water taxi to St. Mark's square and walked back through the narrow streets of Venice. The walk back was incredible, but it does take about 45-60 minutes depending on how much you stop and look at all the shops along the way! Doge's Palace is absolutely incredible and a must see as well as the glass factory. Took a cruise to Barano Island and that was so peaceful and a welcome repreive from the crowds of Venice. Get up early and sit at the tables in front of the hotel to watch all of the supply boats come in. It is incredible to see these little boats coming down the canal with cases of water and dog food! Staff at the hotel were nice and very helpful with any questions we had. One of the unique charms of the hotel is that they still use real keys for the hotel rooms! You are given one key on a heavy key chain and leave it at the front desk when you leave. You then get a card that they fill out that you present to the desk when you return to collect your key. One thing you have to remember is to lock your hotel room door when you leave using the key!

Reviews.Title: “Good Hotel & lovely rooms”
Reviews.Author: derbyshirenomad
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for three nights and had the Deluxe Canal View Room (308). We took the private water taxi from the airport and arrived at the hotel and were collected from the pier by a porter. Check-in was efficient though not overly warming. Our room was sumptuously decorated, it was small but adequate and that matched our thoughts after reading the hotel reviews. The downside was the 1970's bathroom which was clean though out of character for the hotel and room. We had a nice view of the canal but right opposite is the rather stylish (in my view only) 1930s train station, whilst my wife was hoping for the more traditional Venice view. Breakfast was nice though charging 6.5euros for freshly squeezed orange juice is a bit of cheek. The hotel is slightly out of the way from the main sights, however getting lost on numerous occasions and finding delightful cafes made the trip all the more special. So all in all a lovely stay in Venice and we will return but to a different hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Very Pleasant Hotel”
Reviews.Author: RoyalCruiser
Reviews.Content: We chose to stay in the Hotel Carlton on the Grand Canal pre-cruise, and we spent two nights here. This is a good hotel, with friendly and efficient staff. We didn't eat in the hotel's restaurant but breakfast was most acceptable and plentiful. The lobby is attractive and full of light. My husband and I very much enjoyed sitting just outside the main entrance in comfortable chairs whilst having a drink watching both people and traffic on the busy stretch of water only a few feet away. We had booked a canal view room and were given one on the second floor. We liked the view but next time we would most probably book accommodation overlooking the patio because it was somewhat noisy. This was, of course, not the fault of the hotel although perhaps double or triple glazing on the windows and doors would help a lot. We also found there was very little cupboard space, which is fine if you are only staying for a night or so, but stay longer and you would definitely be living out of your suitcase! Nevertheless, we enjoyed the hotel and would probably repeat the experience.

Reviews.Title: “Hotel is beautiful”
Reviews.Author: sharon1108
Reviews.Content: This hotel is very well located to walk to many places. Staff is excellent. This was our second stay.

Reviews.Title: “Highly Recommended”
Reviews.Author: georgeturrall
Reviews.Content: There is only one way to arrive in Venice, and that is by water taxi,The Hotel Carlton on the Grand Canal has its own pier, and your luggage is taken from the boat, by an obliging porter to your room. If you must come by train, bus, or car, the Hotel Carlton is only 150 metres away across the bridge from the train station and a short distance from Plazzale Roma the bus station, so you are not hauling luggage to far. The Hotel accomodated our family of twelve. Six adults and six children in a family room sleeping four and two interconecting rooms twice sleeping two in each room. The rooms were spacious and clean with Murano glass chandeliers and wall lights. The hotel is elegant and the staff friendly and helpful and would highly recommend the Hotel

Reviews.Title: “Couldnt ask for a better location”
Reviews.Author: Tokyotravellers1207
Reviews.Content: Very convenient hotel. The staff were friendly and helpful and the hotel had a nice charm about it. Directly accross the canal from the train station and a very short walk from the bus terminal and water bus making access extremely easy, especially lugging suitcases. It was easy to get anywhere in Venice, even a nice stroll to St Marks, via the Rialto. Pay a little bit extra and go for the canal view room. Would definately stay again if we go back to Venice!

Reviews.Title: “EVEN BETTER THE SECOND TIME AROUND”
Reviews.Author: vcs049
Reviews.Content: This was my second stay within six months and the hotel was fantastic once again. The room was perfect (in the courtyard), the staff were brilliant. The food at breakfast and in the restaurant was exceptional and the bar staff could not do enough for my sister and I. I will be back before the end of the year and once again I will stay at this wonderful hotel. I have passed on the details of this property to all my friends in Australia (who are all great travellers) who will hopefully stay at this great property.

Reviews.Title: “For your first (or only) trip to Venice Stay at this Hotel!”
Reviews.Author: BPM18
Reviews.Content: My Wife and I, Daughter (and boy-friend) Stayed at the Carlton at the end of April 2011. My Daughter having visited Venice 4 years ago loved this Hotel so much she insisted we booked it for our first visit to Venice. We were not disappointed. The Hotel is full of Venetian character and reflects the ambiance of a bygone era of style and sophistication. The receptionist(s) on the desk all spoke good English and were always helpful - as were all the staff we met. Although small, the rooms we found very clean and comfortable-( and who wants to stay in your room in Venice!?) The location is fantastic, directly opposite is the Railway Station and the Vaporetto- Stops. Our room overlooked the Grand Canal and had a small "Romeo and Juliet" Styled Balcony. These rooms cost a little more but well worth it. The breakfast buffet is served between 7:30 and 10:00am. That kept us going for most of the day, there was a vast choice - too long to list, but included cereal, bacon, eggs and the full continental range of breakfast foods. In conclusion we loved our stay there and if we were to return to Venice it would be our first choice hotel; (we now know why our daughter wanted to return).

Reviews.Title: “Excellent hotel, helpful friendly staff and beautiful interior.”
Reviews.Author: tericollins
Reviews.Content: Just had a four night stay in junior rooftop suite. After booking was a bit concerned as I read a review that really put this room down. Am happy to say that we were delighted with the room and the terrace was great. We went knowing that the view was rooftops, but they were Venetian rooftops, pretty and some small terrace/balconies. Entire hotel was spotless and the staff were really helpful. The only thing I would have changed would have been tea/coffee facilities in the room and feather pillows. Breakfast was also more substantial than we had thought it would be. Thoroughly recommend it although overheard some Americans saying they were too hot of a night in their rooms.

Reviews.Title: “Venice - location perfect for Eurail arrivals”
Reviews.Author: RodandKaren
Reviews.Content: Get off the train, out of the station and see the hotel over the Grand Canal. A short walk and lugging your suitcases over the bridge [this city is not disabled friendly!] and you are there. Hotel is good, room was fine, restaurant excellent [apart from one snooty Italian waiter]. Surprisingly, no free WiFi. Be careful sign up for an hour [Euro5.00] and it means just that. Yes, we would stay again after realising that Venice is a very tourist and 'pay for everything' place. We will come back to this delightful and so different city.

Reviews.Title: “Fabulous, luxurious, glamorous...very Venezia!”
Reviews.Author: Lucia04162011
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed here while in Venice and loved it. They had eggs and bacon and toast for breakfast in case you are American looking for an American, not Italian Breakfast. (In Rome, try Alexander's on Via Veneto, they also have American Breakfast.) :) The Carlton is exactly what you expect from a Ritz Carlton: luxury, bathrobes, slippers, even shoe polish in the rooms. We were happy little clams here. They have luggage drop off if your train is early and you can leave your luggage once you check out before you train leaves. The rooms were clean, the staff was nice, and the food was good. **This hotel is literally directly across from the train station. St. Lucia. It is sooooo convenient. We have lots of luggage so its the best for us. Walk out of the Train station, hand a left, walk over the first and only bridge you see that everyone else is walking across, can't miss it. On the other side, hang a right, walk down about 100 meters, the Carlton is a yellow building, green awning (I think) on the right (obviously) lol. :) It couldn't be on the left or it would be in the water! Can't miss it. :) Have fun! We recommend this hotel and will stay again. Price? Its Venice, everything costs an arm and a leg: 340 Euro per Notte for a room on the Canal side, which we had. We also bought a Gondola ride for 120 Euro. Do the Gondola at least one in your lifetime. Lots of fun.

Reviews.Title: “only good position”
Reviews.Author: masssedighi
Reviews.Content: I have been there for 2 nights . In spite of good position - near the train station - we didnot have any view to the canal . Considering other cities in the world , it cannot be a 4 star hotel . The man at the desk told me : "You should not place your baby food in the minibar......minibar is only minibar..... bring it to the refrigerator at lower level ." ?????? There are many other good hotels in the Venice to choose .

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel would love to return in the near future.”
Reviews.Author: benson_10
Reviews.Content: This Hotel is a lovely hotel with friendly helpful staff, The position is very handy for the bus, train and vaporetta station, It is also easy to get around Venice either by foot or Canal boats, The room we had was on the fourth floor. From a lovely clean private patio we overlooked the interesting rooftops, dome, and over in the far distance you were just able to see the lagoon. When we arrived and were told we were on the fourth floor without a view of the canal, we were a little disappointed but when we were shown to the room it was great and we were very happy with the amount of space and outlook we had and the private patio. The bed was large and very comfortable and the furnishings were good. The concierge was very helpful to us, we arrived late at night he advised us on places were we could get food or offered to make us a sandwich. He was also very helpful explaining the area and how to get about. The person who cleaned our room was very thorough and changed towels and bedding daily she was also very pleasant and helpful. We did not have a meal in the restaurant as we wanted to experience more of Venice, Late in the afternoon We did ask for a snack and although it was officially closed until the evening the very pleasant Carlton Hotel restaurant manager prepared us a lovely assortment of cheese and rolls with a nice glass of wine served to us outside on the comfortable seats overlooking the Grand Canal. There were workmen across the way replacing roof tiles , suprisingly! They did not make any noise, used hand signals for tools, tiles etc, we have never seen builders before who could work without making any noise, we were impressed. My husband arranged this trip as a suprise for my Birthday and my Daughter had asked for a bottle of wine for us on arrival, this was delivered in an ice bucket with two cold wine glasses as soon as we had had chance to look round the room, perfect timing.We would definately tell and recommend this Hotel to our friends. Venice is wonderful place and we hope to return soon. Thanks to all the staff .

Reviews.Title: “Grand View and Good Location”
Reviews.Author: Geezers_on_the_Go
Reviews.Content: We had been to Venice before but that was 40 years ago and "Five Dollars a Day" was our bible. So this was the time to actually splurge a bit (with Trip Adbisor help) and have a room with a view. We booked for a room, with balcony, on the Grand Canal, and were very happy with our choice. Their reservation department was great (Jessica especially) and we were able to find a "special" that allowed us to do it all. The front desk staff was very helpful and the restaurant (breakfast great) and maid staff were always friendly. One of the nice aspects of the Carlton is that is has a private water taxi berth. We arrived by air and concur with other reviewers regarding arriving by taxi - absolutely the easist and best way to arrive. I would definitely recommend this hotel and would enjoin readers to call vice booking on line - it removed a lot of questions. The hotel is thirty minutes by foot to almost all of Venice and multiple vaparetto stops are within 100 yards. Close to multiple restaurants and shopping; two quick recommendations for the neighborhood - go across the bridge (Ponte Scazi), turn right and you will find, across another bridge, and off a square "Taverna Ciardi" -- great local food and our favorite. Likewise, for those must bring back Murano jewerly gifts for nieces and nephews - there is a little shop at Cannaregio 119a, that has a great selection of such at the best price we could find in Venice.

Reviews.Title: “Very good location. Good service!”
Reviews.Author: CarlosMedina965
Reviews.Content: ItÂ´s good to start the day with the environment of the Grand Canal. Me and my wife, could not choose another one. Thank you for the good time.

Reviews.Title: “Great value and location”
Reviews.Author: sandy190320
Reviews.Content: I have recently spent 4 nights at the Hotel Carlton on the Grand Canal and I recommend it to all those travellers who are looking for accommodation which will allow them to combine business with pleasure without too many hitches! hotel is at walking distance from the Piazzale which allows you to travel out of Venice with great ease. Besides Piazza San Marco and the very heart of Venice are only a stroll away and afford a welcome break from business meetings. Hotel rooms are clean and comfortable, the bathrooms maybe could do with some modernizing. Staff is very helpful and I also enjoyed an exquisite dinner at the the restaurant 'La cupola', quite reasonably priced too!

Reviews.Title: “Great Location Terrible service Possible bedbug infestation”
Reviews.Author: fromdenver80123
Reviews.Content: Location is great if you need a hotel beside the train station. We were actually booked at their sister hotel carlton which is just behind the grand canal and were told told that despite their 3 star rating they had great service. Unfortunately when we arrived we had to be upgraded to the 4 star Hotel Carlton on the Grand Canal because of water problems in the smaller carlton. We were made to wait a whole hour despite arriving at 3 PM and we were given a first floor bedroom that looked dingy and really old. The curtains were old and filthy. The carpets were scary we did not take our shoes off and the bathroom was moldy. The front desk people were not friendly or helpful either and service is not compatible for a 4 star hotel. They charged us in US dollars which turned out to be much more than the Euro rate. Thankfully we only had to stay a night. Breakfast buffet was okay. The worst thing is we immediately started noting bites on our body and started to itch all over. Mostly in back neck ,arms and legs. I would not recommend this hotel and will inform our travel agent about their service. One last thing do not accept recommendations of restaurants from the front desk. They sent us to a nearby ristorante-Zanzale that charged a cover charge of Four Euros per person and a service charge of four euros per person- we ended up paying seventy six euros for a 39 euro meal. BEWARE!

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful Hotel with Excellent Service”
Reviews.Author: Jane&Brad
Reviews.Content: Just came back from 3 nights in Venice, staying in the Hotel Carlton. The service at the Hotel was fantastic, they apologised that our room wasn't ready when we arrived, even though we were two hours early. We had lunch in the bar area while waiting, which we were not charged for because of the wait! We only waited an hour, so still early booking in. The location was fantastic, lots of restaurants and cafes in easy reach. The service was always with a smile. We stayed in an upgraded room with a queen size bed, yes the rooms were a little small, but this didn't bother us, and the bathroom was big. The decor was traditional italian. If I had to pick something I was unhappy with, was there wasn't much hanging space for clothes, so if you went longer than 3 days you might run out of space, but only a very small issue. Would recommend this hotel to anyone. Tip on booking a Gondola - we were told they charge 100Euros, but we managed to haggle to 60 Euros :-) and well worth every euro, the guy even sung to us.

Reviews.Title: “Hotel Carlton - Grand Canal Venice”
Reviews.Author: JetsettingOzpatriot
Reviews.Content: My first impression was "wow" what a great place! The facade makes the hotel look small but in reality it is quite large as are the rooms inside. The location is excellent, right on the Grand Canal, close to everything including a myriad of restaurants, water taxis, water buses and yes even the ubiquitous gondola. The reception area and check in space is somewhat small but they are extremely quick in getting everyone through the process and handing you your key, which by the way weighs a ton ... The rooms are quite large when compared to other European Hotels that we stayed in and are very nicely decorated in early Italian design. The beds are quite soft and the rooms have airconditioning and heating to suit most needs. There is plenty of room for clothing and room service is available if needed. The bathroom was nice and clean and had great hot water, large towels and plenty of other stuff as well. Breakfast consisted of the normal continental style with hot bacon and scrambled egg for those that want a bit more. I really liked the red orange juice, something we don't get in Australia or at least I haven't seen it? Getting around Venice is quite easy given that there are no cars, buses, motorbikes, scooters or bicycles and with its many narrow streets and bridges over the canals it makes for a very romantic setting. The cultural sites are excellent and well worth a few days just to wander about looking into everything that can be found. You can't go to Venice without taking a Gondola Ride or visiting the Murano glass factories of which there are approximately 100 (or so I was told). All in all a great hotel in a great location.

Reviews.Title: “Good location but needs and updating on rooms urgently”
Reviews.Author: vsilva
Reviews.Content: I think the best feature of this hotel would be its location. It's right on the begining of the Grand Canal across the bridge on the other side of the train station, and the vaporeto stop is just in front the hotel. The hotel entrance is quite nice as for the lobby, but it's definitely in need of a major refurbishment on floors, hallways, rooms and doors! The rooms are tiny and have this smelly old carpet wich I did not want to step on without my slippers.. the beds and furnishing where wornout. The bathrooms are old, old, old... The bedroom door was scrapped and the corridors needed painting as for the old stained carpet in the hallway.. Definitly not a 4star quotation, and no care whatsoever on guest satisfaction. Breakfast was just ok. Bread was hard, not at all appetizing and the fruit was canned! Really! We did go with the machine cappucino, some crackers and jelly, but not at all our best choice. Venice is a turistic place and prices are over the sealing speacialy if you want high standart, but a good hotel management should want to do the best it can so guests leave with the best impression, speacialy if it's a four star hotel. Again, the location is the best if you don't want to go up and down the bridges with suit cases till you find the right hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location”
Reviews.Author: kd_kevin
Reviews.Content: Brilliantly located hotel, the first building you see as you come out from the train station, just beside a bridge (there are only 3 crossing the grand canal) and a river boat stop. Our room was quite small, although we were bumped up to a deluxe room, but it had a lovely balcony overlooking the canal. Whilst this was lovely in the afternoon and evening but the noise from the river boats was such that we got little to no sleep in the morning, this was the major downside to hotel. Overall this is a good hotel in a brilliant location.

Reviews.Title: “Outstanding Location & Nice Hotel”
Reviews.Author: TyneandMusi
Reviews.Content: Stayed for 3 nights in one of the Patio Garden Rooms. We loved the patio garden and the more modern feel to rooms which were more to our taste than the typical old fashioned venetian style rooms found in the rest of the hotel. The location was outstanding. Breakfast was good. we didn't eat lunch or dinner at the hotel as we preferred to explore the local restaurants. If I return to venice I would definitely book the Carlton on the Grand Canal again.

Reviews.Title: “Only hotel to stay when in Venice”
Reviews.Author: martinmaher187045
Reviews.Content: We have now stayed in this hotel four times, and would stay at no other hotel when in Venice.

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel but terrible customer service!!”
Reviews.Author: deweybeachgirl
Reviews.Content: First I will say that the location of the hotel was ideal, but I would not stay in this hotel again nor would I recommend it to others. We booked the hotel for two nights, but checked out after the first night. There was a problem with our booking arrangements when we arrived for check in, and the clerk on duty (no manager available) was not very helpful. They were able to find another room in the hotel for us, an upgrade ofcourse, but at nearly triple the price of the room we booked prior to arrival!! Unfortunately it was late and we had no other hotel arrangements elsewhere, so we were forced to pay the ridiculous price to stay at the Carlton. We were told to see the manager the next morning to discuss and resolve the problem, but again there was no manager on duty or available for us to speak to. The morning clerk wasn't able to assist us with the problems or our stay, so we packed our bags and checked out. Upon checking out and paying for our one night stay, we reviewed the bill and we were charged even more for the room than we were quoted the night before, so the bill had to be readjusted. There was no consistency with the quoted room rates. Regardless of the problems we were having, we were more than willing to try to work with the hotel and felt that we were being completely reasonable asking them to bill us for the price we were originally quoted when we booked the room, but the hotel would not work with us. Customer service does not seem to be a concern for this hotel. As for the overall feel of the hotel, it was clean and had a welcoming atmosphere. The decor was beautiful and the rooms were nicely appointed. However, the bed was not very comfortable and the robes were not soft at all, they were hard to the touch. We enjoyed visiting Venice, and do so often, but will definitely find another hotel for our next visit.

Reviews.Title: “a handy location to start you trip to venice”
Reviews.Author: hamilton238
Reviews.Content: If you travel into venice via bus from the airport (which only costs 3 euros each and takes 20 minutes) then this hotel is within 5 minutes walking distance from the bus terminal. something you should consider is where is your hotel as getting round is not the easiet with luggage. Your first impression of the interior of the hotel matches 4 star standards, very clean with lovely shiny stone flooring. At check in we were given a town map and given some advice about your location and some of the best ways to get around, a very handy start. The room itself would not be what i expect from a 4 star hotel, i would classify it more as a 3 star. there was nothing special about the room it was very small and come with a spare single bed - incase of arguments i guess! the bed itself was fine but it was not one of those beds you lay on and you instantly fill comfortable, what you want after a day on your feet. Simple things like the plug in the bath did not fit the plug whole, just a lack of attention to detail. Housekeeping always did a good job though. My top travel trip for a visit to venice would be to fly to verona and stay there as it is a very beautiful city and visit venice as a day trip. we did the opposite and see this as a real mistake. Return train tickets for 2 on the regional train which took about one and a half hours were only 22 euros. The best deal you can get in venice. Overall i was a bit dissapointed with venice, very very expensive and not too much to do with very few places to stop and relax.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, but mediocre room and service.”
Reviews.Author: AnnaColagro
Reviews.Content: I stayed in the Deluxe Double Room with Grand Canal View. I did not expect much, but the room was old, the bathroom door was made of a textures glass, and very very small. I was there with my fiancÃ© and felt shy about using the bathroom with him on the room. I don't mean to alarm you, but most hotels is Venice will be like this or worse. Is is however extremely close to the train station. The front desk staff was near rude, breakfast staff rushed you, the bar staff was good. Venice is beautiful but decaying, visit there with an open mind (and wallet) Ps. Horrible WiFI

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful Venetian experience”
Reviews.Author: sjwcooper
Reviews.Content: We were in Venice for three days and, despite rain on the first day, it could not have been better. Our room was on the first floor, but above ground level so we could experience everything on the street and canal, but still have privacy. We had dinner in the restaurant the first night and the m'aitre de and his staff could not have been more accomodating. The loication of the hotel made it easy for us to get transportation around the city. The hotel staff was very, very friendly and helpful.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Hotel:)”
Reviews.Author: Toyah1
Reviews.Content: Myself and my husband and another couple stayed here for 3 nights over valentine. Both our rooms were small but had everything in there that you needed. The staff and breakfast were both very nice. The hotel is situated across the road from the train station and the bus station. We walked most off our 3 day stay, but did jump on the water buses a few times. I found Venice not as expensive as thought was going to be, yes you can pay top dollar if you eat in very expensive restaurants, but..who goes on holiday to penny pinch! Had looked forward to this weekend break for ages, so, we all had a most fantastic time! Were lucky with the weather, cold and crisp but not windy! All in would WILL defo be going back and most prob stay in this hotel again as location to everything and the hotel itself was great.

Reviews.Title: “Travel Agent Review”
Reviews.Author: christina51
Reviews.Content: Spent 2 nights at the Grand Hotel and very happy with location to shopping, water taxis, gondolas, etc. The hotel is lovely and the decor is very well done. Came from California and spent time in Venice before a Greek Isle Cruise. The rooms although quite small are very nicely decorated. The bathroom, shower is great. Lots pf water pressure. and nice to have a towel warmer rack in the bath-room. We had a view of the court-yard but spent little time in the room as there is so much to see in beautiful Venice. The Gondola is just outside the door and as there was 8 of us traveling, the desk clerk made our reservaions for the Gondolas and gave us so much information as to what to do and see. The breakfast was excellent with many choices and served in a lovely area. I liked location, staff very helpful, rooms were very clean and a very adequate breakfast. I would highly recommend the Grand Hotel in Venice to my clients......

Reviews.Title: “Lovely Location, very welcoming staff”
Reviews.Author: shedwards1971
Reviews.Content: Brilliant location, very clean hotel with a nice decadent feel to it. the staff were very helpful and friendly. The room although a little small was very clean, had all we needed in it and had an amazing view of the Grand Canal, our balcony overlooked straight onto it. Great location to get around the whoel of Venice. we loved it and we will return !!

Reviews.Title: “Highly recommended”
Reviews.Author: smith_liam
Reviews.Content: Great hotel, would highly recommend it for a stay in Venice. Fantastic value for a hotel of this quality, in a great location on the Grand Canal. Breakfast / food was great; rooms very nice; staff friendly and helpful. Regarding location, this hotel is in a quieter area of Venice, however, this is by no means a disadvantage due to its location on the Grand Canal, where you can catch a Water Bus to Rialto bridge (10 mins) and St. Marks Square (20 mins). The best of both worlds if you ask me...

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel”
Reviews.Author: 31gs1979
Reviews.Content: Liked everything, breakfast was good, although 'cornetti' croissants could be a bit better, considering we are in italy. Room was small, but i guess this is the size of room you get in Venice. Clean and comfortable. Staff very professional and kind. Would definitely consider going back there again.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, nice staff but a bit overpriced in some respects”
Reviews.Author: AlNic
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Cartlon at the end of January. It was very cold in the City yet the hotel is only 5 minutes walk away from the Piazzle Roma bus terminal. You can get the ATVO airport bus which is only 3 Euro's each direct to the terminal which is about 15 minutes travel time. We found the hotel very warm everywhere despite it being very cold outside. Our room, 271 was spacious and clean. View was a bit rubbish as per our photo but you can have a canal view if you want to pay twice as much, you have a choice. Despite a poor view the room was light and quiet at night. We paid approx Â£105 per night with breakfast via laterooms. We found the staff very nice and helpful. The breakfast was sufficient and you could eat as much as you wanted to. One negative we feel was the charge of 5 euros and hour for the internet. Nothing short pure business driven profit at the expense of good customer service and fairness. I refused to pay that and used the free Wifi in the city hotspots and even went into McDonalds to use theirs. I can hear the groans, fancy going to McDonalds in Venice! All I can say is the coffee was cheap and the internet was free. Come on Carlton, drop the excessive internet charges, for the prices they charge it should be included in the price. That said ,we would stay in the Carlton again providing we got the same or similar deal

Reviews.Title: “Would return!”
Reviews.Author: NazAndy
Reviews.Content: This typically italian designed hotel was excellent. The standard double room (which we stayed in) is their worst room apparently. It was ample in space and beautifully and tastefullty decorated. There is everything you need nearby, eateries, cafes, bars, transport and shopping. If you want the main sights on your doorstep, this is not for you as St Marco is a 40 minute walk, but if like us you love to explore and walk this hotel is perfect. The breakfast was basic but good. The staff were helpful and the housekeeping did a fantastic job. We spent 3 nights here and would definitely return. The hotel is inexpensive because it is not central, NOT due to poor standards!

Reviews.Title: “Fabulous hotel in beautiful Venice”
Reviews.Author: Sharon021_11
Reviews.Content: We stayed in Venice as a first stop on our tour through Italy. We flew in from Amsterdam and took the water taxi to the entrance of the hotel. This is a fabulous hotel! The service was good, the hotel and rooms were very clean, the breakfasts were good and the location was excellent. We took the train from Venice to our next stop, Verona. So convenient with the train station across the bridge. Venice is a place of much beauty and this hotel is highly recommended to top the experience.

Reviews.Title: “very convenient & elegant place to stay”
Reviews.Author: MarzenaB
Reviews.Content: I stayed in this hotel already twice and definitely would return. The hotel is located on the oposite side to railway station and just 2 minutes from Pza Roma, overlooking Canale Grande. It has a very nice decorated rooms (tipical for Venice & Italy in general) and very good selection of food for breakfast. The only problem we had the first night was a bit noisy room which was changed the next day into a quite one.

Reviews.Title: “Prime location in Venice”
Reviews.Author: Lord_Lorenzo
Reviews.Content: I stayed in this hotel for 5 days and 4 nights during a mix of a business / leisure trip to Italy. I chose the hotel mainly because of its prime location, right across the Venice SL train station. The exterior looks a little worn but once you are inside it is decorated nicely. Rooms are comfy and the size is European standard, which is smaller than American / Asian hotels. My only gripe with this hotel is the bare selection of the breakfast menu. You get the standard selection of bread/cheese/fruit etc with bacon and scrambled egg the only hot menu on the list. If you don't mind of the limited choice in the breakfast menu, there is nothing to fault about this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Hotel very well located, proposing clean and spacious rooms in Venice center”
Reviews.Author: spersof
Reviews.Content: Hi visited Venice and stopped already twice at Carlton Grand Canale. The hotel is very well located, 100m from the station, and very close to Venice city center (10min Vaporetto to Piazza St Marco). A very good value for money and definitely a place I will visit again for my Venice business trips.

Reviews.Title: “Very good hotel, the room was clean and the location is excellent”
Reviews.Author: Patty_9876
Reviews.Content: we liked very much this hotel. Good location , near the station, areas and room very clear, good breakfast and nice staff/service.

Reviews.Title: “Looking fwd to going back to Venice & this hotel one day.”
Reviews.Author: SMMcL
Reviews.Content: Husband & I plus parents-in-law stayed at this hotel in Jan 2011 for two nights. Rooms clean & comfortable. Bathroom clean & modern. While the reception area was usually a hive of activity, our room and its corridor was quiet, no noise disturbance. Staff v helpful from reception to restaurant to bar to chamber maids. Breakfast was great, lovely coffee. My only complaint from breakfast was cold bacon & eggs. Everything else in the vast array of breakfast foods was top notch. Hotel could do with wifi internet access (to enable uploading photos of Venice for your friends, of course). All in all, a great stay. I'd love to go back again and soon.

Reviews.Title: “Disappointing Italian hotel and city”
Reviews.Author: kay_dubb_60
Reviews.Content: After reading reviews we had high expectations for this hotel. We arrived to unhelpful front desk person and the service we received from other staff was similar. Rooms were barely cleaned, just new towels (no facecloths or kleenex provided) and bed made each day. The hotel was renovated about 10 years ago in the dark baroque/venetian style with padded, gold damask covering our room walls from floor to ceiling. The room was very small with windows only about 3 feet from the neighboring building so no light could get in. Overall very, very depressing. Location was good within easy walking distance of sights. Food in Venice very poor overall. We would not go back.

Reviews.Title: “Amazing - Would recommend”
Reviews.Author: Rachel121
Reviews.Content: This hotel is absolutly amazing ! Beautiful rooms - very clean. General areas of the hotel were wonderfully presented. Staff very helpful and polite - all speak good english. Breakfast was fab - really lovely food and lots to choose from.
