Location on the Grand Canal - only a 2 minute walk from Pizzale Roma (main bus station in to Venice) so perfect when first arriving in to the city from the airport. Is about a 40 minute walk to St Marks square - which is easy to get to as is clearly signed - but would say, it would probably be a bit much to anyone who might not be able to handle too much walking at one time. Overall - would defo recommend this hotel if your happy to do lots of walking around.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent hospitality and attention to detail”
Reviews.Author: JMB2011
Reviews.Content: We've stayed in this hotel many times and gladly return each time. The service is friendly and polite.

Reviews.Title: “Incredible”
Reviews.Author: clarisiza
Reviews.Content: From the moment you enter this hotel you really feel spoiled! With such elegance and beauty you feel part of a fairy tale. Location is great, close to train/bus station and vaporetto,but Venice is not a huge city and being so marvellous you can simply walk around and discover amazing spots. The hotel had really great staff, everybody spoke English and were really eager to help. The room was spacious and very elegant, it even had a beatiful, sparkling chandelier. Couldn't believe it is not a 5* hotel. Breakfast was outstanding and again staff was very helpful if you had any dietery requirements. After finding the best hotel in the city, we will definitely go back.

Reviews.Title: “We will come back”
Reviews.Author: jacques187209
Reviews.Content: Very nice hÃ´tel, very clean. Excellent Chistmas Diner, served by very pleasant waiters The same applies for the breakfast. Friendly Reception

Reviews.Title: “Great location, elegant rooms... BUT! Worst.Shower.Ever!”
Reviews.Author: Chris - Steph K
Reviews.Content: You can see the hotel from the train station and there is a bridge conveniently located to cross the Grand Canal for easy access - as with almost all bridges in Venice, it's all setps though which could be a challenge if you have heavy luggage. Staff were friendly, breakfast was nice and beds were very comfortable. The hotel common areas and its' rooms are both VERY Venetian - elegant decorating more than reflecting the Hotel's 4 star rating. Room service is also very pricey - we avoided it - too many nice places to eat within a 2 minute walk from the hotel to get room service! Only downside really was the bath/shower - they have tried to fit a bath/shower into an area that can really only fit a shower. It is no ordinary bath though. Due to it's size it is a "dual-level" bath tub to make bathing easier in the cramped tub. This makes for a VERY uncomfortable shower experience! Minor glitch however, Very good experience overall.

Reviews.Title: “Comfortable hotel conveniently located for airport, vaporetto and train”
Reviews.Author: LamHongKong
Reviews.Content: Hotel Carlton is very well situated for anyone arriving in a suitcase at night as I did. It was two bridges away from Piazzale Roma where the airport bys terminates.A bridge across the Grand Canal from Santa Lucia Station and the Ferrovia vaporetto stop. Though a brisk 10-minute walk from St Mark's Square, still good for touring Venice and excellent for anyone planning to take the train to other cities on the mainland. Quite a big hotel by Venetian standard, yet staff were friendly and helpful, giving guests good advice and support for their sightseeing activities. They even offered to charge my iphone which doubled as my camera. The restaurant-bar, lobby lounge and breakfast room are all comfortable and well maintained, with adequate personal service. Guest rooms are in typical Venetian style and my double room was spacious and clean. Made my stay in Venice a comfortable one.

Reviews.Title: “Good hotel with exellent location”
Reviews.Author: etm68
Reviews.Content: Nice hotel, wwith exellent location. Service is good and rooms are clen. The only thing what I am missing is fitness center but.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful service, great view, excellent breakfast!”
Reviews.Author: EbolynSuriv
Reviews.Content: We loved this hotel as the service was most impressive. We were greeted by outstanding receptionists who were more than helpful with pointing out to us the best attractions in Venice. As our rooms were not ready at noon, they held our luggage for us then delivered them to our rooms in the afternoon. This hotel is situated on the canal so transportation is very convenient if you're going by water-taxi. The breakfast that is included is another value that comes with the hotel. The breakfast buffet opens from 6:30-10:30 a.m. We took advantage of that option before heading out to the city and exploring as meals in Venice is not cheap. Would definitely stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic location on the Grand Canal”
Reviews.Author: BertDC
Reviews.Content: My husband and I recently stayed two nights at the Carlton on the Grand Canal. We paid extra for a room with a view of the canal; it had a small balcony, and we really enjoyed the view. The room was cozy, with a modern bathroom. We didn't realize that in November, the walkways in Venice can flood, and we felt very lucky that our hotel lobby never flooded; other hotels and businesses, particularly near Plaza San Marco, were inundated. The hotel is about three blocks from the Piazzale Roma, where the airport bus dropped us off. We did have to cross two bridges with stairs with our luggage to get to the hotel, but at least we saved money by avoiding water taxis. My only complaint might be that, when we checked out, I was asked if I wanted to pay in dollars or euros, and without thinking, I said dollars. The rate would have been much better if I had stuck with euros. We would definitely stay at this hotel again on our next trip to Venice (and pay in euros!).

Reviews.Title: “Great Value and Location”
Reviews.Author: rnowicki
Reviews.Content: Very helpful and friendly staff . Could not ask for a better location . Hotel restaurant is also very good .

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic location, spacious room , good value!”
Reviews.Author: fatcat2222
Reviews.Content: I stayed 1 day from 4 to 5 Nov 2010. The room was spacious, classic looking, very clean and the bed was comfortable. Location wise, it was just along the Grand canal and across the main station ( Just 3 minutes walk away).Reception/Conceirge and service was very helpful and efficient. Breakfast was very decent with a good choice of bread, buns, croissants,some cured meats, fruits and cereals. They even had some salad with vinaigrette available! ! I booked the hotel through GTA and paid 77euros per night for it .The location and price is unbeatable !

Reviews.Title: “Great Location for an O.K. Hotel”
Reviews.Author: jcfbumpkin
Reviews.Content: My wife and I stayed in this hotel just before a cruise. It is located near Plaza Roma and it was easy to catch ACTV bus.no. 5 from Marco Polo airport to Plaza Roma and then a short trip( about 100 yards) while crossing two small bridges and your there.the outside of this hotel is beautiful and its located right on the grand canal. We arrived late and received a less than choice room near the rear of the hotel. We had a horrible view. The room was small but adequate. Beds were two twin and were comfy. The room was clean. The shower was small and watch out for the vinyl floors in the bathroom . They are very slick. I talked to other folks who were on our cruise and they were very impressed with this hotel. They had received rooms with either a courtyard or a canal view. I suppose that its just the luck of the draw. As someone else had stated on this forum the staff is friendly enough, but they try to rush you out of the room well before checkout time. This is an O.K. to a very good hotel based upon the type of room that you receive.I would stay here again because of the location.

Reviews.Title: “Hotel Carlton on the Grand Canal is truly grand!”
Reviews.Author: Mnabroad
Reviews.Content: My daughter-in-law and I recently stayed here for four nights and were extremely pleased. The location is perfect--over the bridge a few steps away, and there are the waterbus stop and the train station. The ride to the Rialto is only a short time and distance. Also just over the bridge is a wonderful street filled with shops and restaurants. The buffet breakfast is very diverse--something for every palate. Our room was quiet, fairly spacious, and had a clean modern bath.This was my fifth trip to Venuce and my daughter-in-law's first--for both the experienced traveler and the novice, we felt the Carlton is a real find!

Reviews.Title: “The Special Relationship”
Reviews.Author: GilbertSheffield
Reviews.Content: The good things of this place are the location, if you have seen people lugging wheely cases round Venice you'll appreciate this spot,Just across from the train and bus stations.People write that it is very clean, true but what did they expect? Food is fine for breakfast, limited but fine,at other times it is expensive. The rooms are OK nicely furnished, wierd TV which needed to warm up, but again fine. The bad things are the very thin walls which almost made our trip communal, I have never said "bless you" to someone sneezing in another room before and I am sure she heard it, despite whispering ! The other down side is that this hotel attracts loads of people on cruise trips and organised tours, therefore the place has a forever shifting clientele. As the Headwaiter told us," you should have seen it for breakfast at 6.30, it was packed" in an Italian accent of course. The other fact is unless you are on a cruise or trip you can't get your breakfast at that time ( the usual feeding frenzy is from 7.30) Don't get me wrong I don't mind whatever nationality stays in a hotel but when you get loads of them together the worst national traits appear ( just ask the Spanish in Andalucia about us Brits) Americans were not at the front of the queue when God handed out courtesy and the psuedo American wannabees the Japanese travel in shoals and all tend to bully those without 15 mates and hog facilities with ridiculous demands on the Reception, so we had to wait half an hour to check out whilst they complained about Oregano ( or Or-egg-gan-o) in the soup!! Wierd. So if you like crowds and thin walls it may be for you, but if you want to be an individual try the Rialto Grande much quieter but a long suitcase pull !

Reviews.Title: “Good location - Service could improve”
Reviews.Author: CatalinaLondon
Reviews.Content: Godd location, across the train station and less than 5' walk from the Piazza Roma where bus, taxi and cars arrive. The rooms are clean and well layed out and the Hotel is fairly quiet. The service could improve considering the Concierge, Bell Men and Waiters are there to guide and help hosts as much as possible and not to make it difficult. A bit of a helpful attitude, quality information regarding services, transport and speaking on behalf of the guest to a restaurant or others...won't hurt ! Where is that added value that takes a Hotel from average to good ?.

Reviews.Title: “My first visit to Venice the staff at Hotel Carlton were excellent they made my state a one I will never forget.”
Reviews.Author: Spencezx
Reviews.Content: The service you could not fault, excellent service from the front counter, dinning room and staff that cleaned our room, also the porters. The room was excellent, over looking the Grand Canal with a balcony, inside the room had all you required and done out lovely. The location was perfect, opposite the railway station, ferries and water taxis, very convenient. Walking distance to restaurants and shops. The best part is waking up in the morning and been able to go out on balcony and view the grand canal. The only problem was the shower over the bath a little bit inconvenient but that would not stop me from staying there again. My sister and I stayed for a week but I hope to visit Venice in March 2011 and I will be booking into The Hotel Carlton on the Grand Canal with my husband.

Reviews.Title: “Fabulous Location”
Reviews.Author: bergs1977
Reviews.Content: My friends and I went back to Venice and stayed in this hotel for the second time. The location for us was great as it is just as you enter Venice. This meant we could walk all through the different streets and alley ways to find the main attractions rather than staying right in the middle. We also found that the shops and restaurants were cheaper to! The hotel is very nice and the rooms are extremely clean although ours were on the small side but considering we were only there to sleep, it was great. Most of the staff are very friendly, however there are one or two reception staff who were a tad rude. The breakfast is nice but simple so do not expect the full works. All in all I would recommend this hotel to anyone.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic, friendly, a great place to stay.”
Reviews.Author: safintermission
Reviews.Content: This was my 4th visit to this hotel. The staff are very friendly, the rooms are clean and comfortable and the breakfasts are extensive! I will definately be returning in the near future.

Reviews.Title: “very nice hotel in front of the Grand Canal”
Reviews.Author: Diego19762011
Reviews.Content: we stayed there for a weekend, we booked a junior suite, the room had an elegant classical furniture, with a balcony perfect to have breakfast. the location is perfect, you have the grand canal in front with the possibilty of taken the "vaporetto" just across the next bridge, walk in the city or the bus station to go the airport.

Reviews.Title: “Enjoyable well located hotel”
Reviews.Author: steve2505
Reviews.Content: We stayed 3 nights based on Trip Advisor reviews and were not disappointed. Hotel is very close to the train station - 5 minute walk and also the public ferry. We booked a deluxe double room with grand canal view. We were glad we did as it was great to see the canal and the various traffic that goes up and down. Given all the activity it can get a bit noisy but its quite manageable if you close the windows and shutters. Breakfast was excellent, great choice and good service. Room size whilst not large was fine. We would stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Most recommended for its location and services offered.”
Reviews.Author: Tgg4
Reviews.Content: Excellent service, with friendly and professionnal skills. Staff is devoted in satisfying their client. Very well located to the railway and busboats station. Lovely stay in Carlton on the Grand Canal.

Reviews.Title: “wonderful windows on the water”
Reviews.Author: bluemoontvl
Reviews.Content: My husband and I just returned from Venice to celebrate our 25th wedding anniversary. We stayed in a beautiful suite with magnificant views of the Grand Canal from our balcony. The hotel was welcoming, beautiful and so conveniently located to anything you desired to do in Venice. Our visit was much too short and we do look forward to staying again at the Hotel Carlton.....it was perfect!!!

Reviews.Title: “Well Situated”
Reviews.Author: OuzoandCoke
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for 2 nights on the strength of Trip Advisor reviews. It's situated on the Grand Canal directly opposite the train station and the water bus terminus where you can get a boat to just about anywhere in Venice. Premises were clean and well appointed and our room was very spacious with a Juliette balcony overlooking the canal. There was a fridge and electronic safe in the room and the bathroom was huge. It was a little noisy at night and we found it necessary to close off the balcony in order to get some sleep. Breakfast here was sensational and amongst the best we've had anywhere in terms of quantity and quality. We will stay there again for sure.

Reviews.Title: “Very Pleasant staff”
Reviews.Author: Biscuit88
Reviews.Content: This hotel was very nice. Directly across from train station. Room was good sized and very clean. Breakfast was excellent, with many choices. The staff at the front desk and servers at breakfast were talkative and friendly. (We stayed at 6 hotels on this trip and for the most part, the front desk people/servers are very bland and not very friendly). Only downside was No free internet in room.

Reviews.Title: “excellent as usual”
Reviews.Author: jmlO6
Reviews.Content: This Hotel is among the best place to stay in Venise , perfect service and in a great location. The breakfast Buffet is very efficient and the service again very nice. I recomand the room with the view on Grand Canal . The bar is a full american bar open late and friendly staff . This must be a Nice place to work since the staff never change. it's a good value. They know how to do a very good job in this Hotel without been Snobb like Other wellknown Places .BRAVO and Thank YOU

Reviews.Title: “beautiful Venice”
Reviews.Author: rbarbaris
Reviews.Content: Seeing Venice from this beautiful hotel was a great experience. Everything was excellent, the staff very courteous. When we return to Venice we definitely would stay at this beautiful Carlton again. Mille grazie Carlton! The Barbarisis Family Miami Fl and Atlanta Ga.

Reviews.Title: “The Perfect Birthday Weekend”
Reviews.Author: GWalsh60
Reviews.Content: I visited Venice for my 50th birthday with 7 of my closest girl friends. The Hotel Carlton on the Grand Canal was the perfect base for our 3 night visit. We arrived by water taxi straight to the door of the Hotel on the Grand Canal which they had arranged for us. The staff could not have been more friendly or helpful, from advising us on a fabulous little square to find some off the tourist track restaurants, to helping my friends surprise me with a birthday breakfast on the Sunday morning. I expected breakfast at the hotel to be just a standard continental but it was in fact more than generous, with yoghurts & fruit, together with scrambled eggs & bacon, all the usual cheeses, meats, & pastries. It was a lovely relaxed affair. My room was a stunning suite overlooking the Grand Canal with all of my friends rooms close by (& one connected). My balcony looked out over the Grand Canal which was a busy highway of boats. All the girls were extremely pleased with their rooms which were decorated in traditional Venetian style & very comfortable. The hotel itself is based up by the train station and is within easy reach of everything either by meandering down the main roads checking out the wonderful leather goods and Venetian masque shops or by taking a water bus from over the other side of the Canal. I am already looking forward to my next visit and cannot thank the Hotel Carlton enough for helping make my birthday weekend so special.

Reviews.Title: “Venetian Palace in Wonderful Location for Train and Cruise Arrivals”
Reviews.Author: CathyBNewYork_NY
Reviews.Content: We had the pleasure of only one night in a junior suite in this fabulous hotel, but DH and I have agreed that we found a new home in Venice! The room was magnificent! Silk Draperies, doublebalconied windowsover the Grand Canal (yeah, the view is not Rialto or San Marco but so what, this is Venice!), luxurious marble bath with tub and shower, and the most delicious and plentiful breakfast we have ever had in Europe! We have stayed in the Danieli numerous times, and because we were taking only one night pre-cruise, we decided to try this instead. The Grand was every bit as lovely, and at the rate we paid, was a bargain indeed! Most importantly, the service at the front desk, in the dining room and throughout was excellent and it fel like being in a palazzo! We will be back again for sure!

Reviews.Title: “A Siver Wedding to Remember”
Reviews.Author: candsgreener
Reviews.Content: My wife and I have recently returned from a holiday in Venice to celebrate our 25th Wedding Anniversary, and were delighted that we had chosen to stay at The Carlton on the Grand Canal. The staff were very professional and could not have been more helpful. We had a large comfortable room which was beautifully furnished and decorated. The choice available for breakfast was excellent and the hotel was ideally situated for sight seeing as the water bus stopped opposite. We also discovered a wide variety of restaurants within walking distance of the hotel. We would not hesitate to recommend the hotel as an ideal place to stay. So much so we are planning a return visit.

Reviews.Title: “Far too expensive for what you are getting”
Reviews.Author: norwooda
Reviews.Content: The hotel was not bad, but for over $400/night, I was thankful we were only there for one night. The room was smaller than the cruise cabin that I had stayed in for the previous week. I didn't know that would be possible. I have been to Europe multiple times and realize that rooms tend to be smaller than US rooms, but it was exceptionally small. The room did have a wonderful view of the Grand Canal. You hear the boat traffic instead of car traffic which is a nice change up. It is a city so I never expected it to be quiet all night. The bed was extremely uncomfortable though. I had never spent a night on such a hard bed in Europe and the pillows were so stiff you couldn't even fold them in half to raise your head. The decor was nicer than most hotels. Overall, I wouldn't recommend this hotel, not because it is a bad hotel, but it is not worth the high price especially since it isn't near any of the tourist attractions.

Reviews.Title: “Decent hotel, but a little too pricey”
Reviews.Author: CaliMae
Reviews.Content: This is a very large hotel for the area. I thought the service was average/good. Everyone was nice and polite, but were not overly helpful. The room was clean, but seemed a little dated. Our room faced a courtyard and it was very quiet. There is a free breakfast in the morning that was very well stocked (cereal, toast, fresh fruit, yogurt, cheese, meats, etc.). It is a distance from St. Mark's, but I enjoyed walking through the little streets and didn't feel that it was exceptionally far. I also enjoyed being away from the main tourist areas because it became quieter in the evenings. We took a shuttle bus in from the Venice Airport and the walk was only a short distance. It did require a lot of stairs over the canals, so if you can not lift your bag I would not recommend it. I do believe you can take a canal bus as the main train station is right across the canal (this was very convenient for us when we left Venice via train). My only disappointment was the price. It was $350/night. I don't believe it was worth this price. We did go during peak season and had to book this hotel as there were no others with rooms available. I think if I return to Venice, I will try to book a smaller, boutique hotel. If need be though, i would return to this hotel (but hopefully at a cheaper price :).

Reviews.Title: “This being our second booking, the first postponed due to ashcloud, it was all a bit of a let down”
Reviews.Author: jcmdiver
Reviews.Content: We have just returned from a wonderful time in Venice however feeling very let down by what had been a long anticipated stay in the Hotel Carlton, the first time having been postponed due to the ashcloud. I felt I had done a lot of research and was quite excited to be staying in this hotel (especially as they had been so nice in response to us not getting there in March) The foyer and the reception was very positive and the person who greeted us was very friendly so this boded well for the stay however this was the only time we saw smiling and friendly staff. In fact at breakfast on the first day when I had to point out a hair on the first plate and a dirty dried on food plate, the response instead of being somewhat conciliatory, was down right rude with a shrug of the shoulders (and I am not a serial complainer) The difference in the cost of a double standard and a superior double room was not worth the additional cost (one extra window and a bidet) and both had a view of the wall opposite! No tea/coffee making facilities, tired rooms and tired staff did nothing to enhance our stay but in spite of the Hotel Carlton we will return to Venice (for a third time) just not to this hotel - sorry a real let down!

Reviews.Title: “hotel stay including a special package”
Reviews.Author: espoo_10
Reviews.Content: The hotel has excellent location close to airport bus station and vaporetto boats. Also surrounding areas close to the hotel are fascinating. Hotel's special packages are a very nice idea. We had a package including champange breakfast, opera and gondol ride. Unfortunately there was no opera in an announced evening and instead we had a short music performance. (without any compensation from hotel's side). Otherwise a very nice stay.

Reviews.Title: “Amazing hotel!”
Reviews.Author: elianegermanos
Reviews.Content: The hotel is so beautiful. The location is really superb, close from the Piazza Della Roma and the water taxi. It is parallel to the train station as well. The service is really good and professional, teh staff is always smiling and friendly. the breakfast is very good and teh rooms offer the gorgeous venezian style. We do recomment this hotel and we will be glad to go there again!

Reviews.Title: “Great Place to stay!”
Reviews.Author: RichieV0722
Reviews.Content: Even though we only stayed for 3 nights the hotel was fabulous. The service and responsiveness of the staff were very good. The rooms were very nice, well furnished and large. Right across from the train station.

Reviews.Title: “Ideal location”
Reviews.Author: GazdeVere
Reviews.Content: Great base in Venice, right next to major Vaporetti routes. Very comfortable rooms, superb breakfast. Been back several times to this hotel - highly recommended.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic hotel in a fantastic city!”
Reviews.Author: james_emson
Reviews.Content: A fantastic hotel, really good location (especially if your are entering venice by train), very traditional rooms, we were staying in a room with a view of the canal which was great! Would recommend this hotel to anyone visiting venice!

Reviews.Title: “Don't know why this has such good ratings”
Reviews.Author: cheryldecaf
Reviews.Content: I really do not understand why the ratings for this hotel are so good in Trip Advisor. We stayed here for 2 nights and were not impressed. We had a superior double room which was OK in size but looked out onto a part of a roof with an air conditioning unit and we couldn't open the window to get any air because of all the mosquitos that lived there. The hotel clerks were not very friendly and when we asked if we could check-out 2 hours later than normal we were told we could check out 1 and a half hours later but not 2 hours later. What is the difference? The rooms were empty on that day, I walked around the halls just before we left and the rooms were empty (it was a Sunday). The hotel is so far away from the main areas like San Marco, it took so much time to get there. The reviews said just 26 minutes by vaporetto or 30 by walking, but it took much more than that. The Vaporetto had waiting times of course, and lines to buy the tickets. And the last direct No. 2 vaporetto on Saturday night stopped running at 8 something p.m. Also, walking might only take 30 minutes if you know the way but as tourists one never does. There is not really that much to see in the area of the hotel either. So I would suggest not staying there but at someplace closer to the main tourist sites. Unless of course you do not like tourist sites and are going for some other reason. The worst thing about this hotel, is that they do not have wireless internet! And no computer to use in the lobby or any business center! They only have a wire in the room which you have to plug into your computer if you've lugged one all the way to Venice. And it cost money which is not a problem but if you only have your iphone it does not have a place to plug into. I asked if I could use their computer to check into my flight online, but they would not let me. I went to another hotel and they let me use their internet for free! What a joke.

Reviews.Title: “Love this hotel!”
Reviews.Author: mags_miller101
Reviews.Content: Love this beautiful hotel. It's perfect location allows you to watch Venetian life pass by. The staff are incredibly caring, friendly and helpful. This was our second stay here and we received a warm welcome back. Transport links ideal - directly opposite Ferrovia station and only 7 minutes walk from the bus station (which is only 20 minutes from the airport). We will definitely stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “A very nice hotel in a very nice place serviced by a very nice staff.”
Reviews.Author: jadisalvatore
Reviews.Content: This hotel is located very close to the train station so if you are dragging heavy bags with you your walk from the train station to the hotel will not be a big burden. The staff is very nice from the people behind the front desk to the staff cleaning rooms. Only draw backs were room showers are a bit tight and the morning coffee was served cold a few times. I would still return.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent location right on Grand Canal - a little bit of luxury”
Reviews.Author: Bobbie52
Reviews.Content: Hotel was excellent in comfort and luxury, and breakfast was ample. However, staff were very formal. Certainly efficient, but we found them not as friendly as those who owned or manned the B & Bs we stayed in throughout Italy. Luxury is great, but we found we enjoyed the personal contact with other people in B & Bs and Hotels that are family owned. Hotel Carlton is lovely, and the location great for seeing Venice.

Reviews.Title: “very nice”
Reviews.Author: ilis21
Reviews.Content: I would have prefered that the personel where more friendly. Internet axcess missing if you do not bring your own computer. Need wi-fi for cell phones and a computer in the lobby.

Reviews.Title: “Very nice Hotel in Venice.”
Reviews.Author: LarsAkeL
Reviews.Content: Very good hotel with good location. Nice rooms, this was our fourth stay in this hotel. Good service and nice staff.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location, Great Breakfast, Great Room!!”
Reviews.Author: Caz1988
Reviews.Content: THE LOCATION: The location was perfect, the hotel is an easy 3 minute walk (over 1 bridge) from Piazza Roma where the ATVO Bus from Marco Polo Airport comes directly from in just under 20 minutes (and regularly!). So after a 2 or so hour flight it was great to be in the city and at the hotel in such a short space of time. With regards to getting about and exploring the city we never had to walk too far to see the main sights (which you can get to easily if you follow the yellow signs on the buildings which are dotted everywhere). Walking from the Hotel = Rialto in 15-20 mins.... Piazza St Marco in 25-30 mins! THE HOTEL: I stayed here with my boyfriend from the 03/09/10-06/09/10 (3 nights). We stayed in a deluxe double which was a really good size, nicely decorated and very clean. We had a shower in our room which had a powerful shower and had hot water everyday! It was also very quiet which was nice after a busy and tiring day walking all around Venice! As for the view from our room... we didnt havent one... but then again we only came back to the room to sleep so it didnt matter. Although it would have been lovely to have a canal view! The Buffet breakfast was really good compared to what i've experienced in other Hotels..the coffee was particularly nice and there was a good selection of options... scrambled eggs, bacon, cold meat, cheeses, pastries, fruit and cereals! TIPS: Cafe Florian - it is definetely a must do as it is a beatifully decorated cafe....it is however very expensive! We both bought a cappucino and sat inside which cost us 8.50 euros EACH.... BUT we also got charged 6.50 EACH for the small musical ensemble that was playing outside (which was facing away from us haha!).. so 2x cappucino's actually cost us more like Â£30 haha... ohwell!! The (Jewish) Ghetto - Definetely the place to go for a good quality authentic meal that isn't over priced. Unfortunately we only explored this area on our last night! If you find the Fondamenta de la Misericordian which is a street in the Ghetto you will find lots of cosy little restaurants. There is also a traditional bar/restaurant where all the locals appear to go (I cant remember the name of it though!). This is the main problem we found...where the hell do you eat..you are spoilt for choice! Word of Caution: If they put bread on your table they will charge you for it (4-5 Euro's)...thats the one thing we quickly learnt...the Venetians love hidden charges haha! The Gondola - we paid 100 Euro's for a trip which took us up to the Rialto Bridge and back.... definetely the best way to see Venice...albeit expensive (we think it probably lasted 20-30 mins).

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful hotel in an excellent location”
Reviews.Author: babadavid
Reviews.Content: We were a little worried that we were staying too far from St Marks Square but on arrival the hotel was stunning and the staff very friendly. Situated at the northern part of the grand canal it is not in the middle of the madly busy tourist area. A lovely and calm surrounding with some brilliant resturants and bars within minutes walk. You can walk from the hotel to the southern part of the canal where you will find St Mark's Square in about 30 minutes. We feel the hotel is in an excellent location and were very impressed with the service and the condition of the hotel which is kept to a very high standard. All in all the perfect choice.

Reviews.Title: “great location, lovely view, very central”
Reviews.Author: meathwoman
Reviews.Content: The hotel was walking distance from the car garage where we parked our car so that was so handy we didnt have to wait on a water taxi. we were at the hotel within 10 mins. The hotel is very clean, rooms are lovely and we had a view of the Canal which was very nice. Weather in Venice was very hot when we were there so we were delighted with the air conditioning in the room. Staff were nice. We didnt eat at the hotel but we had a couple of drinks and everything in venice is fairly expensive. i would definately go back to this hotel again on my next visit to venice and recommend to anyone.

Reviews.Title: “Very good hotel located in a very convenient position,near to ferrovia piazzale Roma and the center”
Reviews.Author: giovanni1943
Reviews.Content: The hotel is very convenient for its location in front of the Ferrovia and near Piazzale Roma where all buses are coming.From there one can easily go by feet everywhere f.i. to S.Marco or Fondamenta Nuove.For us it was the 2nd time to stay, having got now a nice,spatious room in the patio,very comfortable and clean.Good breakfast,but the space may be not large enough to support the large presence of clients in this period (August). A minor inconvenient : air conditioning in the room too strong,difficult to regulate.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect!”
Reviews.Author: 0xxnikkixx0
Reviews.Content: I (20 years old) stayed here with my boyfriend (21) for his birthday, for 2 nights, and it was perfect! The hotel is really nicely and traditionally decorated throughout. It is about a 3 minute walk from the bus station, and easy to get to if you know what direction to go in.. When you get off the bus (don't go over the large glass bridge) go down the few steps in front of you, towards the canal, on the left there will be a small green bridge, go over that, then you come to a small stone bridge, go over that and the hotel is on the right down that road. We booked a deluxe double room with a view of the grand canal. I emailed a week before and requested if we could have one of the rooms with a small balcony, not just a window looking out, and we did get one with a balcony. The staff were really friendly and helpful in the emails and in person, and spoke fluent english. The room was a good size, you really don't need anything huge! The bed was big (and so comfortable, I slept so well both nights, there was no noise at all) & the shower worked very well. We put a do not disturb sign on in the morning so later that evening reception phoned up and asked if we wanted the maid to clean the room then, which was nice! I was also abit confused about what plug to take as I'd heard some places in Italy use plugs with 3 pins in a row, but the usual european ones with 2 were fine! The breakfast had something for everyone! Lovely croissants, with jams, choc spread, philadelphia, toast/bread, rolls, yoghurts, cereals, cold meats & cheese, fruit, bacon, scrambled egg, fruit juices, tea, coffee, hot choc. It was all really nice. It was served 7.30-10.30 (i think). There was so many restaurants and shops close by, and gondolas, water taxis and water buses right outside (with stops all the way down the canal) if you wanted to go further without walking. We walked most of the time, because you saw a lot more down the streets. You can't go wrong walking to St Marks Square... When you come out the hotel, if you cross over the bridge on the right then walk down the roads that way (about 25mins), it is lined with shops & restaurants and literally everyone is walking in the same direction to the square & rialto bride. There is also yellow signs pointing you in the right direction all the way, and if you go off track you'll always see a sign every now & then or just go towards the crowds. We actually preferred going off track, you could never get lost it was so small & so easy to get back to the busy areas if you wanted to, and we always felt so safe even though alot of the streets are narrow like alleys. We we much happier to be a little way from the square and main tourist areas because we got to see so much more of venice (it was our first time there). One day when walking towards St Marks, we didn't cross over the bridge outside the hotel, we stayed on the same side until a lot further down and walked through all quieter streets, over small bridges & often came across pretty courtyards with cafes which was really nice. This way had fewer tourist signs but as I said you can always find your way back to the main areas if you want to (theres often signs for vaporetto-water bus) so if you head towards that (if you get abit lost) that will take you back to the main canal & you can get on that for a few euros & go down to any point of the canal inc san marco (st marks sq,) There was a 'Hard Rock Cafe' just off the square which was really fun & stayed open til 00.30.. Really nice cocktails.. A lot of the other bars seemed very quiet, and quite small, so it was nice to go somewhere a bit more upbeat. We also had 2 really nice meals at restaurants (next to eachother) along the canal where the vaporetto drops you off. They both had cream tops. One was called 'Do Leoni' and was the restaurant in front of the 'Londra Palace Hotels' and the other was on the right of that also in front of a hotel and said 'RISORANTE', sorry can't remember the actual name! We had really nice steaks there. Overall we had such a nice time, & would definitely recommend the hotel. Its not right in the centre, but it really isn't far & like I said we much preferred it because you got to see alot more, and the walks & even the water bus rides were so nice. (the water bus runs 24hrs). I was deciding between the carlton, the rialto hotel, & the bonvecchiati (because I wanted a hotel on the canal, and these all looked the nicest from their websites, and were in my price range). I am so glad I picked the Carlton, it definitely looked the nicest from the outside, in person, and for all the reasons already mentioned. It had the best reviews too and now I can understand why. Don't hesitate to stay here! :)

Reviews.Title: “The hotel is so charming and at such a great location”
Reviews.Author: jillie02
Reviews.Content: The breakfast was excellent! The location cannot be beat and is across the canal from the train station. The hotel is very charming and very clean!

Reviews.Title: “Excellent”
Reviews.Author: TEEMILL
Reviews.Content: We stayed three nights in one of their patio rooms overlooking a small but charming courtyard, at ground floor level. Room was quite a good size, not overly big, but certainly big enough for us two and very nicely decorated. Air conditioning was a real boost. Bathroom was on the small side and would be much better if they removed the bidet! This however was the only minor niggle. We arrived late evening to a very warm and efficient welcome at reception with a porter standing by to take us to the room. We headed to the bar for a nightcap and again received a very warm welcome from the lovely staff. There are half a dozen or so tables outside the front of the hotel overlooking the Grand Canal which were perfect for people watching and viewing the canal activity. Breakfast was included in our deal and offered a fair selection, bacon, scambled eggs, various fresh fruit, ham, cheese, pastries, toast and preserves. Tea or various kinds of coffee were served at the table and again the staff were very friendly and efficient. Another bonus here is that breakfast is served up until 10.30am. We found the location very good. We had pre booked a private water taxi from the airport which dropped us off at the hotel landing stage. Just across the canal is the train station but as has been mentioned before, you have to cross a large bridge and l most certainly would not have cared for that trek with luggage. Just a short stroll from the hotel are many little cafes and restaurants. St Marks Square and the Rialto are about a 35 minute walk and you can quite easily get lost in the back streets on the way which we found very interesting and less crowded than the main street. An excellent hotel with friendly efficient staff, would most definately stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Great location”
Reviews.Author: syward
Reviews.Content: Convenient location to get off the train, drop your bag at your convenient hotel - and start exploring Venice!

Reviews.Title: “Great Location”
Reviews.Author: t72par
Reviews.Content: Very nice hotel located just across the Grand Canal from the train station. Short walk to hotel from station but many steps to go up and down when crossing the bridge. No problem unless you have an unusual number of bags. Breakfast buffet is very nice and has a good variety. Good food. We had the Rooftop Terrace Jr. Suite and it was great! Nice to sit out on the terrace and wind down from a busy day of sightseeing. Not much of a view but still nice. Friends had the Grand Canal view Jr. Suite and it was nice with one little problem. Partying under the window on the Grand Canal lasted until after midnight or after a couple of nights. Staff very helpful and spoke very good English. No communication problem.

Reviews.Title: “real good value - however room a little tight with the extra beds for children”
Reviews.Author: gvs_10
Reviews.Content: The staff were very friendly and helpful on our arrival and departure. Having been to Venice before we decided to experience its beauty once again and brought our two children (aged 6 and 8) and decided on a hotel near piazza romale as our flight did not get into late... location was superb within a 3 minute walk and it was right on the grand canal with easy access to the water bus, taxis, shops and restaurants. The room was very clean, air conditioning worked, breakfast in the morning was a better standard than i was expecting - my only fault was as we booked a family room - a double and 2 singles - the room was quite small and there was not much room to walk around the room.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful just a little out of the way”
Reviews.Author: Char029
Reviews.Content: I enjoyed my stay here. I booked with only 2 weeks to go so choice was limited. I paid Â£550 for a deluxe room with a canal view for 3 nights, the most I've ever paid but it was for our 1st year wedding anniversary. The view looked straight onto the train station but was nice to see the boats coming and going all day/night. It could be a little noisy late into the night and there was a funny smell in the room, it had rained heavily the day before we arrived and I think the water had soaked the carpet :0( You could sit and people watch for hours. The room was beautifully decorated, venetian style. The toilet view was the most interesting I have ever had, overlooking the waterside. The reception staff were very helpful, all with excellent english. The little restaurant next door did amazing spaghetti! Across the canal is a water bus stop so that was very handy. The only downside to it is that it is location on the quieter side of the Grand Canal so if you venture over towards St Mark's Sq/Rialto areas on an evening then it's a long and complicated walk home, through many narrow and dark streets. Some would prefer to be on the quieter side but I personally felt it was a long way away. x

Reviews.Title: “Enjoyed the Carlton Grand...”
Reviews.Author: PCBGal
Reviews.Content: Good location for dining and shopping, clean & comfortable rooms, and good breakfast.

Reviews.Title: “Elegant and charming in a beautiful city”
Reviews.Author: mimi903
Reviews.Content: We felt so well taken care of from the moment they picked us up at the airport til we left for our cruise. The Carlton on the Grand is very elegant, charming and in a great location on the Grand Canal. The room was larger than we had expected and was very old world with the beautiful venetian glass chandlier, the damask covered walls, bed and drapes, and the uniquely painted furniture. The bathroom was all marble with all the ammenities furnished. Our windows looked out on a lovely, quiet courtyard with a view of a large dome....the help was very attentive and the breakfast buffet was superb and offered a wide choice of items. We are looking forward to returning soon to this lovey hotel in a very romantic city. Both the city and the hotel are beautiful and charming.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect location”
Reviews.Author: Koku
Reviews.Content: The Hotel Carlton is located across the Grand Canal from the Train station and was easibly accessible via a water taxi from the airport. I really like this hotel - everyone was friendly, breakfast is very good, and the location couldn't better. It was quiet around the hotel - and all sites were easily walkable.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location”
Reviews.Author: dselvan
Reviews.Content: Booked this through booking.com. Stayed for 3 nights on bed and breakfast basis. Excellent location. Less than 10 minutes from Piazza de Roma where the airport bus arrives and leaves and over the bridge is the main railway station and vaporetto stops for almost all lines. Rooms are designed 'venetian' style. We had a room facing the courtyard but some of the upper floors face onto the Grand canal. Our room was extremely quiet and spacious for the two of us. The front desk were very helpful to most request and spoke english well. Breakfast Buffet was continental with the addition of scrambled eggs and bacon which were ok. Recommend this for the location which is difficult to beat without being extremely expensive.

Reviews.Title: “Great choice for staying in Venice”
Reviews.Author: chatnoire1967
Reviews.Content: I had a great experience with this hotel. Travellng to Venice is not easy due to all the bridges. To get to this hotel all you have to do is take the $3 bus to Pl. Roma then walk less than 10 minutes (over 2 bridges)- very easy. It's clean and elegant. The staff is professional and the room was clean- bathroom was gleaming. The only gripe I have is that the concierge seemed motivated to sell me a water taxi to my cruise ship ($100 or so) and tried to discourage me from taking the $1 people mover from Pl. Roma. We opted to take the people mover which was fine. Aside from that this hotel is great- it is a 30-40 minute walk to St. Mark's but it's a nice, scenic walk. If you are taking a cruise I highly recommend it for its proximity to the airport and cruise port.

Reviews.Title: “A Great Hotel In Venice”
Reviews.Author: LarDenMac
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Carlton Hotel three days before a cruise.The room was very clean as was the rest of the Hotel. The breakfast was very good and had a nice selection of food items.The location is perfect. The hotel had its own dock for water taxis. The train station and the Water Bus are both just on the other side of the canal, just a two minute walk..The staff are very friendly. The Front Desk staff went out of their way to solve a problem that we had with a tour company and did so very successfully. We would definitely stay at the Carleton again if we return to Venice.

Reviews.Title: “Hotel is in a good location and staff was helpful with our inquiries.”
Reviews.Author: jmansfi97
Reviews.Content: Hotel is near the train station and auto taxi drop point but located on the other side of the Grand Canal. This location got us away from the large crowd of people but kept us with a great view of the Canal. Easy access to water transportation and shopping areas without being in the middle of them. Breakfast was good, not great. Staff was helpful with our scheduling of daily activities.

Reviews.Title: “yes, we come back again”
Reviews.Author: Alexander-Herbert
Reviews.Content: Very fiendly staff, special thanks to "Filippo" the head-waiter. The CARLTON ist the perfect place to stay in venice. We have bin there for 4 nights. Half board is excellent - delicous food and perfeckt service!

Reviews.Title: “Good Location”
Reviews.Author: noonuija
Reviews.Content: Good Location not too far from Piazzale Roma (Bus, taxi, .. etc. stop). Opposite to Train Station also. Room rate is ok with breakfast.

Reviews.Title: “The Real Deal on Hotel Carlton Grand Canal!”
Reviews.Author: SeekingSun22
Reviews.Content: We stayed at this hotel for a long weekend on 21st May and it was a wonderful base for Venice. We booked a deluxe canal view room and it had a great view! The hotel is located opposite the train station, and the vaporetta (water bus) stop, and just next to a gondola station so there was lots of hustle and bustle! Never a dull moment just looking out at the Grand Canal! The only thing I would say is that it is very noisy at night so take some ear plugs if you book a canal view room! We really enjoyed using the vaporettas everyday to get to and from all the sights and the views of the Grand Canal were fantastic! Try to get seats at the very front for the most fabulous views! The main sights were all about 30 to 40 mins walk away and the walk was lovely and relaxing with lots of shops, bridges and lovely sights along the way. The hotel itself was nice although our ensuite bath had a bit of a leak. The breakfast had lots of choice although mostly continental style, but I think by european standards it was quite good! There were lots of places to eat nearby. For those seeking halal food, we found a couple of takeaway type places nearby but no proper halal restaurants. The takeaway places were along the main tourist walk from the railway station towards Rialto Bridge. This was my second time in Venice and I enjoyed it much more because of the location of the hotel. We saw much more of Venice, parts that I totally missed on my first visit. Would definately recommend this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Execellent location & services”
Reviews.Author: ESFG
Reviews.Content: It was a very nice hotel, close to Piazzale de Roma, easy to find and good access (only two bridges to be crossed). The hotel is very clean and the staff vey friendly.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel food and service were excellent.”
Reviews.Author: DaveBanbury
Reviews.Content: Stayed for 5 nights in patio room, thoroughly enjoyed this experience as you could sit outside and enjoy the ambience of the environment. Breakfast was excellent, lots of choice e.g continental and cooked style. All hotel staff were very amiable at all times. Hotel is ideally situated for access to all areas of Venice and other islands including the mainland (train station opposite hotel). P. le Roma within 5 minutes walking distance.

Reviews.Title: “What a beautiful hotel! Great location to...”
Reviews.Author: Coonies
Reviews.Content: What a beautiful hotel! Great location to station and water buses. A lovely walk through the shops into St Marks . Best breakfast on our holiday so far. The decor is very classy and staff very friendly. Would recommend this hotel to our friends and would definately stay again.

Reviews.Title: “First Time In Venice”
Reviews.Author: p_a_ramsay
Reviews.Content: Stayed for 3 nights in this hotel. Hotel is easy to find and the location is ideal being close to Piazzale Roma and S. Lucia rail station and on the Grand Canal. Walking to and from Piazza San Marco is easy and very enjoyable. The hotel staff are very friendly, courteous and helpful. We are a family of 2 adults and 1 teenager and stayed in a spacious room which had separate bedrooms for a double and single beds. Will definitely stay at this hotel on our next visit to Venice.

Reviews.Title: “Don't stay. You will not sleep, will not have good treatment from the staff and will be hard to take a shower.”
Reviews.Author: RNVR
Reviews.Content: DON'T STAY IF: you want to rest (or enjoy peace) ; want to be well treated ; will need help from the concierge (there is no concierge); want to have shower or bath; want a good hotel. STAY IF: you are short of money and they have a promotion like 60 euro per night (doesn't worth more) ; hotel owners are your relatives (family policy) ; will sleep and have breakfast in another place (use the hotel just to leave the baggage). Actually, don't stay even in these cases. Some days after the stay they offered a discount and an upgrade for returning guests who rate the hotel (with good ratings) in the Tripadvisor. Probably this is the reason they seem to be a nice hotel here. I paid 4 nights and left the hotel 1 night before because I could not stand the idea of sleeping one more night there. The worse is the noise in the room, at night and morning. Everything is noisy, specially in the neighbor rooms: flush, shower, bell, people walking and talking and also the corridor floor and the maid ringing the bells early in the morning. Add a hard bed and pillow, we have a restless trip. The front desk is hostile and blasÃ©, beside they are unhelpful. They didn't know the bus line to San Giuliano Park, for example. They did not indicate a good restaurant - just told there was not any good restaurant nearby. They did not seem to care if the stay would be pleasant. The room is small, but ok for a single room. But the bathroom is unbelievable. There is a 50cmx50cm bathtub where it is impossible to stay stand, and very uncomfortable to seat. Toilet seat cover doesn't stay open if you don't hold it. Soaps and shampoos are not replaced. Neither the towels. Breakfast is completely standard - some people may like it, if don't expect anything. They have the enough: few kinds of breads, fruits, eggs, bacon, cheese, ham, and NESCAFE. I don't like Nescafe, so I had the coffee outside. Actually, on the third day I ate at the train station. Service is, in some way, attentive, but there is nothing good to be served, so, worthless. I don't say it is in a good location because it is far from all Venice sights, though close to Train Station. After arriving by train there is a HUGE bridge between the station and the hotel, and you have to carry the bags through this bridge. My suggestion, if you have bags, is to stay at the same side of the station, like Rio TerÃ  Lista de Spagna. Or, take the vaporetto and go to the city center, near San Marco or Rialto. When I was leaving I would report my discontent, but for my surprise the attendant was sweet. I retained. Than she called the other attendant, unpleasant as all others and he made my check out. I tried to see her name to make an compliment. The badge says TRAINEE. Unfortunately she is learning in the wrong way.

Reviews.Title: “Thank you for helping to make our stay in Venice memorable and special”
Reviews.Author: goldpiano
Reviews.Content: We were looking for a a city break in Venice to relax and take in the sights. The Carlton on the Grand Canal was a perfect hotel for just that. The service was excellent and the staff very friendly. (breakfast was a bit of a bun fight...... but that is possibly because the choice on offer was so good). Location was great. so the hotel helped to make our stay most memorable.

Reviews.Title: “Amazing”
Reviews.Author: butterflycats
Reviews.Content: We enjoyed this hotel very much! We were there for my birthday and it couldnt have been better. We stayed in the rooftop junior suite and were treated with the utmost care. Our room was ready in a few minutes, complete with cake, balloons and a bottle of Proseco. The bathroom was huge , along with the rest of the suite and was decorated with soft green and gold brocade and Murano glass chandeliers. Our private terrace was wonderful, and we even enjoyed the bells of the church next door. We didnt have a canal view but we didnt care. The hotel staff was courteous and made reservations for us at a wonderful restaurant, the Ristorante Al Brindisi, which was a short walk from the hotel in a little piazza. The staff also ensured we had a map and pointed out the places to visit and how to get there. Be warned that if you arrive by train, the hotel is across the canal, but you must carry your bags over the large bridge which has many steps, or pay 25 Euros to have it brought over. We loved Venice and the hotel was excellent! Wish we could go back very soon.

Reviews.Title: “excellent location with lovely venectian decor”
Reviews.Author: petathlone
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for three days after a cruise,what a great way to end our 25 years celebration.Fantastic location,outside the centre but easy to acess the centre with the vaporetta which is just across from hotel.Buy a 2 or 3 day ticket and then you can go where ever you want and see venice at its best.The hotel is bright with a lovely breakfast .Our hotel was at the back but i loved it ,the decor was so unusual and we had a murona chandalere which i think is standard for all rooms.It is expensive to eat in the hotel but you dont have to eat there as there are lovely restaurants arond it.Will definately stay there again if ever in venice again and will recommend it to all my family and friends.

Reviews.Title: “Better than expected”
Reviews.Author: thomaswychan
Reviews.Content: I came from Hong Kong and joined Costa cruise to be on board in Venice. At the beginning, I am afraid of that what kind of hotel I booked via internet? When I arrived, it makes me felt so comfortable especially the breakfast provided and the excellent service of the staffs.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location and beautiful hotel---Highly recommended”
Reviews.Author: SMMPhoenix_Arizona
Reviews.Content: The location couldn't be better..a short walk from Piazza Roma and right accross the canal from the train station. The breakfast was excellent and the hotel was very comfortable and safe. The room and shower was somewhat small.

Reviews.Title: “Value for Money”
Reviews.Author: nupursagar
Reviews.Content: WE stayed in the Carlton for 2 nights and it was a pleasant experience. The rooms are in old venetian style decor and quite comfortable. The hotel is extremely well located and a stones throw away from the train station and all water buses. We had a canal room view which was good, though im not sure about the regular rooms coz they could be quite dark and dingy i suppose. Over all an good stay.

Reviews.Title: “excellent location but quite expensive”
Reviews.Author: olivia459
Reviews.Content: The Carlton is a lovely hotel right on the Grand Canal opposite the train station, so excellent position. Our room had a balcony overlooking the canal that was just about big enough to squeeze a chair on to, so perfect for watching the traffic go by. The room was comfortable, and a good buffet breakfast was provided.

Reviews.Title: “The real Venice feeling”
Reviews.Author: gerdo
Reviews.Content: We stay in this wonderful hotel for a few days and all what we can say is : Perfect ! We booked a room to the "Canale Grande" and it's soo wonderful to view this city from this side. / The hotel staff is friendly and the breakfast is for a hotel in Venice very good We come for sure back in this great hotel. And the whole hotel is on a absolutly modern high-tech standard. Fresh renovated and all rooms in a fascinating Venetian style.

Reviews.Title: “Absolutely perfect for our stay in Venice. Amazing amazing amazing.”
Reviews.Author: bada1982
Reviews.Content: I just want to say that my stay at Carlton was brilliant! It was a last minute booking and some reviews on Tripadvisor spoke of indifferent customer service. NOTHING could have been further from the truth. The staff were warm and friendly and more than happy to accomodate varying levels of italian and help prompt us when we practiced on them. Staff would catch our eye and wave/say hello as we walked through the lobby. One staff member even did so as we walked past him at a cafe in the street. The room was exceptional and incredible value for money. The quality of finish for the hotely in general was beautiful. The convenience of arriving on the train and walking across the pedestrian bridge to the hotel cannot be overstated and you are well and truly handy to everything, with the waterbus just across the canal. Highly reccomended, can't say enough about this place!

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic location and excellent service”
Reviews.Author: Roadrunner7631
Reviews.Content: We chose this hotel after it was recommended by a friend. The hotel is in a superb location. It is directly across from the train station and about 4 mins walk from where the bus drops you from the airport. This journey takes about 20 mins. The hotel is situated right on the grand canal. The views are amazing and if you get the chance to sit on the terrace and watch the world and gondolas go by we recommend this too. The staff are always pleasant and nothing is too much trouble. The breakfast is very good and one of the best we have had on the Continent. The hotel is very clean and the lobby bar is very pleasant to relax in after a day walking around Venice. Recommend the cocktails too ;-). We didnt eat in the main restaurant but that was solely because we usually ate somewhere on our walk back to the hotel each night. We walked all around Venice over 3 days and there is no better starting point than this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “slightly over-priced for what it offers.”
Reviews.Author: mikik85
Reviews.Content: There was nothing special or outstanding about the place. The room was very plain and simple-not too clean, not too dirty. It is a place to stay if you need to be near Santa Lucia station. The breakfast was poor. The bread (rolls) couldn't be harder.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent view”
Reviews.Author: CAGJS
Reviews.Content: Overall the hotel was good. Rooms are excellent, very well kept and the design was amazing. For the price would have liked to have at least a complimentary water. The internet only worked one of the two nights.

Reviews.Title: “Lovely, fantastic location”
Reviews.Author: Andb76
Reviews.Content: This was our first time in Venice so where to stay was a gamble. I have to say that this hotel was excellent. The location opposite the train station and close to Pte Roma is ideal. The Vaporetto goes from opposite and makes seeing Venice easy. Hotel provided an adequate breakfast and very good service. Eating out at night is easy. Room was goo with balcony on Grand Canal but no chairs to sit outside on. There was noise from the Vaporettos as night but the location meant that the disruption was bearable. I would certainly reccommend and hope to go back.

Reviews.Title: “Brilliant stay”
Reviews.Author: Becks10
Reviews.Content: I travelled to Venice with my mother and chose the Carlton Hotel on the Grand Canal through their good internet offer. It was my mother's first time to Venice, but my third and I have experienced that Venice hotels can somewhat not what they say they are. However, I have never stayed near the bus and train station and feared that would take Venice out of the experience so to speak. That did not happen. The Hotel Carlton is very well situated. Immediately by enterting, we were most welcomed by two nice and very helpful gentlemen in the reception. Generally we were treated lovely and cordially through the whole stay. It really made a difference for us. The hotel is very easy to find and excellent location if you don't mind the 30 minutes boat ride to San Marco. Plentiful of choices of restaurants somewhat cheaper than nearer Rialto.. Breakfast was excellent and included. The bar a bit pricey. The rooms are of average size and larger than I had feared from former experiences in Venice. We chose a room at the back for quietness and got what we asked for. The view of Grand Canal is nice, but you can hear the water buses well. However in late May I don't think that is a problem, if you don't mind a bit of noise. The rooms are very clean and tidy. The bathrooms good. All in all I would recommend this hotel to everyone travelling to Venice.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic stay”
Reviews.Author: hmcfetridge
Reviews.Content: Hotel Carlton on the Grand Canal was so much more than just a place to stay. The hotel itself is beautiful, filled with fresh flowers and well-kept. When we first arrived, there was no immediate record of our reservation (made by our travel agency), and the front desk employees were incredibly professional about it- they invited us to relax in the cafe until they could figure out the problem. We ordered some cappuccinos while we waited, and the kind waiter provided cookies and chips for free. A half-hour later, we were taken to our rooms, which we were very pleased with. They had FANTASTIC air conditioning, a hair dryer in the bathroom, plenty of hot water in the shower, and comfortable (uh, firmly comfortable) beds. The breakfast buffet (included with our stay) was very comprehensive, with eggs, meats, cheeses, cereals, rolls, pastries, yogurts, juices... the list goes on. Hotel Carlton also provided us with great restaurant recommendations, advice for getting around Venice, and called water taxis for us when needed. The hotel is situated conveniently near the train station, but across the canal from it so you avoid all the foot traffic of the station. Overall, the service and accommodations were wonderful and much more than we'd hoped for!

Reviews.Title: “Perfect, divine, marvellous”
Reviews.Author: africaSurrey
Reviews.Content: We spent a weekend in venice with my partner and 3 year old son. What an impressive hotel and the location was absolutely perfect. It is on the canal. We wished we had booked a room overlooking the canal but we still had a lovely room. On the opposite side of the canal is the train station and a boat station. The bus from the airport stops very close to the location. We only paid Euro2.50 each for the bus trip from the airport and it would have cost us a fortune if we had chosen to use a boat taxi or normal taxi. Great location. Breakfast was a delight. Staff were so helpful and friendly. If I have to fault the hotel then it is only to say we were not allowed a late check out which was slightly inconvinient as our flight out was 10pm that night. But we found loads to do in venice and spent a day at the Lido di sol, therefore time passed by very quickly. They did however allow us to leave our luggage and freshen up in their toilets before we headed of to the aiport. Highly recommend this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “First class service in all aspects”
Reviews.Author: JESCOTTY
Reviews.Content: My wife and I really enjoyed our four day vacation in Venice and found the staff and service at the Carlton on the Canal of the highest order. We had problems with missing luggage on arrival and the staff at reception could not have been more helpful. The junior suites that we occupied were extremely comfortable and added to to pleasure of the vacation. We will certainly stay at " The Carlton " again should we visit Venice.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel in a great location giving the Venice "experience"”
Reviews.Author: crusty_smith
Reviews.Content: Bus from airport to bus station is a great money saver and is only a couple of minutes walk to the Carlton. Hotel right near railway station and main shopping areas but still a restfull hotel on the Grand Canal. Jump on a water bus close by and visit all the tourist destinations with a day pass. Great little restaurants close by or eat at the hotel which is great anyway.

Reviews.Title: “Convenient location, pleasant stay”
Reviews.Author: snowphalaenopsis
Reviews.Content: Good location close to both the train and bus stations. Breakfast was generous and the staff efficient, polite and professional. We had a room on the 3rd floor facing the Grand Canal which was nice. There was some noise from the Vaporetta's at night but nothing too dramatic. Room decorated in the typical Venetian style.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location”
Reviews.Author: jfpumbaa
Reviews.Content: I think everyone has pointed out that this is a great location easily to just hope on the bus from the airport and get off and its a short walk from there, or if you came in from the train its just right across from the train station. Easily access to the water buses to get to the center of the city, and the staff was very helpful and spoke very good English. The breakfast here was probably the best we had through our tour of Europe in five different hotels.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic Venice hotel!”
Reviews.Author: peter_panfil
Reviews.Content: I had a business trip in Europe and my wife and I decided to stay over a few days and visit Venice. We had not originally planned to stay at this hotel - we had booked another hotel thru my corporate travel office. When we arrived at the original hotel we were told we would have to pay more than our reservation indicated. A lot of that was happening all over EWurope due to the Iceland volcano. We stayed there that night but moved to the Hotel Carlton the next day. It is very convenient to public transportation - right across the canal from the train station and public water bus. It is also adjacent to the bus from the airport. We chose a slightly larger double room and the hotel moved a queen size matress in for my wife and I (it is common in Europe to have split single beds that are pushed together, but have a crack down the middle). The hotel was clean, quiet and well maintained. The breakfast was included and was better than most we have experienced in Europe. Each morning we carried our coffee out to the tables in front to enjoy the sights. The staff was excellent and spoke English very well. When our flight to the US was changed we decided to leave our luggage with them and have it shipped back - they made all the arrangements. We highly recommend staying there and will do so in the future when we are in Venice.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful”
Reviews.Author: jcb321
Reviews.Content: Great place, clean, good staff. Great breakfast and an elevator. Rooms were average size of any Euro hotel you will find. By US Standards they are smaller. I would and hopefully will return and stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful hotel, excellent service, friendly and efficient staff.”
Reviews.Author: PaulLincoln_England
Reviews.Content: We chose this hotel because all the Trip Advisor reviews were good - we were not disappointed. We were delighted with the location which was away from the busy area of Piazza San Marco but right next to the Grand Canal where there was plenty of Venetian bustle. Our room faced the hotel patio and was a good size and very comfortable - as we weren't acclimatised to Italian temperatures and like a cool room, it would have been nice had the AC been switched on for the season, however, we were perfectly comfortable. The staff everywhere in the hotel were very friendly, helpful and efficient, especially ensuring that tables in the breakfast room were cleared promptly allowing every one to enjoy breakfast from the good choice of buffet. Restaurant and bar service were equally good - we dined in the restaurant for the special dinner on the Feast of St Mark and had a delicious meal of huge prawns, gnocchi with asparaus and scallops, fillets of turbot and tiramisu. All was beautifully presented and expertly served. Were we to return to Venice - a distinct possibility as we throughly enjoyed our stay - we would without doubt stay at this hotel again as we found it hard to fault.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent accommodation”
Reviews.Author: VincentKifissia
Reviews.Content: An Excellent hotel in every way. Venetian-style rooms, very clean, with facilities like hair dryer, internet access, tv, mini bar, great view to the Grand Canal (at least, as far as our room is concerned). Easy access to vaporeto stations. Really good breakfast, excellent service in breakfast area. Very friendly stuff, willing to give you directions about what to see, where to eat etc. An excellent choice in general, for someone who wants to visit Venice and wants to avoid the crowded area of Piazza San Marco.

Reviews.Title: “We definitely made the right choice”
Reviews.Author: twiles
Reviews.Content: When it comes to planning a vacation, I probably spend too much time researching hotels. But a bad hotel experience can ruin a great vacation experience. With over 400 hotels in Venice to choose from, it was a little overwhelming. We ended up choosing the Hotel Carlton on the Grand Canal. The minute we stepped out of the Santa Lucia train station, and saw the hotel directly across the canal, we knew we made the right decision. The room we stayed in was beautiful. The staff was friendly and accommodating. The breakfast was much more than we had anticipated. And the location was perfect. Venice was the first stop on our trip in Italy, and we absolutely loved it. It set the tone for the rest of the trip. Hotel Carlton played a key role in making our time in Venice so enjoyable and memorable.

Reviews.Title: “A perfect match for a romantic stay in Venice”
Reviews.Author: KoV2010
Reviews.Content: Well, Very often I've experienced that I get a room not meeting my expectations for many different reasons. in this case they fully met them which is enough with saying from my side.

Reviews.Title: “Outstanding location, outstanding service!”
Reviews.Author: scott112233
Reviews.Content: An excellent hotel with very competitive pricing and outstanding service. The hotel staff were without exception courteous and helpful. The hotel rooms were of a very good standard and extremely well cleaned. The breakfast sets one up for the enitre day! TV with English speaking channels in the room and newspapers in the luxurious foyer. The bar is welcoming and well priced, serving drinks and coffees etc late into the night. This is a hotel to which we will definitely return in the future - can't fault it, marvellous.

Reviews.Title: “Lovely hotel in a great location”
Reviews.Author: elle1leeds
Reviews.Content: We booked our two night stay at this hotel through Thomas cook . We`d booked a double superior room with a garden view. Upon our arrival we were unexpectedly shown to an amazing room at the front of the hotel with a balcony over looking the Grand Canal. The staff were brilliant, couldn`t do enough for us, they were very helpful. The Breakfast was buffet style, you could have anything from fresh pastries, cerials, fruit, cheese and cold meats and also scrambled eggs with bacon. We would certainly stay at this hotel again as the location is also a massive bonus.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent location - Excellent Hotel”
Reviews.Author: Sunworshiper10
Reviews.Content: We arrived from Marco Polo Airport took the shuttle to Piazzale Roma from there to the Hotel Carlton is a 5 minute walk over the bridge lovely scenery for first time visitors to Venice. Arrived at the hotel which I must say is our 4th time that we stayed there. Hotel checked us in very efficiently. We traveled with our adult children. Hotel location is excellent if you need to travel with the railway it is opposite over the bridge also many water buses that take you to the Rialto Bridge and St Marks Square. Hotel is clean and very well kept. Staff very helpful if you need help getting around Venice. Plenty of shops, coffee bars etc near by. Breakfast is very good coffee could be hotter but that is a minor issue. We would definitely recommend this hotel it is excellent if you are staying overnight for Cruise Ships as the location is so near to the Port. We will be booking once again next year. Thank you Hotel Carlton.

Reviews.Title: “Not as good as it seems...”
Reviews.Author: NickHertfordshire
Reviews.Content: The ethos of this hotel is to get as much money out of you as possible whilst providing as little as possible. Breakfast is as basic as it could be. For a hotel in Italy to have such a poor selection of fruit (apples, oranges, pineapple everyday; no variation) and such a large bowl of tinned fruit each day is a disgrace. Every ingredient at the buffet table was as cheap as it could possibly be; very poor bread, museli diluted with corn flakes. The photos on the website of bedrooms are misleading. We upgraded to a double deluxe room overlooking the canal, however, it was smaller than we were led to believe. The cost of the items in the minibar were outrageously expensive even by Venice standards as was their restaurant; both were avoided. The staff at reception clearly hadn't realised that their job was to serve customers. I usually had to interrupt their conversations to get their attention. Strangely, the staff in the breakfast room were excellent, so clearly a different attitude there. I will try another hotel when I return to Venice.

Reviews.Title: “Pleasant hotel with a nice atmosphere”
Reviews.Author: UppsalaMuffin
Reviews.Content: No special comment. I received what I expect from a good hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Good value on the grand canal”
Reviews.Author: impostere
Reviews.Content: This was our fourth visit to Venice and for a change decided to stay up by Ferrovia on the canal. This hotel offered canal facing rooms at a discount during March just before the season,in fact we paid for four nights and received a fifth one free! The location is fine just over the bridge for the vaparetto for five lines so in fact there is not much changing. The car parks are near (Roma is a five minute walk) and there is a large supermarket near if you need one.The reception is excellent . It is staffed by multi language helpful,curteous people to whom nothing was too much trouble.The rooms are small and a bit tight ( but this is Venice) all in all a very nice hotel especially off season.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic,Magnificient and most rejuvenating stay.”
Reviews.Author: kjoshi50
Reviews.Content: This was our wedding anniversary and my wife expressed the desire to visit Venice.After a lot of online research we decided to make a hotel reservation at the Carlton on the Grand Canal Hotel. There can be nothing so much convenient and so beautiful as this hotel. Bang opposite the Venice Santa Lucia Train Station accross the Grand Canal,it was so convenient, took us exactly 3 minutes of walking.It was snowing in Venice when we arrived,but there was no problem crossing the bridge with our bags and walking into the hotel.At the Hotel we were greeted very warmly by the staff and taken to our second floor room overlooking the Grand Canal.
