Even though it was night time,the sight was heavenly.Rooms are great,very beautifully appointed and very comfortable.For the three nights we stayed there, we slept very well with no disturbance at all.You wake up in the morning,open the balcony door and view the beautiful emrald green water of the canal, and all your spirits rise and you forget about the rest of the world and take in the splendour created jointly by Mother Nature and Mankind. The staff in the hotel were very polite,very warm and very helpful.Two persons who really went 'Above and Beyond' to make our stay enjoyable are Enrico and Dario.Realising that we were vegetarians, Enrico went out of his way to fix some nice veggie sandwiches for us.He speaks good English and we would recommend you find him out to answer any questions.You can't miss him, he is always there during breakfast. Very good and wholesome breakfast with a wide selection really makes this Hotel an exceptional choice for those visiting Venice.We would highly recomend the Carlton on the Grand Canal, for it's proximity to the Train Station, the Water Bus stop,the Gondola Station and all nice eating places etc. Most importantly, the very courteous and friendly staff make it more than 'worth it' to choose this place to stay. We are quite sure we are coming again and this time with our extended family and we are sure the Carlton on the Grand Canal will roll out the Red Carpet for us again.

Reviews.Title: “A more comfortable place to stay in Venezia, Hotel Carlton on the Grand Canal”
Reviews.Author: clara2010
Reviews.Content: I 've been here 2 nights. very near Santa Lucia rail way station and easy to find location although never have been Venezia. If you go around Venezia by foot from the hotel . It is possible but You must know well map. This hotel is very clean and quiet but room is antique deco except bath room(If you interested in this style no problem) . Bath room is very Clean & modern style , However I recommend this hotel. It was very comfortable for me.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel, wonderful location, friendly and helpful staff`”
Reviews.Author: florencern
Reviews.Content: This was our first trip to Venice , and we booked the hotel sight unseen the night before we left. We got an excellent last minute deal on the room, although somehow in the process we booked starting a night earlier than our arrival. When we got there the hotal staff were good enough to extend our stay to the correct dates without an addditional charge. The only disappointment was that we had booked the double superior room which was advertised with a view of the grand canal, and that room wasn't available for us. I suggest you spend the extra for the superior room anyway becasue the regular rooms are much smaller and ours was small enough. Hotel staff were able to communicate in English, and were very helpful with directions and answering other questions. The hotel was very clean and well decorated. The price included a great breakfast buffet which had many choices. We didn't eat at the hotel restaurant, opting instead for local cafes where the food was much cheaper and still excellent. The hotel is located a short walk from the train station, saving the cost of a water taxi (which were very expensive). We purchased a 3 day water bus pass for 33 euros that allowed unlimited on and off trips all over Venice and to the neighboring islands. We went in early March and were surprised by the extremely cold weather. While we missed the mobs of tourists, you really needed a heavy coat, gloves, and hat most days. If we go again in the spring we'll plan for a date later in March or April. Overall it was a great trip and a great hotel experience. I would recommend it to anyone looking for a place to stay.

Reviews.Title: “meraviglioso”
Reviews.Author: m_monb
Reviews.Content: I stayed in this wonderful hotel for 4 nights. I enjoyed a lot the Panoramic Surprise package . This is a very good choice. I highly recommend any of the packages offered by the hotel management. The staff was so nice, helpful, wonderful. Everything was so good. Nothing bad to mention. The location is also wonderful. Near to Central station and all the other touristic interests.

Reviews.Title: “Lovely Hotel. Great Staff”
Reviews.Author: chriskane
Reviews.Content: Loved location staff friendly and helpful. Rooms overlooked courtyard. Got water taxi from airport. Expensive but with 6 of us and Dad disabled and taxi came up to steps of hotel and booking return was 20% discount wellworth money. We spent first night in Hotel bar and found staff very helpful. At breakfast next morning staff found 6 in party table together without us asking. Would stay at this Hotel again if returned to Venice.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful hotel in a wonderful city”
Reviews.Author: jimmy_boy81
Reviews.Content: Came back on saturday from Venice and i cannot recommend the Hotel Carlton enough. The decor of the hotel is wonderful, the rooms are more than adequate and the staff are wonderfully helpful and friendly. Location of the hotel is also excellent, walking to the Rialto bridge and San Marco was a breeze and also located very close to the train station, bus terminal and water bus stations All in all a great hotel and would highly recommend to anyone

Reviews.Title: “deluxe double ? have bigger stationery cupboard at work”
Reviews.Author: Hewell
Reviews.Content: The room was VERY small. The 'bathroom' had a half bath (meaning with a seat!) - and a shower you could hardly turn around in over the top. Even with the curtain inside the bath the whole (small room) got soaked. It's placed near very touristy, VERY expensive, awful restaurants. I wanted a room looking out over the water - MAJOR mistake. The water taxis and water buses run 24/7 and are very noisy. They stop (and start!) directly opposite the hotel = no sleep. The only plus was the truly lovely woman who ran the bar. A great professional who remembered exactly what you had ordered previously - and your room number!

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful Hotel in a Beautiful City”
Reviews.Author: tx09
Reviews.Content: Hotel was conveniently located near the train station and vaporetto stops, which was very nice. It is not near the center of the tourist areas, but those areas were very easy to get to. Our hotel had a balcony overlooking the river, and it was beautiful. We bought groceries at the grocery store nearby, a bottle of wine, and sat out to view the city and the people passing by. Considering we were so close to the river, it was very quiet. The room was small but beautiful, with a beautiful chandelier. Breakfast was good, and the staff were friendly and helpful. I would stay here if we visit again.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, friendly staff and aged decore”
Reviews.Author: NorbitonFlyer
Reviews.Content: Carlton is in a great position directly opposite the train station and only 5mins walk from the main bus station, making access to your hotel very easy. Initial inspection of the hotel was great and looked 4 star. The reception staff were friendly and always willing to provide assistance. The room was a bit smaller than I thought (booked the superior double over looking the court yard) and while the place was decorated only 5-8 years ago, already a lot of chips and marks made the room appear a liitle grubby. That was pretty much the main bad point as the room was very warm (even slept with the window open in feb) and the breakfast was more than just a continental, with scrambled eggs and bacon as well. The room service was expensive though (3euro 50 cents for a can of coke and breakfast in bed was 5 euros each and most things in the lobby had to be additionaly paid for. One other point, but for some reason the place has been re-furbed so that your room door opens out into the hallway ?? why ?? this meant having to be extra careful not to knock someone off their feet if they happened to be passing by your room when you opened the door. Bit weird, but hey, they're crazy these europeans :-)

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Hotel, Fantastic Location: would highly recommend”
Reviews.Author: welltravelledwoman
Reviews.Content: Stayed at the Carlton for 5 nights leaving 3rd March and had a fantastic holiday made better by having such a good hotel.This is probably the cleanest hotel that I have ever stayed in. The staff were pleasant and very helpful without being intrusive. The breakfast was plentiful and delicious and taken in a lovely room. The hotel is directly across the canal from the Ferovia vaporetto stop which takes you anywhere in the city and to the islands as well. Buy a pass for the number of days that you are staying and its much cheaper than paying per journey. The hotel is just along from the Piazzale Roma which is where the taxis and buses from the airport drop you off but be aware that there are 2 bridges to cross between there and the hotel which are a bit of a slog with luggage - pack lightly. The hotel is in a good area and quiet by night but with access to restaurants and bars directly over the Scalzi Bridge which is about 50 meters from the front door. It is an easy walk to Rialto and on to St Marks Square if you are reasonably fit and active. The bridges can be tiring for the older traveller. If you are feeding a family or looking for authentic food at a good price go to Brek which is just down to road to the right as you come off the bridge. Not the best looking restaurant but full of Italians, basic but excellent food and the best prices we saw anywhere in the city. We had a thoroughly enjoyable vacation which was made all the better for staying in such a lovely hotel.Can highly recommend the Serenaded Gondola Ride which very schmaltzy but great fun (and the man can sing) and the Vivaldi Concert at Scuolo San Teodoro near to Rialto. Don't buy concert tickets online. We paid E29 each for E25 tickets which we could have bought on the door on the night or paid E30 for better seats which is what I thought I had bought.

Reviews.Title: “Staff very helpful, decor and furnishings past their best, breakfast disappointing.”
Reviews.Author: StarJade
Reviews.Content: This hotel didn't live up to expectations. We had one of the patio garden rooms. There is no garden, just a few flower pots and tables and chairs in a tiny internal courtyard. No tissue box in the room - surely this is standard these days even in lesser establishments? No glasses for the mini bar. Decor rather old and tired looking. Bathroom clean and fairly large. Handheld shower - no wall attachment. Breakfast fare rather limited: ham, salami, two sorts of sliced cheese, yogurts, the hardest bread rolls imaginable, croissants, tinned pineapple, apples and oranges in the fruitbowl (no bananas, pears or any of the other fruit we saw in the local markets), scrambled egg, toast. Not up to four star standard. Not much ambience in the restaurant for our candlelit dinner. Bread rolls were hard at dinner too. Very expensive (but then so was much of Venice). Gin and tonic E12. Very convenient for the railway station. The hotel faces you as you come out of the station. Be warned though, you can't see it from the bus station. We spent forty minutes trying to find it. Everyone we asked gave different directions. Most said don't cross the bridges, just follow the canal. What they meant was don't cross the big bridge. Instead, walk down the steps to the edge of the canal, go right under the big bridge and then go over the first small bridge you come to keeping the Grand Canal on your left. This bridge is green. Then go over the small stone bridge in front of you. The hotel is then 100 yards on your right. If you get lost ask for the railway station. In the summer this hotel would be a good choice as you're near the terminus for the vaparetto. In February it seemed too far away from the main sites. By the way, you can get a taxi (a car not a water bus) from the airport to the bus station. Cost was Â£36 compared with E2.50 for the number 5 ACTV bus. The water bus is said to be around E90 although we didn't use it.

Reviews.Title: “Don't stop in Roof Top Junior Suite with terrace”
Reviews.Author: marcusUK1684
Reviews.Content: The room was far from perfect, I have stayed in travel lodges that are better! The view was ok although the picture out onto the balcony on their website is VERY misleading. In the picture they have very cleverly placed flowers in the way so to block the actual view which is just overlooking the front roof of the hotel! All of the windows in the room where lacking any putty so rattled all day without the shutters being down which then ruined what view their was. Certainly not a panoramic view as described on their website from the Top Junior Suite. A good view of the rear hotel walls though! Room service was not great either, and when requested a couple of glasses for a bottle of wine we were given, 10 minutes later 3 x plastic cups. This by the way is the most expensive room in their 4 star hotel! No signs of a menu for evening room service although the breakfast room service was ok. Oh and the grand king size bed was actually 2 x single beds held together with a sheet! Certainly not a 4 star hotel in my opinion and very high prices! Very calmly explained to the manager all the issues we had on the second day of three and he clearly was not interested one bit saying what do I expect for an old building and yes all our beds are 2 x single but we have a few double mattresses in the hotel if you would prefer! Marvellous . . . . Certainly wouldnâ€™t stop their again and I am in the process of trying to get some money back from the hotel!

Reviews.Title: “Just the kind of Hotel you would like to stay when in Venice.”
Reviews.Author: manutraductor
Reviews.Content: I stayed with my wife and three children and we took a family room on the penthouse. The room was big, cosy, very well furnished in a classical style, almost soundproof (one children is two years old), the views were astonishing and the king size mattress was super confortable .The hotel is very well located. Reception desk personnel very helpful, good humored, resolutive and of venetian appearance. Breakfast recommended and I shall highlight that the closing time is fixed at around 10h30AM.

Reviews.Title: “Put Venice on your bucket list!”
Reviews.Author: momofdr
Reviews.Content: Close to train station, water buses, great location!

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic Hotel - Great Location!!”
Reviews.Author: ChumpyGirl10
Reviews.Content: We had a great stay at this hotel, everything was as expected. The hotel is in a great location, there is a waterbus terminal and train station, both opposite the hotel, great for travelling around the city. We flew into Trevisso Airport and were dropped off at the coach station, which is in walking distance of the hotel! We stayed in a Superior room, which was excellent.The cleanliness of the room was given top marks, everything was perfect. Breakfast was lovely, wide variety to choose from. Staff were also really pleasant. We stayed in January, the hotel seemed to have a few guests but was always nice and quiet! I would definatley stay at this hotel again!

Reviews.Title: “Good location, service and atmosphere”
Reviews.Author: Northern_explorer_10
Reviews.Content: Very good service and perfect location, just opposite of railway station and near bus station. Splendid view and atmosphere to the Grande Canal from our deluxe rooms. Very good value.

Reviews.Title: “Not suitable for romance”
Reviews.Author: areyougunnagomyway
Reviews.Content: We were so excited a 4star hotel for our honeymoon on the Grand Canal... and were terribly disapointed. Our 'Superior room' on the 'internal courtyard' overlooked the airconditioning unit and a cement wall. This room was small and dark but did have the beautiful fittings promised on the hotels website. The bed was two singles pushed together and sheeted seperately. We upgraded the next day at an additional cost of 50 Euros. The 'Premier room' had a full bed, and room for two people to pass without climbing on the furniture and being our honeymoon we demanded a view of the canal which was charming. Pillows were still like cardboard. There are no tea of coffee facilities in the rooms. Go to a local cafe they're 90cents, same coffee in the bar downstairs was 3.50euros. Bathrooms were clean, and had full baths. They appear untouched by the renovation and have an ugly 80's beige influence. The hairdryers offered are next to useless. We stayed in winter which we were told was very quiet and many businesses are closed. Room heating was fantastic and we had full control over the thermastat. The TVs have a fancy entertainment system that offeres internet if you have your laptop with you, BBC world news and movies (11 euros). The staff have excellent English, but we found that even the smallest vendors in the side streets did too. They were polite but not overly helpful. We wanted to see an exhibition promoted on a street poster and unable to make heads of tails of the location the staff looked it up for us and sent us to the wrong gallery which cost us a day of our trip. Buffet breakfast was fantastic, big variety available. The waiters who brought coffee were friendly, which made a nice start to the day. The location is convenient for the train station and relatively easy to find from the airport. It is the wrong side of the island for all the big attractions though everything can be reached within a 40minute casual walk through the laneways or by the ferries. If we hadn't booked our entire stay's accomodation with our flights we would have found another hotel.

Reviews.Title: “malto bieni! (Fantastic)”
Reviews.Author: fredblue66
Reviews.Content: We did not see a better place to stay in Venice. Right across from the main train station, the staff was very friendly and helpful, the rooms and beds excellent, and the food outstanding!

Reviews.Title: “excellent location”
Reviews.Author: nm007dubai
Reviews.Content: Hotel is right opposite the train station. ferry stations are also outside the train station making it convinient to move around. We had booked in the carlton capri which was closed for renovations and we were given a room in this hotel instead. the room was small but clean and the staff was very friendly. Internet was a disappointment as it was very expensive. the restaurant was decent and food was quite good. we planned to travel to paris by the night train hence opted for a late checkout for 50 euros and checked out at 7 in the evening. it was a nice experiance and we would love to come back .

Reviews.Title: “An ideal startin-point to see Venezia.”
Reviews.Author: balzac70
Reviews.Content: I sated at this hotel from 8 till 10 January, 2010. The place is just a few minutes from the coach station on 50 seconds from the train station. The room we were given was nice, clean, tastefully decorated and - as requested- overlooking the Gran Canal. The staff were very kind and extremely helpful. Breakfast was plentiful: continental, English, and German style. As a gay couple we didn't experience any problems at all. I truly recommend this hotel. The only minor problem was that with the room being on the 1st floor, we could hear some of the noise from the street/canal. Nothing earplugs can't correct.

Reviews.Title: “Best hotel to stay in Venice!”
Reviews.Author: Loved-Venice12
Reviews.Content: We do not like staying in average hotels. This hotel seemed nice but in reality was much much better than what is appeared to be on internet while booking. Great location - could not be better. On the grand canal & right oppsite the Santa Lucia station. You have Gondolas right outside the hotel to start your ride. Food at this hotel - very good. Breakfast - great variety. Room - we loved it. They even put a toy in the cot arranged or our baby. What else? Service - Very friendly staff - on their toes with a big smile all the time. And this lovely hotel is very resonably priced too. We had a great experience and if we go back to Venice, we would definitely stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “FIrst class, elegant, beautifully positioned hotel”
Reviews.Author: whydoyouhatemeso
Reviews.Content: The position of the hotel was excellent overlooking the Grand Canal. The decor was of a high standard in keeping with the area. It had a great atmosphere that was both gentile and peaceful. The standard of cleanliness was excellent and the hotel staff were very helpful. The buffet breakfast catered for eveyones tastes and we ate in the hotel restaurant most of the time as the meals were excellent and they were willing to accomodate our choices.

Reviews.Title: “Execellent”
Reviews.Author: napstersg
Reviews.Content: I was in Venice for 4 nights, had gone there to propose to my GF and we stayed in Carlton on the Grand Canal. The hotel was good, clean and gave a fantastic view of the grand canal. The staff was courteous and polite, especially the staff at the restaurant that served the breakfast. The only disappointment was for a 4 star hotel, they didnâ€™t have room service and no business center which was a let down and the breakfast spread didnâ€™t change for all the days that made it a bit monotonous. Apart from that if you are looking a pleasant stay with close proximity to the train station and other amenities, I would recommend this hotel, for its shortcoming I would still give it thumbs up for its room dÃ©cor and cleanliness and friendly staff. chris

Reviews.Title: “Great location.”
Reviews.Author: vacationsrforus
Reviews.Content: This hotel on the Grand Canal has the best location, we were within walking distance to the best sites, St Marks square, the bridge of sighs and Rialto bridge. The service was great. The rooms are comfortable, rather small but the terrific canal view makes up for it. The dinner menu is quite limited but there are plenty of eateries close by.

Reviews.Title: “Pleasant hotel in a great location”
Reviews.Author: larkenRidgefield_CT
Reviews.Content: We spent several nights in this hotel as we traveled in Italy. This is an older hotel but well cared for and very clean. The staff was friendly and helpful except for one instance; our room safe didn't work and they promised to fix it the next morning and didn't. Other than that, they were very helpful and nice. The rooms were small but nicely decorated, each with a murano glass chandelier. Breakfast was basic european and offered a variety of selections. The hotel was almost directly across the bridge from the train station, an ATM machine and the ferrovia ( ferry) terminal which was a great benefit....The hotel was also a very short walk from where the busses drop you off so we were able to walk to the hotel with our luggage. The passanger ship terminal for the cruise lines is also near the area. The hotel has a restraunt and bar and a friend who ate there said it was very good. A short walk across the bridge there are many excellent restraunts and shops and if you are in the mind for walking, you can get to the Rialto Bridge in about 30-40 minutes depending on your pace.

Reviews.Title: “Where dreams come true!!!! Fantastic!!!!”
Reviews.Author: kat_monty
Reviews.Content: Hotel was top class. Had a Deluxe Double room. Could be picky and say was a bit small but how long do you actually spend in your room on holidays?!?!! not too often!!! Room was beautifally decorated and the murna glass chandiliers were stunning! Checked in at 9pm, to our name and baggage taken to our room - fab!!! Breakfast was included in our price and was excellent....something for everyone!!! the cafe latte's wer lovely! The hotel location is excellent for exploring venice and he hotel staff provided us with a map - excellent detail...however we did get lost 5-6 times but that added to our experience! Quite expensive to eat out in venice but your on holidays so u dont mind payin!Transport around the grand canal is very expensive - 6.50euro one way newer on the avto! We flew into Treviso Airport and used the low cost shuttle transfer which was 9euro return and the hotel was only a 3 minute walk!!! Al in all and excellent holiday!!! HOwever woulf recommend Venice for children... more for a romantic break away wit ur loved one!!!

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel with one problem!”
Reviews.Author: nschucky
Reviews.Content: Look out for Andrea Tognon at the main desk. If you ask him something more than once he can get quit testy. Just beware of him and ask to speak to someone else. Otherwise, our experience at the hotel was a good one. The rest of the staff was extremely hospitable and very friendly. The hotel was clean and our room was nicely decorated and a good size for a triple. We liked the lobby and ended one of our evenings in the hotel bar where we had drinks and snacks while listening to a very pleasant musical duo. The waitress and manager of the bar went overboard to make sure we were satisfied. The hotel's buffet breakfast was delicious and had more than enough choices. It is located at the beginning of the Grand Canal, close to the bus and train stations, easily accessible by vaporetto.

Reviews.Title: “Fine hotel, nothing spectacular”
Reviews.Author: mande846
Reviews.Content: We stayed at The Carlton for 3 nights in late October. The staff was really nice and helpful. The room was clean and comfortable (except for the pillows- ask for a couple more when you check-in!) but I was disappointed that we were put next to the elevator and our room didn't have a view. For the price, I was expecting more. This hotel is across from the train station, which is convenient, but I would have rather stayed near St. Mark's. If you don't feel like walking the 40 minutes to where the action is, it's easy to cross the river and jump on the ferry.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location - nice hotel”
Reviews.Author: emmandjay
Reviews.Content: Stayed 2 nights here last month. The hotel is very easy to reach on foot from the Piazzale Roma (where the airport bus drops off) and it's not far to the vaporetto stops where you can get the tour down the Grand Canal on the no 1 service. The reception area is spacious and the staff were efficient and courteous throughout our stay. There is a separate breakfast area, a lounge and a bar/cafe leading to the restaurant. Our deluxe room overlooked the enclosed patio area where there are tables and chairs for guest's use. We asked for a quiet room and there was certainly no noise problem during our stay. The room decor is a little on the chintzy side but everything was clean. There is air conditioning, but because it was October it was not operating. As the weather was warm and sunny when we stayed, it meant that the room was rather hot, but the windows can be opened wide for ventilation, and there was also an opening window in the bathroom. The breakfast buffet was quite comprehensive, with breads, pastries, cereals, meats and cheeses as well as hot eggs and bacon. We ate in the restaurant one evening and had the set 5 course menu, which at 38 euros was quite good value, but because the hotel was not full at this time of year the restaurant was fairly empty and quiet. All in all, we were very pleased with our stay and would definitely recommend this hotel to other visitors.

Reviews.Title: “Lovelly Hotel, excellent location!”
Reviews.Author: iarak
Reviews.Content: We stayed 4 days in this hotel.Located in the Grand Canal ,in front of the Ferrovia (train station), within walking distance of Piazzale Roma, before a cruise. There are nice restaurants and shops very near. Hospitality was friendly and helped us with suggestions

Reviews.Title: “Clean, good service, good location”
Reviews.Author: hereandthere25
Reviews.Content: We enjoyed our stay here. Being near the train station was a plus for us, as we just had to cross over one bridge (mind you a bridge with many stairs and no ramp). We didn't mind not being near the center of the action in San Marco Square - it was fun navigating through the narrow streets and bridges to get there. Our view over the canal was great although it can get a little noisy sometimes, but I think that would be the case at any hotel on the Grand Canal. We did have dinner there one evening after having a glass of vino outside and were pleasantly surprised with the quality and value of the meal. Our room was very clean and the staff was most helpful. All in all, a very pleasant stay.

Reviews.Title: “NO PARKING unlike what the website tells you...”
Reviews.Author: ddingermany
Reviews.Content: We chose this hotel b/c the website specifically says parking. After 30 minutes of driving in circles and 2 phone calls to the hotel we found it did not. The location is GREAT for sure, right on the grand canal across from the train station. Other than location, I'd say it is average at best. Our "triple" room was a double with a cot brought in, to make it quite small.

Reviews.Title: “Went based on other reviews - and agree”
Reviews.Author: DaveLDN
Reviews.Content: Hi all, First review for me, so hopefully it will be up to standard. Went to Venice for 2 nights as part of a package with last minute. Was about Â£400 each with BA flights. I was happy with the hotel - Room was clean. Always had clean towels and bed made when we returned from a day out. Breakfast was pretty standard - I'm not snobby, just your average person and it was completely fine for me. Cereals, Continental, orange juice, etc etc. I was really happy with the location of the hotel: It's quite far from San Marco, but very close to the bus / taxi rank for getting back to the airport. Personally I enjoyed the fact we were away from the centre, as both days we found ourselves exploring the streets and alleys like a maze, eventually finding our way to the main tourist areas we wanted to visit, then we'd just get our way back to the hotel on the public transport along the Grand Canal. I think if we'd been situated right in the centre we'd have been overwhelmed by the number of tourists and we'd have had no real place to head for when we strolled about (as we'd already have been there!). We were told Lido was a good place for 'nightlife', but for us nightlife was non existant. We're from London, so we're used to a very vibrant clubby scene. We knew we wouldn't get that, but if you fancied a drink and a dance you'd be hard pushed to find a place. My advice would be not to go there thinking that could be a possible evening's entertainment. Think more meals and a drink, and just chilling out and strolling around, and you won't be dissappointed!

Reviews.Title: “stay where the local live in venice”
Reviews.Author: thommoAustralia
Reviews.Content: there are 2 - Hotel Carlton Capri and the main hotel Grand Canal which if you could afford it looks beautiful,maybe next time without the kids-but dont be put off by the walk down the small side alley way to Hotel Carlton it is in a much quieter part where the locals live and a fantastic bakery/ cafe around the corner, the rooms are clean ,beds comfy, bathroom roomy, breakfast is busy but there is plenty with a good selection,with hot milk for a cafe latte, staff are well trained and go about there jobs in a polite manner.You walk every where in Venice so position is ideal if you need somewhere close to the train station, just be aware of carrying bags over the Ponte Degli Scalzi (opposite) there are a lot of steps if your bags are heavy-trust me!!!

Reviews.Title: “Reasonable hotel in good location”
Reviews.Author: Guinevere50
Reviews.Content: This hotel is well positioned for all the sights and has wonderful air conditioning which was almost essential! The staff are friendly and helpful and the reception and bar areas are welcoming. The breakfast offered a wide choice of fresh and cooked foods but it wasn't the best we've had. Our only critiscism would be the room itself (which we were told was an upgrade!) which opened onto the inner courtyard but didn't have a window. It was rather claustrophobic. Avoid room 504! Not sure where the restaurant was but to be fair, we didn't look for it - there is a huge choice of restaurants all within walking distance with something for every taste and budget. If you can afford the private water taxi from the airport, it is well worth taking this as the water bus stops at Guglie which is a fair walk away especially lugging your suitcases over two steep bridges in the stifling heat!

Reviews.Title: “We were on our 30th wedding anniversary...”
Reviews.Author: GladIStayedThere
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for three nights before going on a bike trip to the Veneto. It was clean, basic, a great place to come back to for a 6-7 predinner nap each night. The concierges very graciously obliged us with calling various restaurants that we wanted to reserve for dinner (without speaking Italian!). The smell of freshly baked warm croissants woke us up each morming...plus there were other good things for breakfast. The very heavily wooded window shades protected us from the very close canal noise, but to our glee, we could fling upon the shades each morning and almost touch walkers going up and down the very close bridge steps with their clump-clumping rolling suitcases--a charming noise, after all. One morning we saw a bride getting into a vaparetto to be whisked off to her ceremony; very charming. We loved this little hotel!

Reviews.Title: “Definitely will return”
Reviews.Author: Perfectconsultant
Reviews.Content: This Hotel is situated right on the side of the Grand Canal. It is clean, elegant and with some of the best staff you will find anywhere. Philippo in the bar/restaurant was helpful, obliging and very entertaining. Ask him to demonstrate helping red wine to breathe! The dinner dance on Friday is billed as a "must" and we agree. The bedroom was a double - we had asked for a quiet room but this was silent except for the slight murmour of the very effective air conditioning! The balcony did not have a great view but rooms overlooking the canal would have to be more noisy and so we could not object. The breakfast is fantatstic, catering for the most fussy of guests and the service friendly and efficient. We stayed for only two nights but have just booked for a week later in the year.

Reviews.Title: “WOW! This is a MUST STAY Hotel!!”
Reviews.Author: Jocelyne
Reviews.Content: We have just returned from a two-week trip to Italy. For the first few days, we stayed at the Hotel Carlton and Grand Canal... What a perfect, perfect stay! Actually the hotel AND staff deserve the BEST recommendations ever! The people in Venice are extremely helpful, considerate and genuinely nice!! The front desk staff were so very accommodating as were the serving personnel... The maÃ®tre d. couldn't do enough for us. We had a very private, courtyard suite which was beyond compare. We thoroughly enjoyed our breakfasts which were incomparable. After staying at another resort in Italy (on the Amalfi coast), we realized how superior the Hotel Carlton and Grand Canal was: the private, quiet accommodations, the fully bilingual staff (English and Italian) and the clearly indicated directions/ Venice information. As opposed to their counterparts in the south, they definitively want tourists to come back. We would recommend this hotel to anyone wanting TLC when they travel. Thank you for taking the time to read this review.

Reviews.Title: “Very nice hotel in a good location”
Reviews.Author: TakingATrip
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for 2 nights during a Globus tour of Italy. The staff was very nice. The breakfast was very good. The hotel is small but very clean and pretty. It has a great location. I would recommend it and I would stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Hotel Lovely, city amazing!!!”
Reviews.Author: Jemr_blueeyes
Reviews.Content: We were on a late flight to Venice, and so arrived around 11pm. At the airport you have the choice of Taxi, Water Taxi and Water bus! I think if you arrive this late a normal taxi is suffice!! A Water Taxi costs â‚¬95!! very expensive i think especially when you have 1st arrived and dont forget you will be on a lot of boats in your stay anyway!! In a taxi you get dropped at the bus station. You simply need to walk over the huge bridge in front of you and walk along the canal for less than 10 mins. At this point the Hotel is on the other side of the canal (so on your right) you then cross another bridge and your at the hotel in seconds! NOTE: lots of baggae will make the crossing of the bridges tiresome, so if you have a lot of baggage maybe a Water taxi would be best for you as it takes you right to the hotel door!!! HOTEL; Entrance Foyer, bar and breakfast room LOVELY! looks newly done, fancy looking and modern. The room we stayed in 254 was a very good sized room! Large!! and this is a normal double i believe. But a little dated in the decor, to my personal taste, but VERY clean and bathroom a good size, white suite and again clean!! which is very important. The rooms are very different to the entrance and you do expect a fancy modern room, but dont be too put off, you are hardly in the room! The staff were absolutely lovely!!! They helped with the map and told you where to go, booked Restaurant's and taxi's for you, and were all so smiley!!! except one staff member at breakfast one day but apart from that Great! A guy called Andrea...and lady called Claudia...very helpful and so were the bar staff!! LOCATION: not directly in the actual centre, but when arriving this is perfect, otherwise you would prob not be able to find it!! Only about 15-20 mins walk into St Marks Square, but longer obv if your taking your time,LOTS of shops and lots of little lanes, the signs were great! its a great experience walking everywhere! We walked for hours and hours, and it was lovely! VERY hot though, the whole stay around 30degrees. was fab!! We didnt actually go into the Palace, or art galleries, but generally that is it for sight seeing, and churches. Have drinks by the Canal's are amazing!!! Had a lovely lunch by Rialto Bridge on the right hand side of it, the 1st in a row of restaurants...def go to the first!!! One thing you do need to know is that Venice is extremly expensive!!! â‚¬18 for 2 cokes in some places, but then â‚¬5 in others. Lunch (1 starter, 2 mains and 1 bottle of wine) â‚¬95 but then anothr little restaurant by our hotel on the canal was â‚¬95, for 2 startes, 2 bottles of wine and 2 mains! so that was def a better price!!! Of course went on a Gondola Ride... A must obviously! this is â‚¬100 but i think i did see someone haggling and got it for â‚¬70. The man was singing in Italian and giving us a History lesson which was great. There are lots of nice Restaurants, but i would definatley say eat on the canal at all times! there is no point in going to a restuarant in a little lane!!! The beauty of it all is the Canal's! You can get around on a water bus (â‚¬6.50) one way, or you can day passes, i would recomend walking though during the day as that is how you experience Venice, and you always turn down a new lane and discover another part of Venice!! We did get a Water Taxi back to Airport and this was a fantastic way to say good bye to Venice even if it did cost â‚¬100!!! That was perfect! Would recommend this place to Everybody!!!

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel and Great Location”
Reviews.Author: Steve48Texas
Reviews.Content: Great location with lots of shops and places to eat right on the Grand Canal. Not too busy like by the Rialto Bridge area so very desirable. Hotel very nice, smallish rooms but very clean and excellent service. Fantastic breakfast included in room fees. We took a water taxi directly from the airport and stayed for 2 nights before heading off on a cruise. Close to the port. Very friendly and would recomend this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “You get what you pay for! :)”
Reviews.Author: mrmcintosh
Reviews.Content: This hotel is in a great location - just across the canal from the train station. We picked it for that reason because it was our starting point for our trip across Italy. The hotel is clean and the room was very nice (huge bathroom). We were on the first floor, so we were facing a courtyard in the middle of the hotel. It was so fantastic! Nice hotel! Thumbs up!

Reviews.Title: “traditional”
Reviews.Author: nmahtani
Reviews.Content: this looked like one of the nicest hotels on the cana from the outside....on the inside the rooms are very traditional looking with fabric wallpaper...don't let this put you off...its comfortable and the staff are very attentive. we selected the standard room when we booked however when we got there the room was very tight and had no natural light so we upgraded to a canal view room that had a lil' balcony and it was perfect. i was able to sit on the balcony and read overlooking the hustle and bustle of the canal, it was great :)

Reviews.Title: “Good choice for all around common tourist hotel”
Reviews.Author: pathkid
Reviews.Content: Pro: great location near train station and historic jewish ghetto, clean rooms, canal front Con: breakfast ok (for europe) and bad(for usa standards), small rooms, my TV broke. Ok, This was 1st hotel on our Gate 1 Travel Italy tour. We flew into Milan. Took a train to Venice Santa Lucia station (make sure you go to this train station and not Mestre which is on the mainland next to "venice" that we come to know). When you get out of the train station, you can see the hotel right across the canal. A bridge to your left about 200 ft away is there to walk across and then make a right to another 500ft to your hotel. The hotel is along a walking path in front where they put tables/chairs and then the water. The hotel doesnt seem to sit directly on the water. Some neato hotels do in Venice, where you get on a boat and go directly to the steps of the hotel, but i digress. This hotel is good transition for the USA folks, first time in Europe. Folks speak english, the rooms are clean, has working AC, usual hotel amenities, a little fridge. They are small and basically we used them for shower/sleep...u gotta see the town yknow. This was part of the Gate 1 Affordable Italy tour. Good start. Now, it is on the far west side of Venice. There are crowds around this hotel location, but it is quiet enough. Walk 500ft away, you get to the Bus station area with lots of people, and 500ft the other way to the ghettoaway, with alot of ppl too. The crazy tourist location is St Marks Square in the middle of venice which is about a 30min stroll. Really, You could walk all the way around venice in about 4 hours I would think. We were pleased with the hotel, I feel it's worth it for about $150-200 night. (my yard stick being a regular USA Hampton Inn being worth it at $100/night)

Reviews.Title: “Great All-round Hotel”
Reviews.Author: DODK
Reviews.Content: As we were booking a trip to Venice for our last holiday together before the birth of our first child, I wanted to make sure we were getting a comfortable hotel in a convenient area as a good base for exploring the city for the first time. I tend to worry about everything, from transport to/from the hotel to the kind of area it is in, etc, etc, but I can say that this hotel ticked all the boxes and made for a great, relaxing trip. I'll try to summarise the main areas / points below: Location: Perfect for those who don't want to be slap-bang in the middle of busy, tourist-filled areas, this hotel is near the northern entrance to the Grand Canal, overlooking it. My worry was that it would be too near to the giant 'car park' at the end of the causeway linking Venice to the mainland. Also, that it was directly opposite the train station - I expected the are to be less than beautiful but was willing to compromise this for the convenience. I needn't have worried - when we arrived by bus from the airport (about 25mins), we stepped off the bus, over a bridge, round a corner and were at the hotel in about 4 minutes. I was pleasantly surprised by the hotel's entrance as it suggests a cut above the 'basic' accomodation I was expecting. With tastefully set tables outside for an evening drink (rather than the standard paper tablecloths often associated with pavement cafes) I was immediately reassured. The area is perfectly pleasant and attractive, with one of the Grand Canal's bridges a stone's throw from the hotel door. Being on the Grand Canal, you can catch a gondola or a water taxi from directly outside the hotel, or over the bridge you can catch a vaporetto. It is easy to cross the bridge and join the main tourist drag through to St Mark's (about a 35 min walk - at a leisurely pace!), or equally easy to avoid this, and turn the opposite way and immediately enter some of the quieter yet equally spectacular lanes and alleys you expect of Venice. On the way home we decided to treat ourselves to a water taxi and go out in style. I would heartily recommend this - ask at reception and they will order one. 2-3 minutes later they will carry your bags out to the boat (which moors directly outside the hotel) and whisk you off to the airport terminal. Definitely the best journey to an airport I've ever had. Rooms: As I understand it, all rooms in Venice are small by UK/European standards which is understandable due to space being at a premium. As this was our last 'big' holiday together, I opted for the 'Premium room with canal views'. Definitely worth it. Even our Premium Room was small - enough space for the bed, mini bar, dressing table, telly and cupboard and not much more. The en-suite was a shower only which was disappointing at first, but we got by fine without it. Our room, and toilet, had a window out onto the Grand Canal. There was a (very) small balcony which the 2 of us could stand out on to take in the view. In reality we only used the room for sleeping in at night, and for a break from the heat of the day around 3pm when we would come back and enjoy the air conditioning! The hotel seems to have quite a large capacity, and despite the large numbers of loud Americans we came across, we were never disturbed during our stay and it never felt uncomfortably busy. As for noise from the canal outside, yes you do hear the roar of boats' engines at about 7.30-8.00 in the morning, but we didn't find it too loud to be a disturbance. It made you aware that the canal was just outside your window and that Venice is very much reliant on it for all manner of things, but we found that part of the fascination rather than unpleasant. Cleanliness: Couldn't fault it at all for cleanliness. General appearance and rooms were spotless. Service: Again, great. All reception staff spoke English so our very limited Italian wasn't really required. Friendly welcome, with a free map and an explanation of routes to the main attractions. We were unlucky to have BA lose one of our cases on the way over, but when it arrived at the hotel the following day we found staff had taken it up to our room for us. Also, we checked out at noon on the day we left but didn't need to leave for the airport til 2pm, so the hotel kept our bags in a secure room until we returned. Breakfast was a great selection of cheese, meats, rolls, pastries, bacon & eggs, fruits, cereals, yoghurts (and even chocolate and pear cake one morning!). All self-service. Evening drinks outside the hotel are to be recommended - just make sure you are there as it gets dark, because there is a very funny man who comes out with candles and gives you a little song as he does so. I would also suggest eating at the hotel's restaurant. Venice isn't renowned for the quality of food, and we spent most of the week eating fairly basic (but tasty) food at the various Trattorias. On the last night we ate at the hotel and it was a cut above these. In fact, we found it difficult to find a better quality of restaurant on our travels around the city. Luckily the place is captivating enough, even for a couple of foodies like ourselves. Value: I would say that, even with the upgrade to a canal view room, this hotel represents very good value for money. It isn't the cheapest available, but you do tend to get what you pay for and this delivered on all counts, making for a relaxing, convenient and trouble-free trip to a lovely city.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent location & Great Service”
Reviews.Author: WomblesofWimbledon
Reviews.Content: You canâ€™t get a better location than this hotel for Venice. Some would say that the San Marco area is better, but thatâ€™s way too many people and way too touristy. Getting to this hotel is simple â€“ a 20 min ride from the airport in the 3Euro AVTO bus (catch it right outside the airport) followed by a 5 min stroll from the bus stop. We saw many others lugging their bags across the many bridges looking very stressed trying to get to their hotel. The main water bus is right outside the hotel and will get you around Venice and the surrounding areas (Murano, Burano and Lido). If you are travelling around a little then makes sure you buy a pass â€“ individual trip tickets can work out to be pricey. The hotel itself was very clean, service impeccable â€“ the staff couldnâ€™t help you enough. We had a room was at the back of the hotel and it was small, but from the floor plan â€“ all the rooms are small. We could have moved to a canal view room for 80 euro but decided to spend that outside and the numerous canal side bars instead, and just use the room to crash out. Breakfast was reasonable, coffee excellent, drinks are expensive â€“ 12 Euro for an Irish coffee, but we couldnâ€™t resist it and it was good. Make sure you take a gondola ride, but one thing a friend recommended was to take a bottle of champagne (the hotel was happy to chill it for us) on the gondola and enjoy. We were in heaven for a short time. Venice is safe, we walked around getting lost in the numerous alleys late at night, and never felt vulnerable. One thing about Venice, itâ€™s expensive, everything is expensive about twice the price of the UK, butâ€¦ itâ€™s still worth it.

Reviews.Title: “Best experience in Italy”
Reviews.Author: bangkok08
Reviews.Content: being a hotelier myself i know what some of the comments can be like on this forum so i share my thoughts candid;y. After arriving from Milan via Euorstar City the hotel is just across the brigge however the bridge is probably the steepest and with many steps and no ramp access for luggage. So we struggled with many other tourists to carry our over the bridge - be ware it is extremely difficult and there is no assistance offered. Arriving at the hotel the female staff at reception were very friendly and eficient. The male staff standing in the lobby did not help with the luggage or even open the door as we struggled to enter the hotel. Apart from this experience all our encounters with offer staff was very pleasant. It was the only place we visited in Italy where the staff smiled and said hello! The rooms are small but well equipped with all the facilities you need, mini bar, LCD TV, safe, internet etc... Enrico - the Head Waiter/Mgr in the restaurant was efficient and friendly, we had some good laughs with him. Breakfast buffet is more than adequate and has a large variety. Overall a very positive experience and would recommend this hotel for anyone

Reviews.Title: “Very Pleasant...”
Reviews.Author: HOLIDAY2002
Reviews.Content: Just back from a 3 day trip. Good location.... close to the Railway, bus stop and water bus stop. The Staff were very helpful..... A canal view is well worth it, just to watch the world go by.... Breakfast is very good. Rooms tiny but clean and after all its only somewhere to drop the cases...! Would definately recommend this hotel....!!! Enjoy your stay.

Reviews.Title: “Charming & Lovely hotel without the air con!!”
Reviews.Author: Elizag
Reviews.Content: Loved this hotel. Great location only 2 min from bus and railway station.Its Also near the waterbus stops. Very clean and luxurious. The decor is lovely and old world. The rooms were a good size and so was bathroom. The one major problem was that the air con was not working in the rooms and it was uncomfortably hot!!! It is located only 5 mins from rialto bridge (by waterbus) and 10 mins from st mark square. The breakfast was good. A good selection of cereal, ham & cheese, fruit and also hot food. would recommend it to anyone.

Reviews.Title: “Average average average”
Reviews.Author: Suggs2222
Reviews.Content: Location pretty good as very easy access to all transport links, and right on the canal. It is a fair walk to the main sights which we actually liked as you can lose yourself in all the side streets and little shops along the way. Agree with other comments about the drinks and room service in the hotel being a complete rip off, but I imagine it is a similar story in pretty much any hotel in venice.

Reviews.Title: “Good basic hotel - not the very best location”
Reviews.Author: Vonneytraveldotcom
Reviews.Content: The Carlton & Grand Hotel is a good basic tourist hotel. No room service so where they get their 4 stars is questionable!! Not even a coffee could be mustered up for an early start to catch a 7am flight. It is spotlessly clean and located right at the far end of the Grand Canal (furthest from St Marks - 40 minutes by Valperetto). However, it does provide easy access from the Airport by number 5 bus (â‚¬2.50 per head) as this is only a 5 minute walk or the train station, which is directly opposite. Next time I go to Venice I would probably stay closer to the action.

Reviews.Title: “Shabby Chic”
Reviews.Author: HappyGM
Reviews.Content: Just returned after a two night stay in this hotel with my Husband. It isn't a trendy boutique style hotel, but has old fashioned charm with flocked walls and wooden painted furntiture in an old Venitian style. We liked it more for that reason. The location couldn't be better as it was only a few minutes walk away from the train station or Water Buses (which we used all the time). Breakfast was good, and the only critisism we had was the bar drinks, you would have to be rich to get drunk. In fact that is the case throughout Venice 'but thems the breaks!'. Can't wait to go back one day with our children and show them what a fantastic place this is.

Reviews.Title: “Small but Right on the Canal”
Reviews.Author: Rinnegirl143
Reviews.Content: This hotel is in a great location. Of all the hotels I stayed at in Italy, this hotel was the most expensive (but still right around $200/night which was our limit) and the room was the smallest. I really feel like we hit the jackpot with our Italian hotels because they were all gems. We knew that Venetian hotels would be the most expensive, so we were able to go a little over budget for this hotel because we went so far under budget with the others. We paid $195.00/night for 2 nights which was the cheapest internet rate available for August. Our room was beautifully decorated with a double bed, and a bench/couch at the foot of the bed and a chair to the side with a TV. The room was snug, but we expected that. We didn't spend much time in the room either. It was quiet for sleeping and clean. (If you're looking for other hotels in Italy with larger rooms, please read my other reviews) The bathroom served it's purpose. The breakfast was included in our rate and was excellent. It was a mix of hot and cold food (eggs, ham, cold meats, canned fruit, and other breakfast breads). The best part about the hotel was the location. We were right on the canal (and no it doesn't smell bad) and two steps from a waterbus stop. I highly recommend getting the venice pass which gives you unlimited use of the waterbus system.

Reviews.Title: “Short break destination”
Reviews.Author: F22Raptor
Reviews.Content: Arrived at San Marco airport and after collecting our luggage and the transfer we were in our hotel room within an hour. Smack bang on the Grand Canal - although maybe not the most prestigious location at the beginning it was an ideal base for exploring. The hotel was well appointed with a nice, warm and welcoming atmosphere. The actual layout is very much like Venice - all corridors, passages and and stairs (there are lifts by the way). We wanted a room overlooking the canal but they were all taken - this was not necessarily unfortunate as it seemed to get quite noisy canalside from time to time - don't ever wish to see an 'ambulance' - you'll here it an hour before you see it!! So we had a room towards the back looking onto a wall about 8 mtrs away. We could still hear birds and the room did receive some daylight but you just knew that beyond the net curtain was a wall so it was maybe a little claustrophobic. The room was not as well apoointed as others we have stayed in - no ironing facilities, no tea and coffee (just the minibar!) and the lighting was a little on the ambient side of dark or dull for our liking. Still, the bed was big and comfortable and unusually I did not wake up suffering, like I often do when I'm away, with a bad back. Would we go back to this hotel - probably - but as we think we've done the Venice thing for the time being it's likely to be a good few more years yet.

Reviews.Title: “Perfection from start to finish”
Reviews.Author: randrewsuk
Reviews.Content: An excellent hotel, very well located. Staff were friendly and couldn't do more to help. I had asked for some additional services such as the "Birthday" package and they worked their magic for me. In addtion, they booked some restaurants on my behalf and arranged for some additional transportation. The room was marvellous and I do suggest paying more and getting one of the junior suites with a roof terrace which has amazing views over the Venetian rooftops - marvellous!

Reviews.Title: “Unbelievable!!!!!!!”
Reviews.Author: steviT
Reviews.Content: This Hotel is absolutely OUTSTANDING!!!! Do not believe any bad reviews about this hotel, trust me! My girlfriend and I got the bus ( 3 euro each) from the marco polo airport to the main bus station. From there its literally a 2 min light walk to the hotel. The location is breathtaking, overlooking the canal it gives you a real taste of venetian life. We checked in whilst appreciating the detailed shabby chic style decor. Our room ( a superior room with canal view) was very well presented, clean, welcoming, warm, spacious and again finished with incredible detail. A highly recommended hotel!

Reviews.Title: “Just the ticket”
Reviews.Author: casjrg
Reviews.Content: Quick city break for me and Mrs casjrg so we could see Venice, booked on the Friday, flew on the Monday home on the Thursday! No kids, no pets, no work, no worries. Flights were excellent with SwissAir dropping into Zurich for a transfer -12 degrees on the Airport Apron as we walked accross to our tranfer plane Mrs casjrg utter the immortal words "I DON'T THINK I WILL GO ON A SKIING BREAK I'M FREEZING" lol we''ll see Landed at venice temperature was a chilly 2C but fantastic clear skies and an easy transfer by express bus to the Piazza Roma which is almost at the hotel door. The hotel is lovely, right on the start of the Grand Canal and accross from the main railway station-we had been told its a bit noisy but to be honest, the main rush hour starts about 8am so no issues really and listening to the traffic up and down the river I personally didnt see an issue :) Very friendly staff who didnt laugh too much as we attempted pleasantries in a very poor Italian- as with most places I truly believe they appreciate the effort We ended up in a room at the 3rd floor with good views and i was well impressed with the bathroom and decor and standards all round. Nice stroll to a nearby trattoria and after a meal of pizza and a fantastic salad (called a Titian) washed down with a house red we were replete and strolled about for a little longer. The hotel is close to a water taxi vaporetta but quite frankly, if your fit and able the walk about venice is fine-even though the mileage increases due to the times you get lost) so i would say that the hotel IS close to the things you want to see BUT WEAR COMFORTABLE SHOES LOL The hotel breakfast was very good, eggs bacon toast cereals tea coffee yoghurts pastries and excellent friendly service, the staff were all, without exception, attentative, prompt, courteous and helpfull-full marks all round. As it was carnival time we got to see lots of entertainment in St Marks square and we also took in the other sights I was well impressed with Venice and I'm glad I went during carnival and not during the summer. I truly enjoyed this city break and although we dont usually (with the exception of the Maldives) consider a revisit, I would be hard pushed to find a compelling reason to missany bargain break on offer to this hotel

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Hotel”
Reviews.Author: Macey
Reviews.Content: We stayed 3 nights at this hotel and paid for a canal view room, worth the upgrade. However, we were originally offered room 107, beautiful room all blue decor, but the canal view was not pretty as this room had a view of a graffied hut right in front of it. The graffiti is everywhere in venice and not a problem for me, but as the room is on the first floor this hut blocks your view. We were offered room 308 (pink room) which had a fab view. it is true that the canal view rooms are noisy as the grand canal is extremely busy, but this did not spoil our stay and we loved waking up in the early hours 5am'ish to watch the boats taking the food to market amongst other boats going about there daily business. Down for a wonderful breakfast by 6.30am and out for the day by 8am. Cannot comment on the other rooms at the back of the hotel, but I believe they are quieter for those that need that. Great location, helpful and friendly staff, breakfast yummy (even the bacon) Good value for money.

Reviews.Title: “Great location but disappointing rooms”
Reviews.Author: DublinDiva1
Reviews.Content: Stayed in this hotel for a romantic trip for my boyfriend's birthday. Decided on the hotel from Trip Advisor and the good recommendations and secured the room at a special offer so it was good value. Our flight was very delayed and we arrived into Venice in the middle of the night, and although we had planned getting the cheap buses to the city we were forced to get a land taxi. It cost â‚¬20. The hotel was very easy to reach from the Piazzale Roma, by taking the stone steps down to the canal to the right of the new modern bridge and walking along side the canal over 2 bridges to get to the hotel. They were very helpful checking in considering our late arrival. The room was very disappointing. I booked a superior double room just for a bit more than basic, but even this room was to small for my comfort. The bed, as someone else stated, was two single beds pushed together which is fine, I was expecting this. But they were made up separately which was a bit strange. When I approached reception they justified it by saying I hadn't specified . . . But they sorted it out by the time we came back that day which was fine. The decor was not to my taste at all, nor was it what I was expecting based on reviews and hotel information. I considered the furnishings including the fake chandelier to be tacky and really detracted from the charm of the hotel. But the room was clean, so it was really only a personal issue. The bathroom was unacceptable. It was clean but tiny. The door was just a large piece of glass which was very odd. I could barely sit in the bath and the shower was hand held, there was no place to rest it and stand. The breakfast was a little gem. I was expecting a simple continental breakfast but they also served bacon and eggs, and "the strongest, most amazing coffee" my boyfriend had ever tasted! The location was brilliant. It was a nice walk to St. Mark's and the Rialto but it was also very easy to get the Vaparetto, the stop was directly across the canal. Other tourist areas such as the Jewish Ghetto were within walking distance whereas Dorsuduro is more ideally reached using a boat. Either way good walking shoes are necessary! The bridge just a few minutes from the hotel lead to a bustling street, ideal for tourists along the main stretch but also housing little small restaurants off the beaten track.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel, we loved it”
Reviews.Author: dlanods
Reviews.Content: We stayed in the Carlton Hotel, which definitely seemed like the lesser sibling of the Grand Canal. However it was nice and quiet, very well furnished and a very comfortable base for our stay in Venice. Directly across from the train station where we came in, we were impressed. We didn't interact at all with the staff, so can't really comment on the service, but would go back to this hotel again if we were looking for a value for money residence in Venice.

Reviews.Title: “Great views of the Grand Canal”
Reviews.Author: Cymru_Jon
Reviews.Content: I paid a little bit extra for a canal view room and have to say it made the stay, a 2nd floor room with full length opening windows gave stunning views on one of the busiest points of the Grand Canal. Relaxing in the nights with a bottle of wine and watching the boats passing by was a wonderful experience. The room itself was fine; good size and clean with period furniture. Staff were friendly and particularly helpful on reception. Breakfast was the usual continental buffet and sets you up for the day. I didnâ€™t eat there in the night so can't comment on the restaurant. Location is great for arrival in Venice; it's opposite the train station and is a 5 minute walk over one bridge. If your arriving by train or bus, itâ€™s a 10 minute walk and fairly easy to find. Boats stops are nearby so itâ€™s easy to get around Venice. We preferred to navigate through the tight alleyways of Santa Croce and itâ€™s about a 30 minute walk to San Marco via the Rialto Bridge. Overall itâ€™s an excellent hotel, particularly if you want to explore more than just San Marco.

Reviews.Title: “Great stay!!”
Reviews.Author: pebblezs
Reviews.Content: This hotel actually surprised us. We didnt expect the hotel would turn out so great. After waiting at the airport for our luggages for 3 hrs, walking over two bridges with steps and our luggages, we finally checked in. We took the bus from the airport; it was only $2.50 euros and was dropped off at the main bus depot. Although we had to drag our luggages through two bridges, the walk wasnt too far. We stayed at Hotel Carlton for three days. The check in staff was very friendly and provided maps to us. The breakfast was awesome. My friends and I didnt know continental breakfast would consist of bread, eggs, ham, salami, cheese, bacon, juice, cereal and croissant. My friends and I was assigned 4 rooms in the back of the hotel with a private garden/patio area which was pretty good. There was alot of tourist checking in for a night or two. The rooms in the back are more quiet. The only back draw was we could not find a supermarket nearby. There's not much they offer to watch on TV, the only english speaking channel was CNN. Across the river is the railroad station, small grocery stores, gelato stores and restaurants. There are banks next door and nearby. If you want to exchange your money, try exchanging at the banks near the Rialto Bridge. The rates are better. DO NOT EXCHANGE MONEY AT THE AIRPORT, THE RATES SUCKS. My friends and I was able to find our way to all the highlight attractions without any problems. The rooms were warm and bathroom clean and modern. I stayed in room 511. Just keep in mind there's alot of walking around Venice. My friends and I didnt bother spending money on the water taxi or public water transportation. We basically walked everywhere and it got extremely cold on our last stay. The mornings and evenings are cold and the afternoons are fairly warm.

Reviews.Title: “Charming Hotel, Centrally Located”
Reviews.Author: jessieboo
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the Carlton prior to a cruise that left from Venice. From what I've learned, the Carlton is very popular with tour groups and travel agencies. The Carlton is located on the Grand Canal on the opposite side of San Marco's square. Due to the absence of cars we were dropped off at the train station parking lot where our luggage was taken from us (and brought to the hotel via boat). Our escort walked us to the hotel which is located right on the canal. The walk was my first glimpse of Venice and was just enough to entice me. Check in was easy and courteous. The staff was friendly and provided us with a map and some general information about the points of interest. Our rooms were not immediately available (it was early) so we chose to walk around. The hotel is about a 15+ minute walk from San Marco's square which may not please everyone. My family thoroughly enjoys walking so the trek through the winding streets was very pleasant. San Marco's square is packed with people so we were happy to be a bit removed from it. Later in the day our rooms were ready and were in my opinion very charming. The bathrooms were modern but the rooms themselves maintained period charm. Furniture was antique style and each room was distinct. Our room had a window facing the back of the hotel and at night was quieter than I expected. The beds were a tad bit hard but having been up for 24+ hours this wasn't much of an issue. The hotel is also located within close proximity to a water taxi stop. This is beneficial if you do not want to walk. We took the water taxi just once and enjoyed the different perspective of the city that it gave us. The hotel provides a breakfast. Breakfast was similar to most European hotel breakfasts. It consisted of a variety of cereals, pastries, yogurt, eggs, fruit and ham. There may have been more but I can't recall. The breakfast was acceptable. Overall our experience with the Carlton was very positive and I wouldn't hesitate to recommend it.

Reviews.Title: “Nice and Easy”
Reviews.Author: BAIC03
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed at this hotel for our one-night stay before we caught our cruise ship the next day. We wanted something close to the port so we wouldn't have to drag our bags all over Venice. 2 small bridges and viola! You are there. About a 30-45 min walk to St Marks (allow time for getting lost, it will happen!) The desk clerk was very nice; she helped me with my broken Italian before she switched to English... (I find they are always nicer when you speak even the smallest amount of thier language). We had a large bed in a small room- but I was pleased... usually you get a very tiny bed in Europe. We had a big bathroom with nice hot water and great pressure-- even had a towel warmer. The bathroom door was a thick piece of glass-- so not for the modest! We were upgraded to a Canal View room, which is very nice, but yes, it is noisy. Bring your ear plugs just in case because we discovered the hotel is across the canal from the train station, so you hear the water taxis working all night. BUT- we were so jet lagged, we didn't notice! There are shutters on each window so you can keep the noise out more if you like. Breakfast was much more than continental with very strong coffee that I wish I had at home! There were ham and eggs, cereal bagels, kippers and other things beyond what we have in the US. Great. Also, we found a great little pizza joint about 50 yds to the left of the hotel. He hand-made the pizza in about 10 min and it cost us 10 Euro. It served it's purpose very well.

Reviews.Title: “OLD WORLD CHARM & good location”
Reviews.Author: MRS.TRAVELS.OFTEN
Reviews.Content: We stayed here on our 2 week trip to Europe on October 08 - 10. They have no air conditioning after October 01. which upset me because i have really thick hair - so i first room i got was very nice, it was off this little court yard on the main floor the room # was 504 , it had no windows it was flipping hot!!!!!! second room was definatly a down grade with one very small window--that was un acceptable!!!!! finally the third room our final room...ROOM # 123 WAS BETTER . it had two big windows no view ,but at this point i was tired and hungry. so we took it. OUR BED ..was two twin beds made separetly and pushed together, which was weird, not sleeping "together" THE BATHROOM...old ,but clean ,with a tub which i hadn't had at the last two hotels, it had the worst hairdryer EVER..., the water pressure was good. BREAKFEST...was accually ok, better than the last two places. it had eggs ,bacon, toast etc. MINI BAR ..in the hotel way too expensive, there is this little booth when you walk out of the hotel to the right that sells everything for half the price or cheaper,just get it there and put it in your fridge. OVER ALL : NICE HOTEL ,GREAT LOCATION and they give you a good map. it is right across the little river from the train station it right around the corner from the bus and taxi station AIRPORT;...to get to the airport you have 3 options 1.) take a water bus {boat} at approx 30 to 50 euros, and they drop you off at the waters edge , and you have to get to the terminal from there ,..you can then walk all that way or take a shuttle which is extra so that is more money not to mention all the tipping NOTE> dont hand your luggage to any one waiting on the island or shore they will follow you around untill they feel you have given them an appropriate tip. 2.) taxi ... that will cost 50 to 60 euro's 3.) shuttle bus that comes every 20 minutes and costs $ 2.50 euro's each. Venice is a small beautiful Island, there are a lot of things to see and do. DO have a hot chocolate ,its thick and rich wow DO find and have a banana gelato BUY some beautiful murano glass . NEVER eat at the same place twice see PIAZZA SAN MARCO, RIALTO BRIDGE GONDALA RIDES...$ 80.00 BEFORE 6:00PM AND $ 100.00 AFTER .

Reviews.Title: “If you just need a place to sleep and wash...stay here.”
Reviews.Author: LolaJade
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the Carlton for 2 nights with a tour group, so the rooms were pre-booked. The room felt cold and damp, windows could not lock and there was a slow drain in my tiny tiny shower stall. I didn't feel that it was particularly clean...to my taste anyway. It wouldn't have been my first choice for a hotel but hotels in Venice are very expensive. Venice is a beautiful, wonderful city so that made up for ANY discomfort I felt about the Carlton.

Reviews.Title: “Nice!”
Reviews.Author: tinabee80s
Reviews.Content: We stayed here as part of our Globus Tour for two nights and found Grand Canal to be nice, although nothing spectular. The rooms are okay, a little small though and are suited quite close to each other so you hear everything from the walls. You even hear if your neighbour has their TV on or takes a shower. The rooms are also a little old, although you expect that from an old city like Venice. The buffet breakfast isn't great and don't also expect too much from Reception staff and they are rude and unfriendly. This hotel is located about 40min walk to the city centre (St Marks Square), or you can take a water taxi for 6.50EURO per person which also takes 40mins. We choose to walk and its the best way to see the city.

Reviews.Title: “Don't stay here - not worth the money”
Reviews.Author: EmerA23
Reviews.Content: Very disappointing stay at this hotel. We had booked a short trip to Venice and as a treat we had decided to stay at the Carlton Hotel. Disappointing from the word go. The reception staff were far from friendly and our room was not ready when we arrived, we were told to call back in an hour. The reception & lobby are beautifully decorated but I'm afraid it stops here. The rooms are extremely old fashioned and badly need redecorating as they have become shabby, the bathroom was awful. The corridors to the rooms are also very dull and not at all in keeping with a 4 star hotel. Would never stay here again, found the staff quite rude and far from friendly. If you are looking for a lovely hotel to stay in for a trip to Venice I would highly recommend Hotel Antiche, only a few doors down from The Carlton, gorgeous rooms and extremely helpful and friendly staff.

Reviews.Title: “4 star ?”
Reviews.Author: spanysim
Reviews.Content: Arrived at the airport to the find water taxis were on strike but in 30 minutes we were sorted out. Hotel has great location on Grand Canal so easy to reach by boat and only 5 mins walk from the Ferrovia railway station. Most rooms have no view and ours had two single beds "joined together". Breakfast has been value engineered with what tasted like fruit squash masquerading as orange juice. Bar is a bit overpriced compared to the rest of town. Overall the staff were very helpful and the location opposite the river buses was convenient. Would probably not stay there again unless we had a canal view

Reviews.Title: “Perfect hotel warm and friendly”
Reviews.Author: johnwEngland
Reviews.Content: We stayed at this hotel for our 35th wedding anniversary. The special meal on the first night was outstanding and sitting outside watching the world go by added to the pleasure. The staff could not do enough to make our stay perfect . From breakfast to the evening meal and bar service we could not fault anything. After 35 years we have traveled the world and stayed in 5 star hotels but this hotel is the best and we would go back. One word of warning and it made me very angry the number of bars that charge when you sit down for a drink. It was back street bars as well as St Marks Square and I felt like they treated tourists as mugs. We used the vapouretta on the first day and then on foot the next day. Walking was fine first thing in the morning and after 4pm but during the middle of the day too many people !!

Reviews.Title: “Delightful Hotel”
Reviews.Author: julieparr
Reviews.Content: Just got back fom this delightful hotel. The outside of the building looks fabulous, very pretty, ideally situated just 2 mins from train station/bus station and Vaparetto/water bus. Can get gondola right outside at own landing stage. It is a way away from St Marks but situated ina lovely area and is nice to wander throught the streets exploring on way to St Marks. The hotel itself was delightful, staff very courteous and helpful, accompnied us to our room with a balcony overlooking the Grand Canal, was average size room, very well decorated and maintained. Decorated typically Venitian with Chandalier! Good sized bathroom with bath/shower bidet, hairdryer etc. Breakfasts were Lovely, lots different cereals,lots FRESH FRUIT, yoghurt, ham, cheese , croissants, plus cooked breakfast scrambled egg, bacon toast preserves fresh juices etc their Fresh Coffee was gorgeous. Staff extremley attentive and in abundance, service was excellent. All in all a fabulous trip and I would definetly go back to this hotel

Reviews.Title: “Perfect.....”
Reviews.Author: Broch5
Reviews.Content: We came back from Carlton Grand Canal 2 days ago. We went there for our 4 day honeymoon. (without our children!!!) We arrived at night by speed boat and it looked fantastic lit up against the night sky........ when we walked in the first impression was fantastic. The hotel reception is beautiful. The staff were friendly and spoke English very well (which is a bonus for me as I speak NO Italian!!) Our room was a little on the small side - but had EVERYTHING you need for a holiday. We had a balcony over looking the Grand Canal (which we had requested) The bedroom and bathroom decor were a little old and quite gawdy....... BUT it was very clean. TV was new and had channels in many languages. There was also high speed internet access - for a small price. The location is brilliant!! The train station is opposite, water bus stops opposite, road bus stops 5 mins walk away....perfect!!!
