All in all it was a great experience........ although when we go back to Venice we would like to experience another hotel we would definately not be dissapointed if we had to stay at the Carlton Grand Canal again!!!

Reviews.Title: “Great Location”
Reviews.Author: aquamist
Reviews.Content: Venice was our last stop of our Italy tour. We traveled with our toddler and it was a very convenient location. It's located across from the train station and a 5-minute walk to the bus station. The hotel is very beautiful and elegant. The hotel room itself is very beautiful but I find it small. They did provide us with a crib, which was very nice. The strange thing is that they never give us enough towels. Breakfast was amazing in the elegant breakfast room. The front desk is courteous but seem to be too busy all the time. I didn't get a chance to talk to them much. The place is great if you are a couple. There are not many kids if any around.

Reviews.Title: “Rude Staff/Terrible Rooms”
Reviews.Author: ivettefl
Reviews.Content: Stayed in this hotel prior to taking a cruise. Found staff to be rude and unhelpful. Rooms small, old and showers never remodeled. Beds hard in no way represents a 4 star hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Great location”
Reviews.Author: GnSLondon
Reviews.Content: We decided to go to Venice at short notice , so didn't have enough time to hunt around for hotels. Following a quick search through the common travel web sites which seemed to recommend Hotel Carlton and Grand Canal we decided to book it. When we actually got to Venice, getting to the hotel couldn't have been easier. From the airport we caught the No 5 bus to central Venice and when we arrived at piazzle Roma bus terminal, it was a 5 minutes walk. The number of tourists carrying luggage and struggling across all the bridges in Venice to reach their hotels , made me realise how lucky we were to get a hotel so conveniently located to the bus terminal. Every one is right in saying that the hotel is a bit further away from St Marks square. But the vaporetto ( water bus) station is just opposite the hotel and the walk ( which is about 20-25 min) to the square is very interesting with alot of shops, cafe's and restaurants. Souvenir shop items tend to get a bit cheaper away from St Marks square towards the hotel too. The hotel it self was very good. Helpful staff, rooms were certainly larger than we expected and toilet was so spacious and clean ( which was so great!) . The breakfast buffet was also good with alot of healthy choices. The 48 or 72 hour ticket works out alot cheaper than paying individual fares and if possible try to get this at the airport it self. We managed to do a gondola ride for 70 euros. Having inquired in many places the standard price seemed to be around 80euros before 7pm and 100 euros thereafter. We went around half six in the evening and it was really nice. Please do hire cycles for as cheap as 3 euros and do a tour around Lido, it's well worth it. Overall for a holiday booked with minimal planning we had a great time and you definitely must visit Venice because it's so beautiful and unique. We couldn't have booked a better hotel even if we had time to do better research!

Reviews.Title: “location, location, location...”
Reviews.Author: thislinda
Reviews.Content: This hotel was just what I was looking for in terms of location. It is less than a five minute walk from the bus station and two minutes from the train station. The waterbus and taxi stop are a two minute walk and there are plenty of places to shop and eat nearby. You can walk to the Rialto and San Marco Square easily -if you follow the signs on the street corners (allow 20-35 mins). It is on the banks of the Grand Canal and there are plenty of places to eat and shop nearby. In terms of the hotel: this is Venice -everything is expensive! The hotel frontage and foyer are pleasant. We had a 'superior' double room -which frankly, was ordinary, and had literally no outlook at all -6 feet to the next building. The furnishings are a little jaded and the usual luxury touches lacking. However, the breakfast was ok, it was very quiet at night, the other guests were well behaved, and the staff polite. So, it depends what you are looking for -we needed somewhere with easy access for an early departure time and this seemed to be the best in the area. If you don't care about that, then you might get more 'luxury' for your money elsewhere.

Reviews.Title: “Ignore The Bad Comments!”
Reviews.Author: Eubank0
Reviews.Content: We stayed for three nights in the hotel Carlton & Grande Canal in Venice. What a lovely hotel. Dairo the barman/waiter is a lovely chap, very friendly and nothing too much trouble for him he is a credit to the hotel. We landed in Marco Polo airport. We went to the Hellovenezia kiosk to collect Blue Venice Cards which i had pre ordered on line. The was easy, and was handed a little wallet with map, and info book. We went outside to the number five bus stop. We got on the bus and put our blue cards into the machine on the bus. This began the countdown....you can pay to go to Venice on this bus it cost 3 euros but with your venicards it is included. The bus took us to the piazzle Roma bus terminal. We turned left out of the station, over two little bridges and then we were at the hotel, not even five minutes walk. Check in was easy and we had a lovely room number 362. The room was lovely and clean, and the bathroom lovely and clean also. We had a wonderful stay here and would recommend it to anyone!..We enjoyed a lovely meal in the hotel restuarant, and they produced a birthday cake for me for my partner as i had advised them of this. It was just so nice. We went to all the tourist sites and our blue venice cards took us to Lido and Murano. It includes Burano, but i wasnt really interested in going there. It is such a great time hoping on and off of water buses. The station for which is situated dead opposite the hotel just over the bridge and to the left. Number 1 bus will take you all the way to St Marks Square the tourist route or you can get a Number 2 which is a direct boat...either way it is far better than our buses and trains haha.... probably something to do with the scenery. We had a great time, so take yourselves there and ignore all the silly comments people have made on here about this hotel. It is a very welcoming, clean friendly hotel and we will definately be going back.

Reviews.Title: “Lovely hotel”
Reviews.Author: EuropeDreamer
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Carlton Grand Canal as part of a tour, and enjoyed our time there very much. As other reviews have said, it is a bit far from St. Mark's Square. At night, it is VERY easy to get lost (believe me, I know); so I would seriously recommend using the vaporetto. The souvenir stall just outside of the hotel is very reasonable for t-shirts (as compared to The Square). The hotel has tables outside on the Canal, and it is very nice to have a refreshment and sit there at night, too. If you have the time and opportunity to see Burano Island, it is very worth doing. It is so nice to stroll around this very colorful fishing village and see how the women make the famous Venetian lace.

Reviews.Title: “Venice Close By”
Reviews.Author: GatorVictoria_BC
Reviews.Content: Although the hotel is on the outside of the central Venice, we found it to be handy to everything. Everything is walkable and within 30 minutes but it is nice to have the water bus ticket for 2, 3 days especially when you have been walking all day and your feet are tired. Plus if coming later in the evening from the San marco you didn't have to walk through some of the dark streets to get back to the hotel. The hotel is 15 minutes walk over two bridges (with suitcases) from the bus terminal where we caught the airport transport for only 3 Euro per person ~ yes only three Euro. Way cheaper than the 80 to 100 Euro the water taxi's were quoting. The bus was at the airport within 20 minutes which was great when we left at 5 AM. and since most of the check-in wickets don't open until 5:30 anyway. I thought the hotel location for arrival & departures were a bonus that compensated for being a bit away from San Marco square. Also close by the bus terminal on the water side is a supermarket called the Coop so we were able to get our own water, beer and other things to keep in the hotel bar fridge. Our comfortable room was large and bathroom clean. Fresh fluffy towels every day. One thing we found was how thin the walls were and how inconsiderate some people are. We were on an inside room away from the Canal which was quiet until the rude guests went screaming by. For those of you who are leaving very early in the morning please be quiet. There is no need to yell down the halls or slam doors. I found the front desk staff to be stand-offish. They gave you the bare minimum to your queries and always seemed put out when you were asking for directions or information. The breakfast was wonderful ~ so many items and lots of healthy choices. This proved to be a blessing as restaurant dining in Venice was very expensive and the food was nothing to write home about. This was the most disappointing aspect of Venice for us.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic Trip”
Reviews.Author: ljlangers
Reviews.Content: Before i booked my hotel in Venice i did the usual checks on line and also looked on Trip Adviser for other people's opinion's and i thought there were mixed views on this hotel but on the whole there were very positive remarks..All i can say is how wonderful i thought my trip to Venice was and the hotel was fantastic i have no complaints, on arrival the check in staff were very polite and very welcoming and the hotel lobby was very much like the pictures on the net and it was spotless, we arrived early therefore we were able to leave our case in a room as our room wasn't ready until 2.00pm which didn't bother us as we started exploring Venice..When we did finally go back to the hotel to check in we got to our room and yes they are smallish, however the bed and wardrobe and bathroom was plenty big enough and the rooms & bathroom was very clean and the towels and bed sheets were changed daily, and to be honest our room was a base we didn't spend an awfal lot of time in our room. All rooms have an electric safe which we found very useful, The rooms also have air conditioning which was fantastic considering it was very hot and sunny, i noticed a couple of reviews from people said how hot they found there rooms but i have no complaints there.. The bathrooms are also fitted with a hair dryer, i would say next time i would probably take my own simply because i have long hair it took a long time but apart from that it was a fantastic trip! I would also recommend getting a 3 day water buss ticket they cost â‚¬31 each and it means you can travel on all the water buses any time of day all day and they are so easy to use and you can purchase these from the ticket desk at the airport which is very easy to find. The location of the hotel was fantastic, it's right on the canal and is at the start of the canal so it's very easy to cross over the bridge and catch the water bus.. We did a gondola ride while we were there and it cost â‚¬70 which i thought was quite reasonable, some of them were offering a ride for â‚¬60 and the private water taxis cost â‚¬95 we did this to and from the hotel and i thought it was worth the money because they take you right outside your hotel and pick you up. All in all i have no complaints and loved the city and will definatly be going back to Venice and i would 100% go back to the Carlton & Grand Canal hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful hotel”
Reviews.Author: htmp
Reviews.Content: Definitely a nice hotel. Not sure that it is worth the canal view room....This made the stay VERY noisy. There is a walk way below the window (we were fortunate to have a balcony room overlooking the canal). All day and night you could hear the people pulling their suitcases on the walk below. Their talking carried into the rooms. I did love looking out at the canal though. Room was very nice, quite large. The bathroom however smelled VERY musty and we had to keep that door closed and stuff a towel under the bottom of it. Breakfast was very good. (eggs, sausage) Although this was a larger hotel, it never felt crowded. Lots of tourists groups stayed there.

Reviews.Title: “Superb Location”
Reviews.Author: emyaj1964
Reviews.Content: Located close to the bus station , train station and one of the main vaperetto stops , the hotel is perfecly located to be able to explore all of the sights that Venice has to offer. The staff were friendly and helpful and the hotel was very clean. Our room did not have a canal view - and was small to say the least - but as we spent so little time actually in the hotel this didnt matter at all. Breakfast buffet was OK - with a mixture of cakes / croissant / bacon and eggs - along with some fruit and heavily waterted down fruit juices. The main attraction of the hotel is its prime location on the Grand Canal and the fact that it gave us a great base to explore Venice from. I would highly recommend buying a vaperetto pass (30 euros) for 3 days - as this lets you get on any water bus to explore Venice ans the outlying islands. This can be bought from the airport and enables tyou to transfer to Pizalle Roma ( bus station) which is a 5 minute walk from the hotel. Once youve seen all the sights and got blisters on your feet - I would also recommend a trip on the vaperetto out to " The Lido" - which is a simply fantastic sandy beach on the Adriatic - which we wish we could have found a little sooner in our 4 day break as it was a perfect spot to relax and unwind.

Reviews.Title: “Good Venice Hotel”
Reviews.Author: gemsrp
Reviews.Content: Stayed at the Hotel Carlton and Grand Canal 7th to 10th April. I took my mum for her 60th Birthday but it was our second trip to Venice. We booked through Ryan Air and flew with them from Liverpool to Treviso so got a discount on the normal hotel rate. If you want a Grand Canal View you have to book a deluxe room and request the view. We did and it was worth it, you do feel part of Venice when you overlook the canal. (If it is your first time in Venice I advise you fly to Marco Polo and arrive by water, it's the best way to arrive for your first visit in this amazing city), getting the coach from Treviso to Piazza Roma just isn't the same but we didnt mind as it was our second time around. The Hotel is undergoing renovation but this didn't affect our stay. Staff are polite and helpful, breakfast was more than adequate and the bar is open all day (many of the smaller hotels in Venice do not have a bar service until 6pm) this was great, we came back around 4pm everyday and ordered tea in the lounge with a piece of almond cake which was lovely. If you arrive at Piazza Roma, exit the square canal side and go over a bridge to your left to join the Grand Canal on the righthandside and walk about 100 metres and the hotel is there on your right. There are two bridges in total to arrive at the hotel so not too bad with the luggage. Our room was quite small but a lot of hotel rooms in Venice are, it was more than adequate and the maids left the room absolutely spotless everyday. Beds were comfy and there was a good shower and bath. We didn't dine in the hotel so can't comment. We paid approx Â£650 for three nights. This is not bad atall for a room with a view in Venice. The Vaporetto stop it just across from the hotel, we bought a three day ticket and went everywhere on the waterbus. All in all a good standard hotel with an excellent location. We would stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Tiny room, no view”
Reviews.Author: JUGL11
Reviews.Content: This hotel likes to brag about its "100 windows on the Grand Canal" but your room is not likely to have one of them. The rooms are so small that we had to put our suitcases in the bathtub in order to have any floor space to move around. Location is good - you can easily walk to Rialto, Canareggio, etc. The water bus stop is just across the bridge (Ponte di Scalzi) so it's easy to navigate the Grand Canal & get to San Marco.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent”
Reviews.Author: jonessKent
Reviews.Content: We have just returned from a short break in Venice having stayed at the Hotel Carlton and Grand Canal. We found the hotel to be very clean and the staff were very helpful and polite. Breakfast is more than adequate with lots to choose from; the breakfast staff were polite and kept the supplies well stocked. I must admit having read some previous reviews which didn't paint a good picture of the hotel we were a little sceptical. However, we found everything about the hotel excellent. There was no mould in our room and although the room was not huge, it was more than adequate. All rooms are now fitted with a safe. A hairdryer was fitted in the bathroom which worked adquately. The hotel is situated directly opposite the railway station and is also only a very short walk from the bus station (less than 5 minutes). There is a vaparetto stop opposite the hotel. We found it to be in the perfect location because it was easy to get from the airport via bus or train. We purchased a 72 hour bus ticket which cost 31 Euro's each and it was worth it. This allows you unlimited use of the vaparetto (water bus) and also allows you to get the bus from the airport to the hotel and vice a versa. This ticket is easily purchased at the airport (if you are worried about the language do not panic because they speak English). Venice is a very small place and I would recommend you pack flat comfortable shoes for walking; we did a lot of walking and loved every minute of it - we did get lost a few times but were soon able to find our way around easily. Gondola rides can be expensive. We paid 80 Euro's for a gondola ride from San Marco (St. Mark's Square). It was a lovely sunny day and we were lucky because it was just the two of us (very romantic). You probably can pay less for a gondola ride if you are prepared to share your gondola - we did see some of them with around 8 people sharing. Our gondalier took us under the Bridge of Sigh's and was able to explain other landmarks to us. We visited the famous "Harry's Bar" and I must say it isn't much. It is very very expensive. A glass of bellini cost 15 Euro's each - you can buy a whole bottle of bellini from the local shops in Venice for 6.50 Euro's. We certainly couldn't afford to eat there because on looking at the menu you should expect to pay between 90 - 150 Euro's per person. Saying that, the staff in Harry's Bar were very polite and helpful. We loved our stay in Venice and at the Hotel Carlton and Grand Canal and would certainly recommend this for a short break. However, be prepared because eating and drinking in Venice is extremely expensive.

Reviews.Title: “loved this hotel”
Reviews.Author: topbox
Reviews.Content: We stayed at this hotel from 9th-13th March 2008. I choose this hotel for the location and also its proximity to the train and bus station. We were not disappointed. We arrived at Marco polo airport, went straight to the ticket kiosk got a 3euro ticket to Piazzale Roma and got the express bus at the d2 stand. Which leaves every 1/2 hr. You must get your ticket stamped either at the stop or on the bus (it is a small yellow box) At about 20mins later we had arrived at the main bus station.You cross the first large bridge (SCALZI BRIDGE) turn to the left and walk about 3mins and you have arrived. The hotel is facing the train station which is across the canal. From the moment we stepped into the hotel we were treated very well. All the staff from the front desk to the breakfast staff and chamber maids were lovely. Our room was clean, had everything you needed, it had a nice slim tv, fridge,safe, etc.I was surprised when i was getting our key ,they said breakfast was between 7/10 am and was included in the price when i booked it on the internet it clearly stated no breakfasts, it was extra?? I didnt argue. The breakfast was great eggs/bacon and the usual ham and cheese. Pots of coffee and hot milk. I would recommend this hotel and would stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Great Quality at a Great Price”
Reviews.Author: NokyEily
Reviews.Content: Bit concerned because of a couple of reviews but ... Great hotel. Really convenient for transport options. 5 mins walk from the Piazzale Roma bus station, cheap,regular bus link to both airports. Opposite (over the Grand Canal, bridge beside hotel) main train station and Ferrovia water bus stop. Warm welcome from English speaking staff who presented us with a map and explained all the main details for our stay - details about the Hotel and then which water bus pass to buy, which water-bus to use, the main sites and how to get there etc. The entrance and lobby of the Hotel is beautifully ornate. The hotel fronts onto the Grand Canal and opposite the Train Station - the promenade can be quite noisy from early to late. Our room was excellent - triple superior - at back of Hotel so very quiet. Very clean. The double-bed was actually two single beds pushed together. Plenty of towels in room and replenished each day. There was a bit of building work going on but it was unobtrusive and didn't inconvenience us at all. Took the good look of the front of the Hotel. Breakfast was a superb continental buffet. Very attentive staff kept replenishing the buffet and our coffee. Drinks in the bar were expensive but fairly consistent of food and drinks prices across Venice. Delivery by boat obviously adds to costs. Hotel organised a free water taxi to the island of Murano to a tour of a Glass Factory. Showed very little of the glass production and plenty of the showroom. Pretty spectacular stuff at matching prices. Didn't feel pressure to buy though but was able to buy a similar piece to one we liked in another Glass shop down the steet for substantially less. Area around Hotel is a much quieter than the areas around Rialto and San Marco so much more relaxed in the evenings. Definitely would stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic Location - Good hotel”
Reviews.Author: leanne007London
Reviews.Content: Date of trip 22nd February 2008. The location is fantastic, not right on top of St Marks Square but in a lovely district within walking distance to everything. The hotel is really nice, clean, friendly staff, breakfast is great (7.30 â€“ 10.30) the bar is expensive so Iâ€™d eat and drink elsewhere. I would defently recommend this hotel. The only negative thing I would say about the hotel is that the double bed is actually two single beds pushed together. The bathroom is modern and clean. At the airport go straight to the information desk and ask for a 72 hour travel card it gives the freedom to jump on and off most water buses road buses, even just to cross to the other side of the canal. If your under 29 years of age ask for a Venice rolling card, this gives you discount for the travel card and entry into some tourist attractions. The non discounted price of a 72 hour card is 31 euros. This ticket is defenty worth buying. Use this ticket to board the No.5 blue bus from the airport to the bus station, Piazzale Roma, the yellow buses have many stops along the way so don't bother with them.. To get to the hotel after arriving at the Bus Station walk straight ahead - walking down some stone steps (to the left of the location map on the wall) and then over two small bridges. The hotel is directly on the Grand Canal on the right hand side. The location of the hotel is perfect! It is across from the Vaporetto, water bus stop, which we used daily. Eating out is expensive. The first restaurant over the bridge directly on the right (waiters wear white jackets) is a complete rip off â€“ do not eat here. . Walk over the bridge bare right a few minutes walk on the right is a pizza restaurant (like pizza hut) which is reasonable and quite tasty.

Reviews.Title: “Beware of being burgled!”
Reviews.Author: PJP007
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed at this hotel in October of 07. We arrived in the afternoon and checked into our room with the porter showing us to our room and helping with the luggage we then left to explore Venice a dream of a lifetime. We didn't even take time to unpack! We walked around Venice found a restaurant and had dinner we got back to our room after dark...opened the door to our room and found our luggage broken open the contents scattered all around the room, we realized that we were the victim's of a burglary, I immediately went down to the concierge he came up to the room and agreed that we had been burgled we then went through our things and found that our leather jackets, cashmere scarf, leather gloves, check book, camera, ipod, international drivers license had been stolen. I then said we need to have a police report, the concierge said the police will not come to the hotel to make a report I said o.k. how do we make a police report he said we have to go to the police station back by the train station, we said let's go! Before we go we stated we were not comfortable staying in that room as it appeared the burglars came in through the window, the concierge said lets just lock the window , my husband said the lock is now broken how do we lock it? The concierge came over inspected the window and agreed it was broken and then offered to move us to a different room. We were moved to a different room and at this time the concierge offered to accompany us to the police station. He walked us over to the police station and was helpful with translation and the making of the report. There has been no offer to re[lace our stolen things, however we did receive a letter when we got home asking us to give a more detailed description of the stolen items for their insurance company, which we did do and faxed to them per their request. That has been 4 1/2 months ago. So at this point we feel it is necessary to warn others of our treatment. The hotel lobby and restuarant/bar area is quite impressive and the location of the hotel is pretty good. The decor and cleanliness of the room is acceptable.

Reviews.Title: “Good breakfast!”
Reviews.Author: peggymalone
Reviews.Content: We stayed here in December over the New Year holiday. The front desk staff were very kind and helped us find our way to St. Mark's Square and to the water taxi station. The location was fabulous for us because we took the train on to Florence, so we had only to walk across the bridge to the train station. The morning breakfast was great with fresh fruit and delicious Italian coffee! Would stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Superior Room was NOTHING like the pictures on the website!”
Reviews.Author: Angelfats
Reviews.Content: Me and my boyfriend booked this hotel well in advance to spend valentines day together through Lastminute.com. After looking at the website the room looked stunning, we booked a superior double room we thought we would have a romantic valentines night but we got an awful bedroom i couldn't believe my eyes wasn't even a double room. We had 2 double beds stuck together and my boyfriend kept falling in between! Thats not all we also had another single bed on the side don't know what that was about! We booked a double and got this, the bedroom was big but not stunning would not rate as a 4 star room looked like a 3 star. The bath was very tiny, the room interior wasn't nice as they said it would be on the website. There was no iron and if you wanted to iron your clothes you had to pay to get per clothes ironed! What madness. There was no hair dryer too in the room. The hotel is located in a very good spot right next to all the attractions right outside you have the gondolas and the canal and you even have the train station opposite you and you can take the water taxi right to the hotel but would advise you not too as its very expensive Â£90 Euros if you take the bus its the cheapest option. But i would advise anyone if you book with this hotel check your room and if you are not satisfied change the room! I did not think the money was worth it for this hotel its a very expensive hotel if you are looking for a nice romantic looking hotel i don't think this one would be the right one for you put ur money to good use and would advise you to book with another hotel as there are lots more and they are not very far from the attractions!

Reviews.Title: “Ideal for a Romantic Getaway”
Reviews.Author: Chilly25
Reviews.Content: Really lovely grand old hotel. We stayed here in February (very cold weather) had a great time and would go back. If you stay here look into transportation from the airport to hotel we made the big msitake of not doing this and ended up paying 90 euro for a water taxi. On the way back to the airport we took a short walk around the corner (about 3 minutes) to Piazzale Roma and got a regular taxi for about 30 euro. My advice - get a map and do the regular taxi. This hotel is in a great location near to lots of lovely bars and restaurants. We stayed B&B, breakfast was fine however it is quite close to the lobby and you do feel like you are actually eating in the lobby. Nice rooms decorated as you would expect in Italy. Overall a nice base for exploring Venice.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location in Venice”
Reviews.Author: DileepB
Reviews.Content: The location is great. It is across the canal from the San Lucia train station, where you can also get on the vaporetto up and down the Grand Canal. It is also only 2 short bridges away from Piazzela Roma where the cruise ship free shuttle dropped us off. Our room had aview of the canal. It was a bit noisy. Room size was good. Complimentary breakfast was excellent. Friendly staff recommended a nice restaurant off the beaten path for dinner and made reservations. They also stored our luggage for several hours because we checked in early before the rooms were available. Great value!

Reviews.Title: “Quaint Hotle”
Reviews.Author: interiorsbyjeanine
Reviews.Content: Part of the Globus Tours last week in November. Overlooking the Grand Canal. The Venetian quaint interior is very clean. The staff was very friendly. I would suggest staying at this hotel. The views off the nearby bridge are breathtaking (photo included)

Reviews.Title: “Ignore the negative comments”
Reviews.Author: WirralMan41
Reviews.Content: Took my girlfriend to Venice for her Birthday. Stayed here 30th Nov-2nd Dec 2007 and have to admit being a bit worried due to some of the negative reviews I'd read. Obviously everyone's tastes vary depending on age, expectations, and experience of hotel stays, but from the view of a couple (aged 40 and 41) staying for a short weekend break in Venice, the hotel was fantastic and wouldn't have any hesitation in recommending this to anyone. We stayed in a superior room and to answer some of the more negative reviews 1. Size - I was expecting a tiny room from the reviews, but I was more than surprised - plenty of room in both the bedroom and in the bathroom - more than adequate for us using it as a base to go out exploring. 2. Noise - yes you can hear some noise from the corridors outside, but it didn't lessen the experience - if you're a light sleeper it could possibly be a problem, but it didn't bother us. 3. View - We didn't have a view overlooking the canal, but that wasn't important to us - it was a crisp cold weekend, so we didnt have the windows open anyway. If we wanted a view of the grand canal, then we got one when we left the hotel anyway. 4. Location - perfect - a 5 min walk from the bus station, and a 35-40 min leisurely stroll away from St Marks Square. 5. Staff - very helpful, very polite, not at all hurried or rushed as some reviews would suggest. We didn't have any reason to call on them though, apart from to check in and check out. 6. Breakfast - Standard Continental Style Buffet - no complaints. For other meals we ate out as whilst exploring so can't comment on the hotel catering. On our departure date we had to leave before breakfast started, so they made up a breakfast box for us to eat on the bus to the airport. If we were to go to Venice again, then I would definitely stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Good value and a great location”
Reviews.Author: GillianOWarwickshire
Reviews.Content: The reviews for this hotel vary so much, to the extent we were a little concerned - but we need not have been. It's not a featureless business hotel clone - it's in Venice, decorated in eighteenth-century Venetian style and geared to holiday groups to a considerable extent. If that bothers you, you can pay a lot more and get something a lot less individual. We found the staff friendly, and responding particularly well to our halting attempts to speak Italian to them. Requests for extra pillows, toiletries etc, were dealt with promptly and with friendly courtesy. Breakfast was copious - standard Euro-hotel fare including bread, jam, cheese, cooked meats, cereals and scrambled eggs with bacon, all in a buffet which was kept replenished regularly. Venice itself is a delight - one of those places which takes your breath away with its beauty and lives up to all your preconceptions. We walked almost everywhere - bring solid shoes! Leon restaurant - left out of the hotel and left again - was an excellent food stop for the first evening, but we found plenty of other reasonable places to eat. Don't miss cichetti, the local starters, a bit like tapas, out of which you could make an entire meal. We found the "Rough Guide" invaluable for pointers to restaurants and sights alike. And definitely don't miss the Scuola Grande di San Rocco - more Tintorettos to the square inch than anywhere else on earth, I'd say! We had a four-day minibreak - truly the experience of a lifetime. The hotel was definitely a good choice - but avoid canal view rooms unless you like the noise and bustle of a main road! We'd definitely go again. By the way, the post complaining about the bugs appears to be about an entirely different hotel!

Reviews.Title: “Lovely Hotel”
Reviews.Author: figmentJerseyC_I
Reviews.Content: To be honest - I was a little worried after reading some of the reviews. I had booked the 3 night stay with my elderly mother before I read them. We were pleasantly surprised. The lobby, lounge and bar area are decorated to a high standard and give a comfy homely feeling whilst being quite elegant. Our room, whilst not huge was certainly big enough and although it overlooked down to the back entrances it was very quiet and we did not experience any of the noise that other people seem to have experienced. Our room was very clean and beds very comfortable. Staff were very friendly and obliging - but unfortunately there was a slight hitch upon our departure. The morning before we left I went to reception to request a car taxi back to the airport at 8.00am. The following morning we waited in reception - but at 8.10am our driver had still not arrived. I had allowed plenty of time to get to the airport as my elderly mother walks very slowly with a stick. I asked at reception if they could find out howmuch longer we would have to wait. To cut a long story short the receptionist I had spoken to the day before had not ordered it. (she wrote it down on the list - but obviously failed to call them). We ended up getting a water taxi as that was all that was available. Pleased to say we still got to the airport with time to spare. I would recommend that if you book anything with reception - confirm with them that the booking is done before the due time. Also a gondola ride booked with the hotel reception cost 100 euros for 35 mins. Elsewhere the cost was 100 euros for 45 mins. I would certainly recommend this hotel for ease of getting from one place to another (water buses opposite, near train station etc)

Reviews.Title: “Absolutely fantastic!”
Reviews.Author: Mick40
Reviews.Content: Venice is the most wonderful place I have ever visitedand this hotel made our trip! The staff were so friendly and the hotel was very clean and well kept. It is situated walking distance ofabout five minutes from the bus terminal and wewere able to get a bus from the airport to and fro for only three euros each way! It is the other side of Venice from St Marks Square but that is what makes it so attractive because the area is less busy and you only have to trun off thegrand canal to experience such peaceand tranquility. You can get to St Marks by waterbus for very reasonable prices and it only takes about 30 mins. We ordered a candlelit dinner at the hotel when we booked and it was divine! We were the only guests inside the restuarant at the time and we had personal service from the staff and the food was out of this world. I did not see many children in the hotel which suited us but I am sure children would be as welcome as the adults. You must go to Venice and this hotel will make your trip.

Reviews.Title: “The Regatta on the 1st Sunday in September shouldn't be missed!”
Reviews.Author: Bradway9
Reviews.Content: We booked this hotel for 3 nights at short notice, and with some trepidation after reading previous reviews. We sked for, and got, a room with a canal view. It was not large, but quite adequate. The mini-bath was a bit of a shock for a 6 footer, my wife won't allow me to attach a picture, but better than a shower alone. It is very convenient for the railway station, just across the canal, and the bus station, only about 300 yards away. Water taxis draw up outside. All tne vaporettas/water buses stop by the station, so transport is no problem (see [--] for details of water buses). They run all night, too. We got used to their noise in tne street! Gondolas are available outside, although there are more romantic places by the Rialto and St Mark's Square to start your ride. We seemed to be unusual as independent guests. Most visitors appeared to be with travel groups (American and Australian when we were there) who ate in a different room. They sounded satisfied. We had the restaurant breakfast room to ourselves on 2 mornings, with fresh supplies of everything. We didn't eat inside in the lovely restaurant in the evening as there are so many other places to try in Venice, but we did sample the pavement service once. It was rather slow, and the busy thoroughfare, with 2 graffiti covered shacks (colurful sales kiosks during tne day) outside took something away from tne ambience. The room was clean, as were all public areas. The staff were helpful, although we did feel there could have been more information made available to advise of the biggest annual Regatta on the Grand Canal starting at 4pm on Sunday 2nd September. This must be a marvellous day, especialy as the races and processions all pass in front of the hotel. The water buses were taken off the Canal from 3 until 7. Not the fault of the hotel that I'd booked us to leave on the 4.30 train! We got to the Lido to see the annual Film Festival - although we didn't see anyone we recognised! Perhaps we may soon be able to say we saw them before thay became famous. For Venice we felt we got fair value and would be happy to stay again.

Reviews.Title: “Good Location”
Reviews.Author: lollygal
Reviews.Content: The Carlton's location was excellent. We hired a water taxi from the airport and was able to pull right up to the front door. We would have been able to transfer our luggage if it hadn't been lost. Apparently, over 5 rooms of tourists at the hotel that had arrived from different destinations on different days were also awaiting missing luggage. This became a major concern for us as Venice was part one of our Italy trip and we wanted to get our luggage before we left for Florence. We asked the front desk to check on the luggage with the airport. We were met with bored stares and yawns that it will get there when its found. We were not impressed with the service or the Breakfast buffet which was sparse. The Superior room with view we booked was not available so we got a back room. The room was clean but not luxurious, but we spent so few hours in our room we were not upset! Venice is magical! The location is perfect! It is accross from the Vaporetto (which we used daily ) and the Train station. The gondola location in front gave us the best rate after asking around. It is within walking distance of great restaurants and shopping!

Reviews.Title: “I Wouldn't Bother ............................”
Reviews.Author: Jacqui7960
Reviews.Content: My partner and I stayed at this hotel 16 - 19 August 2007. The hotel was in a great location and the reception was nice but that is as far as it goes!!! When booking it with Lastminute.com I booked a Superior Room and requested a canal view for which I paid good money. We couldn't have been given anything further from what we requested! We ended up in a small (no, I mean tiny!) room overlooking the air conditioning vents and bin courtyard. I immediately went down to reception with my confirmation and was shrugged at a few times before being told that they were full and there was nothing they could do but if I paid another 120 euro per night I could upgrade!!!!! You can imagine my response!!! The glass bathroom door opposite the room door does not provide any privacy whatsoever. The shower was very small and shallow hence it kept over flowing and flooding the bathroom then the shower curtain would stick to you! Gross!!! However, Venice is an absolute fabulous place. The people are fantastic and the food is better than you could ever imagine. Don't let this review put you off Venice. I would go back there tomorrow but would definitely stay in a different hotel. My family owns a 5 star 17 century country Hall so I know about hotel gradings. Believe me this is definitely NOT a 4* maybe a 2 or 3* AT BEST!

Reviews.Title: “First impression was not great but after a while....”
Reviews.Author: globetrotters21
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed at the Carlton & Grand Canal hotel for 2 nights - Globus booked it as part of a tour. The lobby was nice and well lit. But our room was a little different. we were on the second floor (or to the Italians, the first floor - the ground floor is usually considered 0 floor) so it was a quick flight up. The elevators are SMALL and can take a while. Walking to find our room - the halls were very narrow and I have to admit it reminded me of a scene from 'The Shining'. My first impressions of the room were dark and grungy (could've been the effect of the fabric walls) - but after a bit, I got used to it. It had a lot of character - very historic, 'venetian' feel. Bathrooms were clean but narrow. The room had a mini bar and small flat panel TV - which offered Pay-Per-View - recent movies cost 10 euros. Buffet breakfast was included in our stay and it was alright - small selection of breads, croissants, cold cuts and cheeses. There was also sausages, bacon and eggs - the breakfast area is also pretty small - so if there are a number of tour groups in one morning, go early to grab a table. It was on the canal which was nice - walking distance to restaurants and shops. But to get to the tourist attractions - St. Mark's Sqaure, Doges' Palace, high end shopping, etc, you will have to take a water bus all the way to the other end of the canal. It takes about 45 minutes and costs about 6 euros. The hotel is across from train station - Ferrovia - so its easy to remember when to get off the waterbus. Service was not that great - no sense of urgency with any requests - could be the hotel or just the laid back demeanor of Europe. Overall, it was a good stay - even though it was a trek to the tourist attractions - there were quaint places to explore nearby.

Reviews.Title: “Don't believe the chef! Poor security...”
Reviews.Author: Jan1212
Reviews.Content: I booked this as a surprise for my boyfriend for his birthday. I hadn't a clue where to stay but this seemed to be nice. I paid extra for a roof terrace room, so I think it was about 800 Euro for three nights, maybe more, but I really wouldn;t bother. Probably get a canal view instead. The room seemed a little dated, though that is probably the style, but it just didn't feel clean. Anyway, we were a bit annoyed at the poky room and dirty windows, even though I paid extra. We dedided to eat in the restaurant and asked if they had chicken wings (I know!) and garlic bread as we just wanted something like that, and the chef said 'we do everything' LIE LIE LIE. The chicken wings were just some horrible chicken dish which he charged me as another main course, and the steak my boyfriend ordered was absolute muck. He then gave him some pasta 'expecially made' which was something I would make at home and I can't cook pasta at all. They did not have garlic bread, so he shouldn't have said that he did. We ended up paying for 4 main courses?!!? When we checked out, they said they would put our bags in the little room and mind them. When we came back that afternoon they were at the door, completely unguarded. Even our shopping bags with souveneirs were just at the door. We were furious, it could've been taken by anyone! They just said they didn't have petty crime over there, but you really can't vouch for the other people staying in the hotel. OH did I mention that we were sent to bed with about 8 other people one night for being too loud? We were just having a drink at the bar! And we got told off! Venice is lovely though overpriced, but I would go there, but to be honest, a lot of the hotels seemed a bit dingy. But I would've expected much more from here. Breakfasts were lovely though. And the location is quite good. I am 29 and my boyfriend is 31 and we have never complained about a hotel before, so this is not us just being cranky!!! It was just dissapointing for me as I wanted it to be a good surprise, but it was just kinda annoying,

Reviews.Title: “Excellent location”
Reviews.Author: Schuck
Reviews.Content: Stayed at the Carlton Grand hotel in June for 7 days celebrating our 30th wedding anniversary. We paid a heavy supplement for a canal view room and were pleased to find we also had a balcony which not all rooms have. The highlight of our stay was having a canal view so well worth the money. Some people would find it noisy but it is the main thoroughfare of Venice and we like to watch the world go by and then use earplugs in bed! Room was elaborately decorated venetian style, good size room but no space to speak of for putting clothes away, no deep drawers, kept some clothes in case all week. Bathroom, shower good and hot. Housekeeping was patchy, clean towels, sheets etc everyday, but no top ups of toiletries and disposable plastic cups, also came back to room unlocked one day. Breakfast room bright and airy, plentty of choice buffet was typical cold meats, cheese, jams, rolls, fruit etc with bacon and egg for the brave, italians have yet to get bacon and egg right. Staff all very friendly and helpful particularly on arrival in reception. Great location can walk to St marks in around 30 mins, recommend vaporetti pass for water buses which are not so full at beginning of routes by hotel. Also excellent location for railway station, we travelled to Verona from here no problem.

Reviews.Title: “Carlton Excellent”
Reviews.Author: Ourviews
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Carlton and were pleased with everything. It is right opposite the railway station and very central. The bedrooms were typical Venician with their decore, if you pay extra you have a canal view which we did and were very glad, as you can learn a lot just looking out onto Grand Canal. Breakfast was very varied from fruit to cereals etc. Staff very helpful in all ways. Would thoughly recomend this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Overall was pleased with the Carlton & Grand Canal!”
Reviews.Author: jerseyjenn
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed at the Hotel Carlton and Grand Canal in June 2007 after we departed from our Royal Caribbean Greek Isle Cruise. The hotel is in a great location! The train station is across the canal. We had just about 24 hours in Venice, so we did as much as we were able to do. The staff and the hotel were very helpful in taking care of our luggage after if was dropped off via the boat transfer. The staff helped up book a 2 hour Venice Tour. We were able to walk to the start of the tour at St. Markâ€™s square from our hotel. They also arranged our Gondola Tour. It was nice buy pricey 100E, but it was a set-price so I felt better about that. It truly was a great experience for my husband and me! My only regret is that we only stayed (1) night in Venice. I thought the room and bathroom were a decent size and was clean and was pleased overall. Being American Iâ€™m not a big fan of (2) twin beds pushed together, but can deal with it. They also had a decent breakfast that was included. We had some coffee and cereal and some croissants. I did read there were many negative reviews, but for our needs this hotel was good. Iâ€™m not sure what the other reviews mean by small rooms? Iâ€™m not sure the room needs to be any larger unless your there for business and require a desk. I did not find it noisy since our windows did not face the canal, which next time I would want it too. We were also here only (1) night at the end of our Cruise. We also received a restaurant suggestion from the desk, which was also noted, in our â€œDKâ€� travel book. It was very close to the hotel, but was not in the super touristy area. It was â€œ Antica Bessettaâ€� we went to diner a little early for us, but it had been a long day. We were treated like a king and queen. Their staff could not do enough for us. I wanted to each real food that the locals would eat and not get overcharged because of location. I viewed eating on the Canal like eating in Times Square and being New Yorkers we know that is for the tourist and is overpriced. We also found an English pub, and had some draft beers. It was a cute place and made my husband very happy! They also had bathrooms!! What a huge issue finding a bathroom in Venice! They do have pay public restrooms for 1 euro. I already want to go back to Venice!

Reviews.Title: “Disappointing Room”
Reviews.Author: edwardsonholiday
Reviews.Content: Date of Trip 19 -21 June 2007 I took my wife to Venice for our 20th wedding anniversary and took great care to ensure everything would run smoothly. I booked the whole package with Lastminute.com including the airport car parking, flight and the hotel. In the box for special requests I reiterated what I had read on the hotel webpage that as i was staying in a superior room, a canal view was expected although I later found out this was not guaranteed. After a long journey on foot from St Marks Square we found the hotel at the northern end of the Grand Canal. A porter showed us our room and imagine my disappointment when there was no canal view. I immediately phoned reception who told me that there was nothing they could do to provide us with a canal view. The room was very small but was decorated beautifully in the Venetian style. Breakfast was a big disappointment given that this hotel was rated at 4 star I expected a typical hot and cold all you can eat buffet. The bread was extremly stale and when I requested fresh bread was given a blank look from the head waiter. The scrambled egg was made from egg powder, the bacon was very greasy and appeared uncooked. There was the usual selection of jams and cold meats and so there was enough to eat. The trip was generally a fabulous experience and I'd recommend Venice to everyone although not this hotel and I'd try to stay a little more central next time.

Reviews.Title: “Very nice stay”
Reviews.Author: mac34
Reviews.Content: Very good hotel and very good location. Have stayed here twice now. Rooms are small, but clean, adequate and quiet (away from front of hotel), The hotel has a small restaurant and there are several nice ones nearby for those of us that like to get away from hotel restaurants.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent stay”
Reviews.Author: BRADGIRL48
Reviews.Content: The hotel has a very convenient location, being opposite the railway station and only involves a short walk with cases to get a taxi to the airport. We were grateful for this after seeing hundreds of tourists lugging cases on and off the vaporetti and over bridges. The vaporetto stop, Ferrovia, is opposite the hotel and you can get onto several routes from this. The general area of the hotel is interesting with loads of character and plenty of locals not just piles of tourists. We walked to St Mark's in about 20 minutes (faster than the vaporetto). Rooms were spotless, with all linen changed daily. Staff were invariably friendly and helpful, and any requests were dealt with immediately eg booking concert tickets and a guided tour. We travelled as a party of two couples, one pair over 80, and the staff were very kind. My parents were given a ground floor room with access to an inner courtyard, shared with a few other rooms but not used by any other guests (great for reading or sittting and tucking into fresh fruit and other snacks). We found the hotel very quiet, apart from a very few guests who talked loudly after a couple of drinks - but that was no fault of the hotel! Breakfast was plentiful and staff were attentive, with unlimited tea, coffee etc being offered. The bar staff were very friendly, with amazing memories for our personal preferences, and I was presented with lovely fruit as a late night snack once the lady found out I liked it. My room was very small, but we asked the reception staff to change it, and they said "Just pack your things and leave it to us". When we returned after a day out, our bags had been transferred to a bigger room. I noticed some staff at breakfast producing toast (it wasn't out on display) for guests who asked for it, also specialist teas. My advice would be, if you are not pleased with any service, you should make your point and not just moan. This was our first time in Venice and it was a memorable experience, all aspects positive, even the heavy downpour of rain on a few days, which we were lucky enough to watch from bars and restaurants (quite a sideshow). TOP TIPS Travel very light. The most important items are comfy shoes. Venice is a city so don't dress for the beach. Tshirts and shorts will be unsuitable for entry into churches and St Mark's. It's useful to have a cardigan or light jacket. You can buy cheap umbrellas at stalls on the street, or take your own. If you enjoy concerts, book tickets at one of the churches or concert halls. We went to two, and they were excellent and only about Â£25 each. We saw scenes from La Traviata in a real palazzo, only about 50 seats available and the audience moves through the rooms with the cast. Fantastic!! To get to St Mark's cross the big bridge near the hotel, turn right and walk straight down the wide pedestrian street. It should take about 20 minutes. If you want something a bit different, stop off and visit the mummified body of Santa Lucia in the church as you pass. If you are put off by the queues for St Mark's basilica, book a guided tour. When you get in after about 30 minutes of the tour (without queueing) just drop out of the party so you can be amazed for longer. Try to see St Mark's square when the water is high and watch some tourists wading barefoot. The Accademia is brilliant. The Peggy Guggenheim collection is also smashing, with a nice cafe. For a really good value and lively place to eat, go to Brek near the hotel and have a meal for about a fiver or a tenner if you want salmon (includes dessert). This place is fantastic for vegetarians, as the salad bar is basically eat as much as you can pile in a bowl. The pre-filled salad bowls are HUGE and cost about 3.60 euros. DON'T go to the pizza place along the street, the one with big dark green canopies!! The proprietor will try to entice you in but we thought the service was poor. If you don't want to splash out on a gondola ride, use the gondola crossing the canal at the back of the fish market - it costs 50 cents.

Reviews.Title: “Small rooms, very noisy...”
Reviews.Author: gelati07
Reviews.Content: Small room.. friendly staff, good breakfasts... pretty clean (although the dirty towel hanging on the hook when we arrived stayed in the same place for three days - cleanliness test failed) - but incredibly noisy - like living in a tenement - get to know your neighbours - all your neighbours - all about your neighbours - some nice folks from Georgia (USA) turned up about mid-night, and the old boy was still telling jokes at 2am - the women were still laughing.... and that was 5 doors away... right in the heart of the tourist action, but not the most attractive part of Venice.... plenty of other and much better places to stay and it's worth checking them out....probably a good bet for a really early or really late train.. but otherwise go elsewhere....

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Hotel! Totally recommended”
Reviews.Author: littlebird_Ireland
Reviews.Content: We were very lucky to have found such an affordable 4* hotel during February considering it was Carnivale but with just â‚¬120 per night and we felt we were treated like royalty. **Not only was it in the best location being just being so near to all transport options, but it was in a really nice area of Venice that wasn't 'too' touristy. **The Hotel was extremely clean and although the room we got (superior) was at the back of the hotel with only a view of the roof, it was still very luxurious and comfortable if not a little outdated (especially the bathroom) but it was spacious enough for the 2 of us. We spent most of our time out and about anyway. The staff were extremely professional and very friendly. Everyone took the time to say hello and help when needed. * *The buffet breakfast offered a lot of options and suited most people, however the cerials were terrible. Otherwise, waited on hand and foot and treated better than we've been treated anywhere else. **The small bar is lovely though a bit expensive. Small beer â‚¬7. (Not even a half pint). Fruit juice â‚¬8. Only a few rounds and it all adds up. We found bars outside the hotel more atmospheric and cheaper. **The location was excellent. 3 mins stroll and 2 bridges and you're at Piazzale Roma station that is just a 20 min journey to the airport. The waterbus and train are directly across the bridge opposite the hotel and there are an abundance of restaurants, shops and markets all within a stones throw of the hotel. It is also very conveniently located to most tourist attractions and we found walking to San Marco and Rialto to be the most beneficial to see the most of Venice. **You must take the water bus at least once though...just for the experience. If you can afford it, get a gondola. We didn't as it was just too expensive for just 2 of us but if there is a group of you, it is better to spread the cost. **Venice is spectacular, beautiful and atmospheric. We found it to be extremely safe and everyone was very friendly towards tourists. The hotel made it all the better. It was under some modern refurbishment when we were there. If that includes redecorating the bedrooms and bathrooms, then all the better. **Outside of some outdated decor and high bar prices, I couldn't recommend this hotel more.

Reviews.Title: “Gr8 location but pack the plugs.........ear, not bath!!!”
Reviews.Author: B6IRL
Reviews.Content: As many of the reviews tell you this hotel is in a fantastic location for travel by bus, train, water and foot. This is definately the area to stay in and based on our experience and on reading the reviews the success of your stay at the hotel depends on your room allocation. On arrival after a very stress free journey (we took the No.5 blue bus from the airport to the bus station, walked down some steps, over 2 small bridges to the left and the hotel is on the right hand side), we were met by Claudia on reception who gave us a run down of the hotel, of touring Venice and gave us a map which she marked all the places we wanted to visit. She was very informative and very helpful. We proceeded to our 'Superior' room which was on the second floor. The room was quite big with a shower room off, a small plasma screen TV on a vanity desk and a mini bar fridge. Taking the advise of a fellow traveller I had packed a hairdryer which was essential as the hairdryer in the hotel wasn't very powerful. The room was ok, nothing great and not what I would consider a Superior room but pleasant enough, very clean and facing into a side street so the external noise was minimal, unfortunately it was the internal noise that was the problem. We were woken at 6.30am by the house-keeping staff who had their trolly stationed right outside our door. They proceeded to shout their way through the next 2 hours making sleeping impossible and this was the same each morning of our stay. As we were only staying for 3 nights we just put up with it . There is a great wine bar and restuarant , Leon, just round the corner from the hotel (turn left out of the hotel then left again just before 1st bridge) which opens till 2am so we tended to have a night cap, or two, in there so a 6.30am wake up shout was not well received! Venice is a fantastic place with loads of fantastic eateries and wine bars hidden up side alleys so walking and getting lost has its rewards and although this hotel is definately not a 4 star its location and price makes it worth a look (just pack the lug plugs). If you are looking for a true 4 star, at 4 star prices the Sofitel is just round the corner, across from Leon! Happy travelling & enjoy Venice!

Reviews.Title: “Good location for not lugging your bags”
Reviews.Author: apattie
Reviews.Content: Nice location given that it is very near Plaza Roma where buses let you off. Very clean and great breakfast. We found staff very helpful and all spoke at least some english. The room we had overlooked the back and noise was not a problem. Very easy access to the train. Tip if going to Venice, get a good map as it is easy to get turned around.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect Hotel!”
Reviews.Author: amiddletonpricce
Reviews.Content: I really don't understand all the negative comments about this Hotel. I did'nt read them until I'd booked and I did feel concerned when I did. However, I'm so glad I booked this hotel. The staff were so helpful, the room clean and confortable (OK so it's not a huge room-but what do you expect in Venice). We had a standard room at the back of the Hotel (no view of the Canal) but these rooms are bigger and have views of real Venice (houses, chimney-pots- every-day life). Breakfast was great, as much as you could eat served for 2 hours every morning and the Hotel bar does the greatest cocktails. As for location, two bridges away from Piazzle Roma, across the canal (over the Scalzi bridge) from the Santa Luca Train Station and the Ferrovia water bus stop. So perfect. You could get anywhere fast or slow. We walked to St Marks most days, but the waterbus is an economical way of saving those feet. I would definitely reccomend this hotel. It is beautiful and the staff welcoming. Enjoy your holiday.

Reviews.Title: “Venezia Bella!!, but very small room!!”
Reviews.Author: ItaliaWinnipeg
Reviews.Content: We experienced the best time of our lives when on Honeymoon on the Grand tour of Italy and Sicily through Globus tours and what and amazing time it was!!. We stayed at so many beautiful hotels in Italy it was so impressive untill we arrived in Venice. We checked in at the Grand Carlton of Venice and beleive us this hotel is anything but grand. We arrived to our room to settle in and could not even store our luggage anywhere in the room as it was that small. We had to store the luggage right in front of our room door as there was no space elsewhere. It was so unconfortable for us and the bed was very lumpy we both has sore backs the next day. Everytime we had to leave the room we had to move the luggage away from the door to get our of our room.... what a terrible experience that was. We did not complain and we should of. We could of asked our tour guide to have us moved but we didnt bother. When we asked other people on the tour they said there room was fine... not sure if this is true of perhaps they didnt want to complain either. If we ever encounter anything like this next time we will call front desk to move to another room. Tip- when you check in ask for the biggest room they have and may be this will avoid this situation. The city however really made us forget about the terrible room we had, its sooo!! breathtaking and we really miss it. But we will never stay here again even though this hotel is on the canal we would not be able to justify 400.00 plus paying for this hotel on our own and having the worst accomadations. Best regards, Winnipeg, Manitoba

Reviews.Title: “Great location, nice room”
Reviews.Author: ffdoc2
Reviews.Content: I can't figure out why some reviews for this hotel are negative. I guess some people are never satisfied. Our room was big enough, bed was comfortable, the bath was small but then so what. The location is great being just across the grand canal from the train station and a vaporetto stop. We'd book this same hotel again if we're ever fortunate enough to return to Venice.

Reviews.Title: “Good things and Bad things...”
Reviews.Author: AnabelMarthaJ
Reviews.Content: Good: near the Station (Ferrovia), very clean, good breakfast, nice-looking reception/frontdesk Average: rooms a little bit tiny. staff sometimes cold sometimes friendly (especially when you give a tipps... but they work a lot of hours: i saw the same person at 7 am and 12 pm...) Bad: very noisy inside the hotel! (we hear everything - lift, doors, other people... - the windows shaked when people upside were walking... --> bad insulation!). Preatty expensive in regards that it is not really a 4*. Price we pay: 700 CHF / 430 euros for 3 nights - from thursday until sunday - with breakfast, for 2 people. Advice: cheaper when you book with an intermediate! (e.g.: TUI in Germany) Other: Venice is sooooo greaaaaaaaat! and most people are friendly.

Reviews.Title: “immaculate hotel, dreadful fellow guests.”
Reviews.Author: penky
Reviews.Content: The hotel was immaculate. Our room was lovely, a big double bed and a single one too, even though we had booked a double. In the odd venetian way the walls were covered in damask, rather than wallpaper. Bath with shower over, and lots of toiletries. Breakfast ample, and of good quality. The staff were nice, but we didnt ask for any help or anything, so cant comment about that. This hotel is so convenient, literally 3 mins walk from bus station and railway station, and on the grand canal, so handy for the waterbus. Get a 3 day ticket and go by boat to St. Marks etc, its stunning from the water. Venice is very expensive, and average for food unless you pay loads. Now the downside. On our third night we were woken at 3.30am by the occupants of the room below us, we looked out over the courtyard. They were having a very noisy party, laughing loud, smoking cannabis, the stink was really strong, their window wide open. Very loud american voices. I rang reception and told them, and my husband went down eventually and knocked on the door and complained. We heard other people knocking on the door after my husband. The american bloke who answered the door just said its cool, when my husband asked him to keep quiet. Eventually they shut their window and quietened down. Needless to say we were exhausted on our last day. How inconsiderate can you get! Yes they may have been jet lagged, but this should not stop you from considering other people. In the morning the hotel staff had to clean all their ash and butts from the courtyard. There is a glass panel going all around the court yard at 1st floor level, and it was covered in mess, the porter had to get a ladder and equipment to clean it. Talk about stereotypes living up to themselves.

Reviews.Title: “Great exterior, disappointing room”
Reviews.Author: Geraldine_Powell
Reviews.Content: This hotel is very deceiving - beautiful as soon as you enter, but then the room we were given was simply a let down. The hotel itself is also in a position which is great for the Canale Grande, but quite a way from the Piazza di San Marco. It took us about 30 -40 minutes to walk there, which can be avoided by taking the water bus, but we really didn't want to spend a lot of time on public transport. Venice itself was tremendous - Carnevale was on and the streets were littered with costumed Venetians who are all too willing to be photographed. The food is great and simple, and the people were most welcoming and friendly. I have to say that the staff at this hotel were very good and helpful at every opportunity, not, as I had read, rude and discourteous.

Reviews.Title: “Budget luxury really does exist.........”
Reviews.Author: bassetlawbadger
Reviews.Content: Just returned from a wonderful break in Venice. What a unique place, filled with great food, drink and friendly people - even though it was cold and very quiet for them. The cold only added to the positive experience of the hotel. It was warm, wonderfully decorated, and the staff courteous and helpful (yes, even the night porter when a lightbulb went in my room!). We got such an excellent deal on the internet (around Â£300 for both of us, two nights, flying BA), we were concerned about the quality of the hotel. However, this was completely unfounded. If you have a little more to spend, upgrade to a de luxe room - although they are a little smaller than a patio room they overlook the Grand Canal. We had a ground floor patio room which, as it was for less abled guests, was a lot larger than the other rooms. I'd really recommend that you request one if they are available and you aren't bothered about just a shower (there are only 8). Breakfast was fine - coffee, tea or chocolate however you wanted it and the usual continental style buffet. But - bacon and eggs too! In all, a great bit of luxury at a price that doesn't swallow up all your spending money (and beleive me, you need as much of that as you can get!).

Reviews.Title: “Underrated Hotel-Bargain!”
Reviews.Author: thisgirl_1986
Reviews.Content: It was only after booking the hotel that I came across the negative reviews, and so began to regret the risk of booking it so hastily....However, was really pleasantly surprised when I arrived as it is close to the Piazzale Roma where the airport bus dropped us off, and was not as isolated as many reviews made it out to be. The furthest you will have to walk is to the Piazza San Marco which is only 20 minutes away. The rooms were cleaned every day, were furnished nicely and the breakfasts were great. The only complaint was that the staff behind the desk were not too polite. They also forced a porter upon us even though our room was just down the corridor, and he then stood around waiting for a tip (which I always find rude!). Considering how cheap the hotel was, it was such a bargain! I would definately recommend it to travellers who don't mind a bit of a stroll (water taxis are cheap anyway), or being just outside the crowded streets in heart of Venice.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, nice hotel”
Reviews.Author: two_crazy_africans
Reviews.Content: We painstakingly selected the four-star Carlton and Grand from Venice's hordes of hotels for a three night stay in mid-January to kick-off a two-week trip celebrating our tenth wedding anniversary. First-off know that whenver you pick a place to stay the photographs/website/brochure are generally going to look a lot glitzzier than the real thing. That being said, however, we were not dissappointed with our choice. The hotel's front rooms/reception area are very elegantly appointed. Don't let your heart sink into your shoes when you see the building's facade. Most buildings in Venice look a little long in the tooth - they have, after all, been standing there for hundereds of years...that's part of the charm of this place! We didn't go for a large room or suite, figuring we'd be out touring a lot - and because of a tight budget and horrible exchange rate! - but were pleasanlty suprised with the space we had and the large bathroom. We appreciated the Venetian decor as well.The buffet breakfast served is really excellent with everything from cereals, yoghurt and fresh fruit to eggs, bacon, cold-meats, cheeses and various breads (a choice not experienced by us in other European hotels before). This hotel is in a really great loaction when you consider you can't just catch a taxi (of the wheeled variety...) from the airport to your front door. A quick walk from the Paizzale Roma - the furthest point cars and busses from the mainland can go - and you're there. No need to lug your bags up and down a zillion stairs or bridges. The hotel is also right opposite the train station (not anywhere as unsightly or noisy as this sounds) and a vaporetti landing stage (Ferrovia) so getting around is really easy. Ofcourse, walking is the best way to see Venice and there are many charming little streets to wander near the hotel. I've heard many complain of the noise when in Venice but do bear in mind that this is a city that lives on the water and so obviously the waterways are going to be busy late into the night and in the early hours of the morning with general traffic and deliveries. Canal facing rooms will bear the brunt of this so we were happy to forgo the view and have a slightly quieter spot overlooking a back street and rooftops. As a light-sleeper I always travel with a good set of ear-plugs and the hotel does have great shutters you can close over the windows to block out the early morning light and much of the noise as well (I don't think the front rooms have the same shutters we had though). The only drawback for us is that we did not feel especially welcome...Some reviewers of this hotel commented positively on the friendliness of the staff but for us, apart from one or two helping in the breakfast area and one of the barmen who did manage to smile now and then, we actually found the complete opposite. The reception staff were particularly cold and unfriendly to the point where we were hesistant to ask them anything! Their attitudes had the potential to make our stay there quite unpleasant but we managed to look past them and enjoy the city we had come to explore. Venice is a truly magical place, and if you're looking for a clean, comfortable place to stay with a good breakfast and a great location, then this hotel is definitely an option. Take your welcome as it comes: let it work for you if it's warm and work past it if it's not. Happy travelling!

Reviews.Title: “very good hotel / very small price”
Reviews.Author: barbaraRome
Reviews.Content: We staied at the Hotel Carlton & Grand Canal for 3 nights and really enjoyed it! Very clean room and comfortable. Staff always efficient and friendly. The girls at the booking office were very helpful to organize our stay with good suggestions for visits and excursions at convenient price. I would recommend this hotel to anyone!

Reviews.Title: “OK not hectic 3 star at most”
Reviews.Author: Cathal2006
Reviews.Content: The hotels web site does not reflect the hotel at all. Reduce everything by a third & you have some indication of the size. Saying that, the bedrooms were adequate and clean. Drink prices for this type of hotel were a little excessive but my main complaint was at breakfast there was a queue and I was sitting with my partner eating & waiting for a coffee. I asked a man for the coffee & was told loudly "cant you see how busy we are, you will wait for it" I was v embarrassed as everyone looked around. Later I asked who the man was and I was told he was the manager so I couldnt really complain. Venice is a beautiful place with beautiful people. Go for the food, buildings and of course the wine.

Reviews.Title: “A far better hotel than some reviews make out.....”
Reviews.Author: J0L0
Reviews.Content: Returned yesterday from a 3 day trip to Venice staying in the Hotel Carlton and Grand Canal. I was a little worried about staying at this hotel after reading the reviews, but on arrival I quickly realised I had nothing to worry about. We had a superior double room - a fairly small room with the double bed made up of two single beds (made up with single sheets) pushed together, which was the only real gripe - not really my idea of a superior room but hey - you don't go to Venice to stay in your room!. However the room was traditionally decorated and most importantly it was clean. The biggest plus was the location. Really and truly do not worry that the hotel is not on the doorstep of St Marks square. The hotel is literally a two minute walk from the P.le Roma (bus station) which was handy when arriving from the airport in the dark in the middle of the evening - trying to get your bearings is not easy and so the proximity of this hotel to the bus station is a bonus. There is a main vaporetto stop right outside the hotel so the entire city can be reached quickly. But don't immediately jump on the boats - there are so many diffferent ways to walk into St Marks and you see so much more of the real city on foot. It was incredibly safe, even late at night walking down the alleys to retun to the hotel. I don't think we would have seen half of Venice if we had stayed on the outskirts of St Marks. I really would recommend this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Good location nice hotel”
Reviews.Author: leicsloony
Reviews.Content: Well this is a nice looking hotel that has been recently decorated. We were fortunate to have one of the superior rooms that over look the grand canal. The Reception were very helpful in helping us to find a restaurant that had been recommended to us (It was shut when we found it!!). The rooms are clean and tidy and more than enough for a weekend stay. Make sure that you close your wondows at night as it can get a little noisy. It is very easy to find and we had a very pleasant stay. Its not the Ritz but then your not paying Ritz Prices. We will return at some point in the future.

Reviews.Title: “Better then expected!”
Reviews.Author: masakoVienna
Reviews.Content: We just came back from venice and I have to say although there were a few reviews I`ve read before departure which were not so nice about this hotel, I have nothing to complain about! the rooms are a little bit small, even the deluxe rooms, but the location is perfect, although the staff may seem a little bit chaotic and confused every once in a while, they were very friendly,especially felippo from the restaurant, and all requests IÂ´ve made before arrival were completely fulfilled (smoking room, flowers, friut bascet, greeting card,...). the breakfast buffet was very nice, you cannot expect that much variety all over italy, but comparing to other hotels in italy we never left the hotel hungry... if you are still suspicious, I can recommend also the "Monaco and Grand Canal" because of its amazing view from the terrace, and the hotel "Principe" because of its location!

Reviews.Title: “Pleasant stay, good location”
Reviews.Author: Lucyspoileddog
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed at the Hotel Carlton Grand Canal for 5 nights this past month. We took the train from Florence and it was very convenient since the hotel is directly across from the train station on the Grand Canal. Just up and over one big bridge. Upon arrival we were given a briefing on where the hotel was located within the city, and how to navigate the streets back to the hotel at the end of the day, which turned out to be very helpful!
