The desk staff were always helpful, although we never really asked for much. We were told that our room was in "the new section" of the hotel. Ours was on the ground floor within the courtyard. The room itself was fine, although there was no place to store clothes except for hanging them in the small closet. We had a minibar/refrigerator that we could store bottles of wine that we bought on the street (save lots of euro that way!). We got pretty warm at night and needed to have the room and bathroom windows open to keep us cool, but that allowed in more noise than we wanted to hear, since the bathroom window opened up on a walkway. The double bed was actually 2 twins put together, so it was large enough but quite hard. My request for extra pillows was immediately accomodated. Breakfast was fine, always busy, but there was always a table free, selections were adequate and the coffee service was efficient. I would probably want to try a different place next time in Venice, but I have no complaints about the Carlton. They treated us well.

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel in need of a little TLC”
Reviews.Author: JamesSkinner
Reviews.Content: The Carlton & Grand Canal website, to be fair, makes the hotel look a little better than it is. However that's not to say it's bad. The location is pretty good - ideally placed for arriving / departing Venice as it overlooks the railway station and is a couple of minutes walk from the central bus station. This does make the view from the many rooms overlooking the canal a little less than perfect, but it's not bad. A quick waterbus trip takes you to Rialto and St Mark's, or you can take a 20 minute walk instead. Our junior suite looked to have been recently refurbished and was very nicely appointed. Nice extras such as decent bathrobes and slippers - but not sure whether these are limited to just the suites. The lobby, restaurant and bar were all well decorated and maintained. The other communal areas (such as the hallways) were in real need of some attention. Nothing that a lick of paint and a new carpet wouldn't sort out, but it did let the hotel down a little. Good food in the restaurant, but quite expensive compared to a number of other very cheap places within 5 minutes walk serving really good food. 2 pizzas and a bottle of decent wine for â‚¬15 can't be bad! Hotel staff were good. However be wary of the "free" boat trip to Murano that they will offer you at check-in - it's certainly free but the ultra-high-pressure sales tactics when you get there are a bit annoying. The glass starts around the â‚¬250 mark and they **really** want you to buy something! Overall pretty good - this would be a very expensive hotel elsewhere but in Venice it seems pretty reasonable value.

Reviews.Title: “Great breakie!!”
Reviews.Author: ahouse
Reviews.Content: just returned from the hotel carlton; hotel was easily found from the bus station to welcoming staff and an impressive reception area. It said a 'city view' which turned out being a small side view of shutters and the superior double bed turned out to be two twins pushed together on a double head board so one person was bound to fall down the middle! Apart from these two problems we got what we paid for, the location was perfect, the staff were friendly and the breakfast was good to start the day with. So all in all i recommend staying at this hotel for a short break just remember what you pay is what you get!

Reviews.Title: “Great Location...”
Reviews.Author: cisco88
Reviews.Content: Surprisingly i got a better deal on their own website than expedia and others. Brekkie thrown in but seeing the a la carte menu, i would go elsewhere ($$). Location very good especially if you have a lot of luggage and need to park in the Piazzale Roma. Lobby gives false impression on hotel and rooms in particular. Lobby is very grand but when you go to room, (mine 352) it's shabby in comparison. Clean though, carpet could do with replacing. Instant hotel water and flush super powerful! Room adequate size. Staff friendly and helpful and would have given them top marks until i checked out. I paid up and asked if i could store my luggage with them for 30 mins - 1hr, they said no problem. i waited for 10 minutes and had to check with them in the meantime that they were organising a porter. It seemed that after i paid i was no longer a valued customer. Overall though, if location is an important factor and price not too much of an issue, then this place is worthwhile.

Reviews.Title: “Good Location”
Reviews.Author: chicagolandgirl
Reviews.Content: Just returned from Venice and stayed at this hotel. Our room faced an alley way. The room was small with a double bed. The room was alittle humid, I am guessing it is from it sitting on the Grand Canal. The hotel controls the air conditioning and there was no air available in Oct. The room had a window that was able to be opened but it was noisy. Remember to pack earplugs! Nice lobby, and breakfast is available everyday. Location is great, water bus close by, and in walking distance to alot of shops and dining. Remember to wear comfortable shoes as there is alot of walking and that includes many stairs over several bridges around the city.

Reviews.Title: “good location”
Reviews.Author: ktravel01
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for a pre-cruise stay for one night. The hotel is located directly across from the train station and the water bus station and it is very convienient to both. The room was small but clean and we had one of the rooms that overlooked the grand canal. If you want to be more in the center of the action (i.e. St. Marks Square) this is not the place for you, it is about a 30 minute water bus ride to the the square. The general neighborhood is quite with several good places to eat, just ask the front desk people all of whom were very friendly and willing to answer any questions. Alll in all for the time spent in the room this was a good choice and I would recommend it to others.

Reviews.Title: “Nice Lobby, small room”
Reviews.Author: eganmay
Reviews.Content: The lobby was nice and so was the room, but the room was a bit small. The courtyard was not a nice as it is in the pictures, and the elevator tends to go out of order, but it wasn't a long walk up the stairs. Breakfast was usually cold, even though we ate early, but they were very good about getting you your coffee.

Reviews.Title: “fairly nice hotel”
Reviews.Author: Treece36
Reviews.Content: I think the hotel is nice overall. I was a bit disappointed in our "double superior" room as far as not having much space. There were no drawers to put our clothes, just a small closet with a few hangers. The bathroom was small and the bed/pillows were not so comfortable. But the decor was cute, baroque style - didn't seem our particular room had been updated for a long time. The breakfast was a nice start of the day and the location was good. Keep in mind no matter where you stay in Venice, you have to hop on a boat to get from here to there in order to see different areas.

Reviews.Title: “Carlton Hotel, Venice”
Reviews.Author: Pete-no1
Reviews.Content: Hotel was clean and newly furnished. Decor was baroque style, staff helpful, price OK. Breakfast was better than average continental. Had a room overlooking an alleyway, no view but quiet. The Grand Canal can be very noisy at night.

Reviews.Title: “Interesting expensive city, terrible airport”
Reviews.Author: TravelBelle22
Reviews.Content: My husband and I went to Venice August 17-20, 2006. We flew with Ryan air because it was the cheapest, but I don't think I will fly with them again. Ryan air flies into Treviso airport which is more like a shoe box than an airport. Then you take a bus for an hour to get into Venice. Our hotel was near where the bus depot was so that wasn't a problem. But for the journey back it only took us 30 minutes by bus and we thought that was great, until we were made to wait in line for an hour and fifteen minutes because they didn't open the check out desk when the three buses arrived. They were not helpful or nice at the airport. I will not fly with Ryan air again because of this. There service in Venice Treviso Airport was terrible. We stayed at the Hotel Carlton and Grand Canal across from the Ferriovia, train station. It was a nice area and we enjoyed the hotel. The room was very small, but clean and the only stations they had in English were CNN, Eurosport, and pay channels. We got very tired of CNN. The staff were very friendly and helpful and the hotel was nice. We would recommend it for people travelling to Venice. It served our purposes just fine. They also provide you with a free trip to the island of Murano. It is the island where they make all the the glass. You get a tour of the factory and are led into 9 show rooms with examples of the glass made there. You are obviously encouraged to buy, but not too forcefully. While the glass is beautiful it is very expensive. Be prepared to leave your first born child. For a dish the size of a side plate it cost about seventy euros. But if you do want something small when you leave the showroom and go to the water bus area there are vendors there selling smaller versions and wine stoppers, glasses, plates, etc. for much cheaper. And also much cheaper than buying it from a shop in Venice. We bought a beautiful wine stopper for five euros on the island from a vendor and saw a siimilar one at a Venice vendor selling for fifteen euros. We also visited the island of Lido. I would recommend this to anyone. The island is beautiful and it has a wonderful sand beach that is quite big and not crowded. You must visit and bring your suits and towels and spend an afternoon here. There is also a golf course and driving range on this island, and you can rent canoes and boats to go out into the water. As for the rest of Venice. It is an experience. There is no where else in the world like it. We did the Original Venice Walk and it was very good. We learned a lot about the history and didn't have to wait in line in St. Marks. But you only do a quick run through of St. Marks. So if you want a more time to look around and explore the church I suggest you do that on your own. The Doge's Palace is next to St. Marks and well worth going in. You can book a tour called the Secret Itineraries tour through the hotel and it is great. They take you into the secret passages, and offices within the palace. You actually get to see where Casanova was imprisioned and made his escape. With that ticket you also get into the palace for free. It costs sixteen euros. Be prepared to spend at least 50 euros per meal and closer to 75-100 for dinners. It is better to try to find restaurants hidden away from the tourist sites down the back streets. Drinks are extremely expensive. For a can of diet coke it can cost anywhere from 3-4 euros per can. Starters are also expensive, ex. parma ham and melon will cost you 12 euros, but it is worth it. Venice is a beautiful city, but it is very expensive. Definately not a cheap holiday. As for travelling around the water bus is the cheapest option. But it does take a long time for the journey from the Ferrovia to Saint Marks. It is often faster to get off at Rialto and walk the 5-10 minutes to San Marco, as opposed to the 20 minute journey on the water bus. It is definately worth riding along the canal once so you can take in the wonderful buildings and history. But it is more fun to walk through the narrow streets and get lost. The city is not that big and you can pretty much walk anywhere within 30-45 minutes, just bring your walking shoes and some water as it gets very hot and humid in the summer.

Reviews.Title: “Just Right !”
Reviews.Author: ALIMEFO
Reviews.Content: We stayed at this Hotel last weekend, the location although is not in the heart on Venice is by the Grand Canal and with the waterbus ticket we could get easily anywhere within minutes, even if we decide to go by walking to Saint Marks Square for instance it was so easy because they are plenty of signals on the streets about how to get anywhere and within half an hour we were right in the main places. I am glad we stayed in that area because is not as crowded as the centre, were it is very difficult even to walk sometimes!! It feels just more relaxed around were the Hotel is, the Railway is right in front of the Hotel. I must say the breakfast was delicious and the prices around the area are reasonable. The room was in good conditions and the staff were very friendly, although they were terribly busy they always seem to try their best, they even provide us with some tips about how to get around and it was very helpful. I notice a nice variety of tourist at the Hotel, people from Japan, South America, North America and some Europeans.

Reviews.Title: “Great Service & Location”
Reviews.Author: MStar08
Reviews.Content: First trip to Venice and after reading the mixed reviews I was somewhat worried about what lay ahead, Within seconds on arriving to the Hotel all these fears were put to rest, we were given a free map and travel advice of how to get around along with a guide of whats what in Venice, fantastic first impression and the staff continued to exceed our expectations. OK the room was are not amazing (Superior Room), but come on, why travel to Venice and stay in your room? The complimentary trip to Murano was a nice surprise, rather than an overcrowded tour as expected, we had our own private water taxi waiting for us 5 minutes after telling reception we wanted to leave, We had to make our own way back to Venice but if you have bought the 72hour Tourist Waterbus pass (YOU REALLY NEED ONE OF THESE TO GET AROUND) this did not present a problem at all. Would we go back to Venice?, definetly, would we go back to the Carlton Grand Hotel? absolutely but next time I would upgrade to a Deluxe Room with Canal view. Do not believe the bad reviews of this hotel, you will be glad of the location, you will be pleased with the attitude of the staff (Sabrine on reception deserves extra credit for the way she looked after us on arrival and for the duration of our stay), just upgrade you room if you can and there is nothing else to worry about. Oh and take a comfortable pair of shoes, the best way to explore this wonderful city is by foot and I would really recommend throwing away the map and just leaving to chance where you end up.

Reviews.Title: “Our visit to Venice”
Reviews.Author: Herefordshire
Reviews.Content: We had a fantastic time at this hotel. We arrived very early so staff put our bags in the secure luggage room. We were getting worried about staying at the hotel due to earlier reviews, but there was no need to worry, we were upgraded to a patio room, the corridors and other areas of the hotel were beautifully kept. The breakfast was excellent and the staff were extrmemely helpful. We cant wait to go back again.

Reviews.Title: “lovely hotel for perfect venice experience”
Reviews.Author: jetbug
Reviews.Content: We stayed at this hotel for 4 nights in june and were not dissapointed. The continental breakfasts were generous, the staff very friendly and helpful. The rooms are of traditional decor but immaculate and atmospheric. The location of the hotel is perfect, excellent for access to all the main area's and sights and opposite the train station and near to the bus station. So it was very easy to find. I'd definately stay here again, we had a great time!

Reviews.Title: “Decent and convienent”
Reviews.Author: corcalaoi
Reviews.Content: We stayed in this hotel at the start of June after seeing it on the airlines hotel search engine and reading reviews on tripadvisor which weren't too bad. We booked a superior room package which gave us a lovely spacious room and a large bathroom. The package included two tickets on the vaporetto for 24 hours and 2 tickets into the museums in San Marco square. The room was very clean and was fully air conditioned with a mini bar and statellite television. The bed was turned down every night on our return to the hotel and complimentary slippers were provide by the bedside. Little extras in the bathroom such as toothbrushes and toothpaste and shaving kit were also provided. We had no view but this did not bother us as we were not spending our time in the room. The breakfast was a continental buffet with a good spread. Plenty of meats, breads, cerals, fruits etc were provided. Their tea making is less to be desired but that was no surprise in this coffee nation. The hotel is located at the top of the Grand Canal opposite the train station and vaperetto stops. Do not stay here if you are looking for a romantic old world view of the canal. The hotel is ideal as a location only if you don't wish to drag your heavy suitcase up and down bridges and alleyways. One bridge and your at the hotel and one bridge was enough for us to pull the suitcases over. The hotel is a twenty minute walk to San Marco and Rialto bridge. We only used the vaperetto once or twice just to take the trip down the canal. It was easier and quicker to walk and more interesting to wander and meander around the tiny streets and see the real venice beyond the tourist packed traditional root of the grand canal. For first timers of this city the crowds of people on every street may not be bewitching, it is best to see the Rialto and San Marco in the evening around eight when the tour groups have departed. If you most venture into San Marco for the museums etc then go early or be prepared for the crush!

Reviews.Title: “A good fit for Venice”
Reviews.Author: cbkingery
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed here two nights as part of our Globus tour. Arriving into Venice, the location was great. I can't imagine lugging all of our bags throughout the tiny streets and over bridges like we saw many others doing. Being April, there was no air conditioning in Venice (temps were in the upper 70's). Our teeny room was stuffy but became cooler once we opened the two windows. The bathroom was large and clean. We also enjoyed good water pressure in the shower and had adequate hot water. When in St. Mark's Square, it was quite a long distance to the hotel. We had good maps but it took about 45 minutes (getting lost once) to walk back. Our last night, we took the waterbus, which proved to be great. The stop, which was on the other side of the canal, was across from the hotel so we just walked over the bridge. If we were by ourselves, we probably wouldn't stay here because we would want something located more in the center of everything. For our needs, and the size of our group, it worked out well.

Reviews.AuthorLocation: Ashby de la Zouch, United Kingdom
Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel”
Reviews.Author: MissHermione
Reviews.Content: I would start by saying don't think twice about staying at this hotel, its very nice and the staff will help you with anything you need and there are no hidden charges. After reading some other reviews about the hotel it was far from being on my list of top hotels to stay at in Venice. But we took a chance and I am pleased that we did. You may think that the hotel is far from the main attractions in Venice, but it's not. Venice isn't that big and you can walk to St Mark's square in half an hour - but I'd suggest you take longer as the walk there is just as much fun as seeing the beautiful cathederal. I loved our walks to and from the hotel - we never went the same way twice! Also being away from the attractions you'll find cheaper and more authentic food. For everyone who says Venice is expensive, that's because they must have been shopping and eating at all the expensive places. You can happily buy a meal for 2 and spend about Â£20 (including wine). Of course if you want a 3 course dinner and all the trimmings it's going to cost you more, but if a bowl of pasta or a pizza is enough to fill you up, you'll have a very cheap stay in Venice. We splashed out on our last night in Venice and did spend a fortune but I couldn't have done that every night. This hotel gives you the opportunity of looking around Venice from a different angle, although the main attractions aren't on your doorstep you'll see so much more than if you just stayed at St Marks square. The hotel offered free tickets to the Casino, and a free trip to a glass blowing factory on Murano island. We took advantage of both! The casino is just a short walk (or water bus ride) away. And the hotel actually arrange a private water taxi to the glass blowing factory. We wanted to go to the factory on the Sunday and as no one else from the hotel was going we had the whole place to ourselves. It seemed as if they'd opened the factory and lit the furnace just for us. The staff at the factory were lovely, they spoke excellent english (as did all the hotel staff) and seemed perfectly happy to show us around - although I suspect the tour is aimed more at groups not couples. The receptionist Lisa was very helpful in particular and was very patient explaining where to catch a waterbus and the best tickets to buy. What more can I say, the breakfast was good - you can have as much as you like from the buffet. The rooms are large and clean.

Reviews.Title: “Appearences can be deceiving!”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: This hotel looks beautiful from the outside and even has it's own jetty where gondolas can moor right outside the front entrance. The people behind the front desk were some of the most helpful I've ever across-they informed us of the excursions the hotel organised (free of charge) and pointed out on a map where the main sights were. I suppose the let down of the hotel was the room-other rooms may have been more impressive but we managed to count 10 things wrong with our room! It was really outdated and not everything in the room worked. Plus our view was of the next door neighbour's window! The food wasn't good at all and I actually skipped breakfast! That aside, the hotel was in a great position for hopping on a ferry down to the Rialto bridge/San Marco Square.

Reviews.Title: “Don't believe some of the bad reviews”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: We stayed at this hotel with our tour group in Venice in November 2005. It is right on the Grande Canal across the canal from the train station. A converted villa of some sort so the halls and rooms are irregular shapes. The rooms were large and nice enough. A lot of tour groups were staying at this hotel. They turn off the air conditioning for the fall. You have to open your windows to get some air or cool off. Then in come the mesquitos. Make sure you bring insect repellant on your trip. We also encountered this in Florence. Breakfast was down in the lobby and the typical fare you get with groups all over Italy. Gondolas and water taxis are available right outside the hotel but we walked everywhere. Opposite end of Venice from St. Marks Square. We also ate at a great restaurant near the hotel called the Brindisi. Venice is beautiful and all the horror stories weren't true. The place wasn't flooded and the canals didn't smell. The whole place looks like a post card. Surely the most romantic place I have every visited. Don't miss it!!!! The people at the front desk were very busy so not the friendliest but I would stay at this hotel again because of the location and the large size of the rooms.

Reviews.Title: “Terrible hotel”
Reviews.Author: proppy
Reviews.Content: I stayed at this hotel quite a while back, but felt I needed toi post as a friend toldme of her recent experience there , it doesn't seem to have changed. It's a lovely hotel, it looks lovely on the website and from the outside it looks quite elegant. I guess its one saving grace is that it isn't particularly pricey. The staff are not the friendliest, the rooms are pretty but lack that certain something. It feels as if it once was great and is now a ghost hotel, if that makes sense? If you don't mind not particularly great service and no extra bits and bobs that one might expect then you won't be disappointed.

Reviews.Title: “OK but nothing exceptional”
Reviews.Author: buhalid
Reviews.Content: The hotel has good and bad things but little that is remarkable both ways Location: +3min from Piazalle Roma (Bus fromAirport) and Train station+Vaporetos - Away from Realto and ST Mark Square Rooms: + Renovated at OK Standard - Corridors need refurbrishment Staff: + Most nice and particular the lady at the bar and the Breakfast Head Waiter - The check in receptionist was "too clever" for my taste - rather than welcoming and friendly + Bar Prices +Breakfast (great eggs!) The two things I really disliked - They only have 12 rooms on the canal - so unlikely to have a view. My room -252 was looking just to another unpleasant building - They had not even heard of WiFi and no internet available Otherwise ok - if the price is ok i will stay again but will not go out of my way to do

Reviews.Title: “Attention to details....”
Reviews.Author: Leo66
Reviews.Content: It's hard to write an objective review of a hotel in Venice, because the city leaves you enchanted. The hotel itself has its good and bad points. On the positive side, it is on the Grand Canal and the rooms are quite charming, all being different sizes and shapes. Ours was quite small, but had lots of storage and a nice full bath. The bed and pillows were great, the best we found on our travels in Italy. We found the service to be adequate, except at breakfast where the hotel seems to be understaffed in the mornings. The building itself needs some TLC. Walls in the dining room and hallways need to be repainted, and outside our room was a display of Venetian masks in an armoire that had fallen down, and were never fixed the whole time we were there - I wonder if it's still like that? The neighborhood itself is a little far away from San Marco, but we enjoyed wandering the backstreets of Venice more than that pigeon haven. Walking through Venice is an experience unlike any other, mazes of alleys, little stores, children and canals. It's amazing. Getting lost is fun and you will never forget the sound of Venice. Without traffic the atmosphere of the city changes - it is so quiet! We didn't find the location of the hotel to be inconvenient at all, clost to a vaporetto stop and the bus station. Venice is so much more than the touristy things. Wander the alleys and you'll find little treasures, mom and pop restaurants, and memories of a lifetime.

Reviews.Title: “A nice place in an entirely wrong location”
Reviews.Author: Hate-to-travel_10
Reviews.Content: My wife and I stayed at the Carlton Grand Canal from October 4 to October 8, 2005. My travel agent recommended this hotel, but I really cannot see why. Even thought the accommodations are nice, it is near the train and bus terminals (which is convenient only if you arrive by either but makes little, or no, difference if you take a water taxi), but is far, far, away from the main â€œplaces to see and goâ€� in Venice, being located at the opposite edge of the city. It takes a good hourâ€™s walk through the maze of streets of Venice to reach Piazza San Marco, and about thirty minutes if you take the â€œvaporettoâ€�, and I donâ€™t think that this disadvantage is compensated by lower room rates. If you *must* stay there, at least try to get a room on the hotel front on the Grand Canal (although you will also get a great view of the all-too-modern train terminal, right across the canal and which, I feel, detracts from the spirit of the city). We stayed in the â€œnewâ€� part of this rabbit-warren of a hotel, on the first floor, next to a â€œpatioâ€�. Our room was nicely appointed and very clean. However, the door leading to the patio was half glass, presumably to provide the room with more light. However, this was *clear* glass, which allowed anybody in the patio to look into the room so, for all practical purposes, every time we were in there we had to keep the drapes (yes, the door had drapes just like the window next to it) closed in order to maintain our privacy. Also, the "patio" could have used some plants and such. Some details and caveats: - The voltage is 220v throughout, so, bring your transformers/adapters (also for the round plugs that they use there) - As most European hotels, they provide no American-style washcloths, so, if you're used to them for shaving and/or showering, bring your own. - Limited TV offerings in English (not terribly important, as you are not there to watch TV anyway!) - VERY limited closet space Summarizing: If this hotel were located anywhere near the Piazza San Marco area, it would be a nice place to stay. However, at least in our opinion, its location kills it.

Reviews.Title: “Not a Nice Place...........at all”
Reviews.Author: glaucomadoc
Reviews.Content: Simply put: Do Not Stay at this hotel! I have been to Venice 4 times over the past several years, all of which were vacation oriented visits. This is by far the worst hotel I have stayed at while in Venice. In fact, it is the worst hotel I have ever stayed at in many, many years, even in the States. Yes, I know European hotels traditionally have small rooms. That is not the issue. I was surprised to read so many positive comments about this hotel, especially in reference to it's "great location". As I've mentioned, I have been to Venice 4 times before, and am reasonably familiar with it's layout. If you want a hotel that overlooks the train station, is about as far away from everything of interest in Venice, and is surrounded by nothing much, then this is the hotel for you. There are far better hotel locations than this, and at much lower prices. And therein lies my biggest complaint with this hotel. The cost is absolutely outrageous for a hotel in a poor location, with very very small rooms, with a staff that is on the rude side on a good day, and downright nasty on any other day. My guess is that the folks who had positive things to say about this hotel were either enamored with Venice as a whole, or have only been there once and did not have anything to compare it to. If you don't want to believe my comments, that is fine. But read the other negative comments.....we are all saying the same thing. DON'T STAY HERE.

Reviews.Title: “Back again”
Reviews.Author: BowTom31
Reviews.Content: We first stayed here in May 2004 and fell in love with Venice. We returned with my partners mum, staying in the same hotel and the experience was just as good - the air conditioned rooms were reasonable sizes with plenty of storage (although oddly no drawers). Breakfast was OK despite the bad coffee machines, and the bar with canalside tables was relaxing. As other reviewers have previously commented, staff were helpful, friendly and most spoke very good English. Moans - not enough pillows - so ask for more. And they need to go green and not change all the linen and towels every day (unless that's what you want of course). We will go back to Venice, and will be happy to stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Far exceeded our expectations”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: We booked this hotel based on the photos that were listed by an independant tour company and the rooms were exactly what I pictured a Venetian hotel to look like. We had a canal front room on the 1st floor (2nd floor for Americans) which I wouldn't have traded for anything! We left the windows open and could hear the water lapping against the sidewalk. Our tour company arranged a taxi for us which dropped us off directly in front of the hotel so we didn't need to go over the bridge. Besides if something like trudging your luggage is going to stop you, you shouldn't be in Italy. Just think of it as your warm up for all of the stair climbing and walking you will be doing. The location is great and convenient as it is across from the train station (which is surprising quiet) and the vaporetto stations. I would recommend that you get a vaporetto pass for however many days you are there. I can't wait to come back to this hotel. The only bad smells came from some of the Europeans who don't use deoderant. Venice is very safe and clean.

Reviews.Title: “romantic”
Reviews.Author: chantal99
Reviews.Content: we went there for our honeymoon, the room was elegant and beautiful, breakfast normal, staff really helpful and nice.the views from the window were not nice but we didnt mind.near train station.

Reviews.Title: “An excellent hotel”
Reviews.Author: kevinl1
Reviews.Content: We stayed in the hotel from 11th August to 18th August 2005. The hotel is opposite the train station on the other side of the Grand Canal. It's nice and comfortable and all staff speak English. Very good buffet breakfast. The bedroom doors are a bit old fashioned so there is some noise of doors opening and closing.Also church bells go off at 0700, 0715, 0730 and 0745hrs but this is Italy!! Its the best place to stay if you are on a budget,as if you stay near St. Marco Square the restaurants are very exspensive. Opposite and to the right is a bridge to cross to the station and all the water buses stop here to go anywhere in Venice. In my opinion a good place to stay.

Reviews.Title: “Well we loved it!”
Reviews.Author: julesy
Reviews.Content: I'm shocked at these horrible reviews of the Carlton & Grand Canal - we had a fabulous time!! We stayed for 2 nights and didn't have one complaint. We caught a train from Zurich and were delighted to find the hotel right across the other side of the canal from the station - so much for it being impossible to find your hotel in Venice!!! Yes, it's a bit of a chore getting your cases over the bridge, but if that's all we have to worry about life is good. The staff were very helpful upon check-in and confirmed forward flights for us, booked restaurants for us, basically did whatever we asked of them. We were in a canal view room which of course was made all the more beautiful by the views. It wasn't huge, but I was surprised at its size given our Paris experience and the general expectation of European hotel rooms. Oh, and our bathroom (with full-size bath and shower-in-bath, large basin with mirror and WC/bidet by the window) was almost bigger than our entire hotel room in Paris!!! Well, not quite but you know what I mean. We had beautiful shutters on all windows, incl the bathroom, that opened up onto magnificent canal views. And we had satellite TV too! The breakfast (which we didn't even realise was included in the tariff) was fine - nothing flash, but a large selection of typical European breakfast goodies that filled us up till lunchtime. No complaints at all from us - we'll be back next time we come to Venice!

Reviews.Title: “Excellent hotel, highly recommended, much better than previous reviews suggest!”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: I had read the reviews on this website and was nervous to say the least about my stay in the Hotel Carlton and Grand Canal. It was, however, near perfect. The staff were polite, the room was wonderful, the breakfast good, and location great. I would definitely go back to this hotel and highly recommend it. We upgraded to a canal view room which was well worth it. The room was not huge but that was not a problem, you didn't really need much more. The double bed was 2 singles pushed together but this was ok and is actually slightly bigger than a conventional double! The furnishings were typical Venetian. The room was air conditioned but even in August it was not sweltering. Neither did the canal smell, as everyone told me before I went (and most of them have not even been!). The hotel staff recommended us 2 restaurants for dinner in the nearby area which were on small side streets, very quiet and romantic, full of locals, with delicious well-priced food. Beats anything you read in a guide book! This was possibly the best trait of the hotel, the local knowledge (and I don't mean of San Marco). The choice of breakfast from the self-service buffet was good. Many types of fruit, cereal, cold meats, cheeses and small bread rolls. You could also order separate items off the a la carte menu but we didn't feel the need to do this. The location of the hotel is fantastic. San Marco is about a 20 minute walk away through a maze of narrow streets, but it is a really fun walk and you get to explore where the locals live, occasionally meeting a dead end or better yet, yet another canal. San Marco itself is very crowded, full of pigeons ("flying rats"!) and is noisy. It was perfect to be able to walk there easily during the day, and then walk back to Santa Croce for a quiet dinner and stroll down the quieter part of the canal at night. We also went on a gondola which was as expensive as you expect/fear (â‚¬150 for an hour) but this was the highlight of our trip as we wound down the empty canals, listening to the locals chattering from their appartments, and did not meet another gondola. It was wonderfully romantic and atmospheric. You also HAVE to go to the San Marco basilica, up the bell tower and to the Doge's Palace. It is such a shame that other tripadvisor users had a bad experience of the hotel - I hope it doesn't put people off as the hotel is a real find.

Reviews.Title: “dirty and rude!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Do not believe thr rumors that the French are rude, this hotel has that completly covered. For the outrageous price of $400 per night, (and we booked TWO rooms for our large family). We were shoved in a closet like room with a rubber mat on the floor that served as a shower base. The view was the dirty rooftop, and as normally expected for European rooms, very small. (our rooms were each calssifed as "triples") These things we can live with, what was impossible to understand, was the rudeness of the front desk employees. They did not help with any questions, and if you dared to ask, the information was usually wrong. Would NOT recommend this hotel, we did travel during the busy season, (July, 2005). Which they love to take advantage of, by asking incredibly high prices.

Reviews.Title: “Good location but that's it!!!!!”
Reviews.Author: 10isguy
Reviews.Content: Very excited after a long plane ride to hear the cab ride from the Venice airport (30 Euro) leaves you very close to the hotel. The driver failed to tell us that you need to carry luggage over 2 bridges to get there. The bridges weren't too bad but for you older travellers, it may be tough. The lobby is very nice and check-in went smooth. The room was small (expected) and a little run down. Strong smell of smoke. No view but did not care. The people at the desk ranged from nice to don't bother me. That was our opinion of the locals in Venice overall. The breakfast was fine. The eggs tasted a little funny but the fruit and rolls were fresh. I do not think we would stay at the hotel again because after touring the city, we came acroos much nicer hotels for the same price.

Reviews.Title: “Good Location, Very Old Rooms”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: The location is the only draw of this hotel. It is right on the canal, not too far from lots of shops and restaurants. Ask if you can have a room with a view of the canal, otherwise your only window will overlook the outdoor cafe (drinks only) which can be a bit loud. The rooms are the smallest I've ever stayed in, even in Europe, and the decor and smell reminded me of an elderly person's house. The breakfast was okay, they did have scrambled eggs which isn't that common for Italian hotels.

Reviews.Title: “Finally! Downgraded to 3 stars!!”
Reviews.Author: MamboMusic
Reviews.Content: I stayed here for the honeymoon May 1-4 and it wasn't great. In general, European hotels are known for having smaller rooms, but this takes the cake. The room we had was very...TINY! We had two twin beds put together and we had requested a King Bed. Second, don't believe anything about Satellite TV because it doesn't exist there. Also, the bathroom was as big as a portapotty. The hotel did not provide AC because of ongoing construction, but was necessary because it was warmer than usual for this time. There are a few things going good at the hotel. The breakfast was very good! They provided a variety of selections of food to eat. However, the eggs were made with olive oil, but still edible. The location is excellent because it's right across from the Train Station. It gives the tourist the opportunity to tour Venice as a whole rather than stay near St. Mark Square and not walk very much. Overall, I won't stay here again. I'll definitely stay in a brand chain hotel next time.

Reviews.Title: “Not too surprised...”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Well this isn't a horrible review but we, from the U.S., must understand that when traveling to Europe the hotel standards should never ever be compared to those of the U.S. Our supersized society does not translate well over in Europe and for the most, residents here do not require as much square feet or free space as we demand in the U.S. A good measure for the next time you travel to Italy? Deduct 1 or 1 1/2 stars from the hotel rating and well, there you go. For instance, 5 stars can either be a 4 star or a 3 1/2 star...you get the picture. And now my review, the Carlton is a decent place to stay if you are not too high-maintenance and do not require undivded attention from the staff. I am a newlywed, the room I stayed in with my husband was very very quaint (1 very small room, a bathroom). It had 2 twin beds...yes two twin! When we asked if we can have one single big bed the staff member shrugged his shoulders and simply said..."It wasn't required". When asked how to use the air conditioning, they told us that it wouldn't be available till May 15th...mind you we arrived May 1st. They weren't the most helpful staff in the world, but at the same time they weren't complete -----. In terms of location, I thought this is where we lucked out. It is directly on the canal, and if you get lucky and get a room with a view I'm sure your stay will be more pleasant. It was also in the vicinity of a whole bunch of affordable restaurants (Go to Pedrocchi's) and small shops. If you are planning to travel within Italy by train, the train station is directly across the hotel. Only thing is you have to haul your luggage over this huge foot bridge which isn't fun, but do-able. The main tourist attraction here is St. Marks square which from the hotel is an easy trip by vaporetto (water bus) for 5 euro or, if you have 80 euro to throw away, by water taxi. You will quickly see how expensive Venice is once you reach the St. Mark's area. You will quickly be thankful you spent your hard-earned dollars in a moderate hotel further from St. Mark's than closer, because the same money closer to the square will get you a room 1/2 the size of that in the Carlton. Whether you chose the Carlton or not, if you're budgeting, and you really should...I would suggest a hotel further away from St. Mark's, you will see the difference in price, surroundings and convenience.

Reviews.Title: “Where do they get 4 stars from?”
Reviews.Author: dassie
Reviews.Content: Absolutely the worst hotel we stayed in during a three week, three country business/holiday trip to Europe. The location is not bad. Lots happening in the area and convenient for the station. Beware if you're dragging a heavy suitcase as you will have carry it over a steep foot bridge. Rooms: Awful. Old fashioned, faded, dark and drab. Cheap blankets on the beds, why not duvets? 1 thin pillow per person. A view of what looked like the heating/air-conditioning equipment. Plastic shower curtains over the bath, why not sliding glass doors? Cheap plastic beakers for drinking water, why not real glass? Breakfast: Limited choice of cereals, limited choice of cold meats and cheeses, tinned 'fresh' fruit salad, stale breads. Self service tea and coffee from a machine. Pre-made scrambled eggs which looked disgusting. Staff rushing around far too busy to give a simple 'good morning', but not too busy to keep up non stop chattering to each other at the top of their voices. And to top it all to see one of the staff members sweep up spilled muesli with her hands and then put the muesli back into the top of the container is, too say the least, pretty unhygenic. Tourist info? City Map? Day tour brochures? Forget it! Go to the equally unhelpful staff at the information desk at the station. Internet access? Forget that too. Not available. Go to the nearest internet cafe. I suppose I should be happy that I at least got directions. This is not a 4 star hotel. The rooms, the breakfast, the facilities and, least of all, the staff are nowhere near 4 star standard. The hotel was recommended by a major tour operator who my partner has business dealings with, needless to say we will be giving them our negative feedback. Give this one a miss.

Reviews.Title: “Enjoyed this hotel”
Reviews.Author: kiwinz75
Reviews.Content: I thought this hotel was excellent, especially for the rates they charge. I am not sure what others were talking about because the breakfast was great, especially for a Eurpoean hotel. We had various breads and pastries, scambled egg, bacon as well as cereals, yougurt, fruits, sweets and juices and coffeee, tea etc. Our room was fine, clean and tidy and not a bad size. Bathroom was modernized with an excellent shower. Only bad point was that the double bed was actually two beds pushed together. Location for some could be its downside. It is about 20 minutes walk to the Rialto bridge and another 10 to St Marks Square. However for us this was not a problem - Venice is the perfect city for just wondering and getting lost down the little streets and alley ways. Being slightly futher from the main attractions also meant we were able to dine in less touristy (and expensive!) resturants. The Vaperetta and water taxi stops are right across from the hotel and the bus station, where you can get a EUR3 ride to the airport is literally 5 mins walk which is brilliant. The staff were helpful with restuarant and sightseeing info

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful Carlton”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: We just returned from our Italy trip, and stayed at the Grand Canal hotel for a few nights. The lobby was beautiful; very modern and golden. It seemed like a 5 star hotel from there! The actual rooms were very old and small, but charming. The furnishings were old style, and the bathroom clean. I loved the furniture, but there was an awful smell of oldness when we walked into our room. It soon faded away though! The double bed was made of two single beds pushed together but it was ok. It is an excellent location for nearby shops and restaurants, and the sightseeing. The boats/ferries are nearby to catch into the St Marco's Square.

Reviews.Title: “Good value”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: I liked this hotel. We stayed in the 3-star Capri part, but you enter through the 4-star Hotel Carlton (it's all really in together, just that you have to walk a bit further down the corridor for the Capri). The lobby is lovely, as is breakfast, and the location is directly opposite the station, good if you have plenty of luggage like we did. This is a fair distance from San Marco but on the bright side we got to discover Venice on foot and saw much more than if we had've stayed closer to San Marco. The ferry also goes from the station. Anyway, the room was quite adequate, warm, had cable tv and the bathroom was very big and new, probably among the best we had in Europe. Staff were helpful. The whole place had a nice feel about it and despite being apprehensive at first I would book this hotel again straight away if I went back to Venice.

Reviews.Title: “Disappointed”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: We stayed here in Jan 2005. We were booked in the smaller Carlton hotel (Capri Carlton) but after walking for an hour trying to find it, it was closed and we were directed to the Grand. They gave us a very small room, and told us the Capri was being painted. They insisted we had a great deal seeing as how we were staying at a 4 star hotel for the price of a 3 star hotel. The heating was kept to a low level, the decoration was worn and old, the doors are paper thin, no bath and 2 beds pushed together makes a bouble bed apparantly. When we complained about all this, they responded, it's a 4 star hotel, be pleased. No apologies for not telling us about the "painting" closure when i confirmed the booking 3 days before. Got a raw deal.

Reviews.Title: “Awesome Venice!”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: I must say first, I would have been happy sleeping on a bench (well, actually, there are no benches!) just to be in that magnificent city!!! The hotel was fine. Location was great. The reason I say this is because if we had been in St. Marks area we never would have the chance to ride back and forth on the vaporetto ( isn't the canal the reason you go to Venice in the first place?). Lot's of good restaurants in the area over the Scalzi bridge. The hotel staff were nice enough. My room had a view of the utility shack and some pretty interesting roofs. The breakfast however was not very good. Coffee lovers like my husband will be very disappointed. The pizza is excellent (had that just about every day). Shops around the Rialto bridge seemed to have the best prices. Word of advise from a travel agent, DO NOT DRIVE IN ITALY!!!!!! What can I say, there is no city like Venice anywhere on the face of the earth and who cares about the rest of it! Have fun and don't let those Italians push you around! Email me if you have any questions.

Reviews.Title: “Could be better”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: We stayed in Carlton hotel for two nights in Oct-04. The room was small but very clean. It was a bit noisy due to the air fans installed in the patio. The staff was not very helpful. We ask for a tour, they gave us the numbers and tols us to phone ourselves. The bar was very expensive. In general was ok but overpriced. I do not think I does deserve 4 stars.

Reviews.Title: “Beware - it's being renovated...”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: As honeymooners, we were first placed in what would have been the worst room in the hotel - it was tiny, dingy and the one window opened out on a brick wall. We complained and were given a bigger room - still with no views or balcony - but it was clean and well furnished. It is in a good location and easily found given its proximity to the train station (you can hop on a ferry when you inevitably get lost in Venice and go to the circumventia (station). Currently being renovated so there is a little extraneous noise from the drilling - but you're in Venice - so who cares???

HotelInfo.Name: Hotel Carlton on the Grand Canal
HotelInfo.Address: Santa Croce 578, 30135 Venice, Italy
